finding: The SNP rs1063192 located in the CDKN2B locus was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D). It showed a higher odds ratio of 1.19 in the top quartile of cardiovascular disease (CVD) topic weight compared to 1.08 in the bottom quartile, with a statistical significance of P=4×10^-5 for the difference.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: The rs62531463 variant also demonstrated PPR > 0.99 and had high PPRs for MAMBA-G (PPR = 0.638) and MAMBA-GT effects (PPR = 0.439). Situated in the KANK1 locus, this variant was associated with lipid measurements, further supporting its relevance in lipid metabolism.
title: Statistical Assessment of Biomarker Replicability using MAJAR Method

finding: The locus at 9p24.2 (rs10974438), linked to GLIS3, was identified as associated with mania and bipolar disorder, which had not been previously reported in depression studies within East Asian populations.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and schizophrenia in East Asians

finding: The SNP rs550057, located at the ABO locus, was associated with venous embolism with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.27 (p=5.28 × 10^-116). It was one of the most significant variants identified, contributing to a large number of phenotype associations.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs505922, also at the ABO locus, was linked to thrombosis with an OR of 1.31 (p=3.5 x 10^-183). This SNP similarly showed a significant association with several phenotypes related to COVID-19 severity.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: rs3793577 was previously associated with depressive symptoms, neuroticism, well-being, and major depressive disorder (MDD) with very strong p-values, indicating a robust link to these phenotypes.
title: Epigenome-wide association study of self-reported antidepressant use in Generation Scotland implicates the innate immune system

finding: The rs8176719-delG SNP, which was used to tag for the O1 blood group, showed an association with an increased risk of venous thromboembolism (VT) recurrence, with a Hazard Ratio (HR) of 1.18 in the combined sample of 2,752 patients.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: The rs41302905-T allele was associated with the O2 blood group and was part of the analysis which determined associations with VT recurrence, contributing to the overall findings of the study.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: The rs2519093-T SNP tagged for the A1 blood group and was observed in the study showing an increased risk of VT recurrence with an HR of 1.18, indicating a significant relation to the phenotype analyzed.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: The rs1053878-A SNP was analyzed for the A2 blood group and was included in the context of the study. Though significant results were not definitively stated, it contributed to the overall findings regarding VT recurrence.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: The rs8176743-T allele, used to identify the B blood group, was included in the analysis, reinforcing the study's examination of multiple ABO polymorphisms in relation to VT.
title: Modelling of time-to-events in an ambispective study: illustration with the analysis of ABO blood groups on venous thrombosis recurrence

finding: SNP rs10757182 was significantly associated with IFN-β levels in the context of LPS stimulation, reinforcing its role in the immune response, although it did not impact IL-12p70 production.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs10811473 exhibited significant association with IFN-β levels after LPS stimulation, supporting its involvement in modulating immune responses without affecting IL-12p70 secretion.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: SNP rs13291085 was significantly associated with levels of IFN-β in response to LPS, emphasizing its potential role in immune regulation, distinct from IL-12p70.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs7020908 showed significant association with IFN-β levels following LPS stimulation, further illustrating its participation in immune responses; however, it did not influence IL-12p70 production.
title: Early IFNβ secretion determines variable downstream IL-12p70 responses upon TLR4 activation in health and disease

finding: The SNP rs11244061, located in the ABO gene, showed a significant association with COVID-19 hospitalization, with a P-meta value of 3.64×10−28, and was also implicated in VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs550057 was identified near the ABO gene, showing a remarkable association with SARS-CoV-2 infection, with a P-meta of 1.56×10−51, and it was also involved in the shared genetics of VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs138683771 co-localized with other genetic loci in the ABO gene and was linked to severe COVID-19 and VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs149181677, located in the ADAMTS13 gene, was found at loci co-localized with both VTE and COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs8176686 was associated with COVID-19 hospitalization and showed co-localization with VTE in the ABO gene.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs9411367 was found to be colocalized with VTE and SARS-CoV-2 infection in the ABO gene.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs71503180 also localized in the ABO gene, showing an association with SARS-CoV-2 infection and implications for VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs1537373, located in the 9p21 locus, was confirmed to affect the gene CDKN2B. This finding provided evidence for a regulatory variant influencing coronary artery calcification (CAC), and was supported by epigenomic analyses linking it to activity in human coronary artery smooth muscle cells (HCASMC) and coronary arteries. This association highlighted the potential regulatory mechanisms for CAC as part of the broader genetic architecture underlying this condition.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies effector genes and druggable pathways for coronary artery calcification

finding: The SNP rs746100 was genome-wide significantly associated with lumbar spine, femur neck, total femur, pelvis, and trunk BMD traits, linked to the ABCA1 gene, with the smallest P-value noted at 1.64×10^-9.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs1039406, in conjunction with rs746100, was highlighted at the locus between ABCA1 and SLC44A1, being genome-wide significant for five BMD sites, enhancing the genetic understanding of bone density.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs1831554 was noted to have marginal significance for femur neck and lumbar spine, emphasizing its role in osteoporosis-related traits.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: This variant involved with <italic>SLC35D2</italic> highlighted impacts on PSA measures.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs141610415 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant disease-associated locus located within the MPDZ gene on chromosome 9p23, with a minor allele frequency of 0.002 and a P-value of 3.68 × 10^-9.
title: Extended genome-wide association study employing the African Genome Resources Panel identifies novel susceptibility loci for Alzheimer’s Disease in individuals of African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs35767802 was identified as one of the most prevalent variants among severely ill ME/CFS patients, showing an allele frequency of greater than 12% in the AFC population. In the study, it was present in at least one allele in 45% of the severely affected patients (9 out of 20). This SNP is located within the ADAMTSL2 gene, which is associated with Type VIIC Ehlers–Danlos syndrome (EDS), a condition that shares a potential comorbidity with ME/CFS. Joint hypermobility, a characteristic of EDS, was frequently observed in ME/CFS patients, pointing to a possible link between these conditions.
title: A Network Medicine Approach to Investigating ME/CFS Pathogenesis in Severely Ill Patients: A Pilot Study

finding: For the TMEM245 locus, rs6477694 was identified as a significant BMI variant, linking it to genetic mechanisms underlying obesity through specific SNP-transcript-BMI associations.
title: Integrating Genetic and Transcriptomic Data to Identify Genes Underlying Obesity Risk Loci

finding: The SNP rs687621 was significantly associated with elevated levels of von Willebrand factor (VWF) in the plasma, with a p-value of 9.58×10^-20. This finding confirmed the role of the ABO blood group locus in COVID-19 severity, suggesting that increased VWF levels, linked to genetic risk variants, may be a key mediator of inflammation and endothelial dysfunction in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: A functional genomics approach to understand host genetic regulation of COVID-19 severity

finding: mapped to RABEPK, contributing to the genetic understanding of addiction risks.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: associated with DBH and provided additional insight into dopamine-related mechanisms influencing addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs7026388 was indicated within an exon of PTPRD, suggesting it disrupts protein function. This finding was significant given its link to dendritic spine formation, crucial in ASD.
title: Structural Variants Are a Major Component of the Missing Heritability of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: Among variants, rs73493041 related to DBP showed evidence of STST interaction (P_GxE=2.0×10^-4), corroborating findings from previous studies.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: SNP rs2275543 in the ABCA1 gene was statistically significant in association with IR. The log-additive model suggested that the risk allele C was associated with an OR of 3.50 (95% CI: 1.17-10.42; P=0.011), indicating ABCA1's potential role in increasing susceptibility to metabolic disorders including type 2 diabetes.
title: Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Individuals: Investigating the Role of Genetic Polymorphisms in RNF138, ABCA1, and ESRRG-GPATCH2 Genes - A Case-Control Study in the Indian Population

finding: The SNP rs1536076 located at SH3GL2 was identified as one of the top 20 SNPs associated with 'fast' progression in PD, indicating that its non-reference allele increased the risk of faster progression.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs657152 was identified to tag the O blood group alleles. It was associated with lower estradiol levels, suggesting individuals with non-O blood groups had lower estradiol levels compared to those with the O blood group.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The SNP rs8176719 was closely related to rs657152 (in linkage disequilibrium) and was significant for tagging the O blood group, thereby also demonstrating a relationship with estradiol levels, similar to rs657152.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: This SNP was linked to COVID-19 hospitalization, showing a strong association at locus 9q34.2 in the ABO gene with Pmeta=3.64×10^-28. It was also noted in relation to VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP demonstrated a strong association with SARS-CoV-2 infection at locus 9q34.2, specifically in the ABO gene, with a Pmeta of 1.56×10^-51, and was co-localized with VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP co-localized with severe COVID-19 and VTE in the ABO gene, indicating a shared genetic basis.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was found in relation to both VTE and deepening understanding of COVID-19 biology, localized in the ADAMTS13 gene.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was co-localized with VTE and COVID-19 hospitalization in the ABO gene, contributing to insights on shared genetic risk.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was associated with VTE and was detected in the ABO gene alongside SARS-CoV-2 infection markers.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was identified within the context of VTE and SARS-CoV-2 infection, being part of the genetic architecture in the ABO gene.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs11559048 SNP was associated with a missense variant (c.622C>T) in the SIGMAR1 gene, resulting in the substitution of Arginine to Tryptophan (p.R208W) at position 208. This variant was identified in a young-onset sporadic ALS patient of Indian origin and was predicted to be damaging by various pathogenicity prediction tools. Its Minor Allele Frequency (MAF) was found to be 0.007 globally and 0.019 in South Asian populations, indicating its relative rarity. The variant's significance in ALS was underscored by the high CADD score (>30), suggesting a strong potential impact on the protein's function.
title: Genetic analysis of Indian sporadic young onset patient with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis

finding: As a shared locus between hypothyroidism and TSH levels, rs9298749 was implicated in thyroid function.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: Associated with blood group O and variations in several protein expressions (including decreases in VWF and F8). It had a strong association with blood donorship noted (p < 5 x 10^-8).
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: This variant showed significant association at a Bonferroni level for prostate volume, indicating its relevance in prostate health and disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The SNP <italic>rs9411476</italic> related to the <italic>ABO</italic> gene indicated a negative association with alkaline phosphatase, presenting a trans-ancestry beta of -0.088. In African populations, the association was even stronger (beta=-0.228) with a heterogeneity p-value of 5×10<sup>-24</sup>.
title: Inter-population differences of allele frequency and regulome tagging are associated with the heterogeneity of loci identified by cross-ancestry genome-wide association studies

finding: rs507666 was identified as one of the two common SNPs in the ABO gene that were robustly associated with ischemic stroke, previously documented in literature.
title: Exome Array Analysis of 9,721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium

finding: Like rs507666, rs635634 was identified as a common SNP in the ABO gene associated with ischemic stroke, also previously established in earlier research.
title: Exome Array Analysis of 9,721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium

finding: Variant rs142792732 located in DDX31 showed a significant association with ischemic stroke at p < 1 × 10−10, with similar demographic observations as other rare variants.
title: Exome Array Analysis of 9,721 ischemic stroke cases from the SiGN Consortium

finding: The rs687621 variant in the ABO gene was linked to 63 unique protein level alterations and exhibited a positive association with blood group O antigens, while negatively relating to blood group AB, thus contributing to blood donor profiles.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: In the ABO gene region, rs687621 had a documented association with neonatal jaundice, with an OR of 0.46 (p-value = 1.4 × 10<sup>-12</sup>), highlighting its role related to maternal-fetal blood group incompatibility.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: The SNP rs10759927 was identified as significant in classical GWAS for hypothyroidism, indicating its role in the disease despite being a non-coding variant affecting PTCSC2.
title: The Etiology of Hypothyroidism Is Revealed by Alternative Genetics Association Study Methodologies

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with hypothyroidism within the context of classical GWAS, demonstrating its potential link to the condition.
title: The Etiology of Hypothyroidism Is Revealed by Alternative Genetics Association Study Methodologies

finding: Like the other two GWAS-referenced SNPs, rs7030280 was significantly associated with hypothyroidism, reinforcing the genetic basis of the disorder through non-coding variants.
title: The Etiology of Hypothyroidism Is Revealed by Alternative Genetics Association Study Methodologies

finding: The SNP rs1571536, located in the SEMA4D-GADD45G locus, was identified as a significant locus in the study, with associations noted for increased habitual coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The variant rs7034200, located in the GLIS3 gene, exhibited significant discordant maternal and fetal effects. It was highly significant (p-value = 1.15 × 10^-12) in the two degree of freedom test, while showing only modest non-significant p-values in the maternal and fetal meta-analyses. This finding suggested that the A allele was associated with increased birth weight when present in the maternal genome but decreased birth weight when present in the fetal genome.
title: Direct and INdirect effects analysis of Genetic lOci (DINGO): A software package to increase the power of locus discovery in GWAS meta-analyses of perinatal phenotypes and traits influenced by indirect genetic effects

finding: Notably, rs855549 on chromosome 9 demonstrated a significant association with ITR, indicated by a p-value of 3.42x10^-6. Its biological relevance was further illustrated by its proximity to the ANKRD18B gene, which is critical for protein signaling pathways.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: The SNP rs2243898, also on chromosome 9, displayed significant correlation with ITR, evidenced by a p-value of 4.50x10^-6. This variant is linked to the LRSAM1 gene, which is integral in protein interactions, reinforcing the association between genetic variations and treatment outcomes.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: This SNP was highlighted as the lead variant at the ABO locus, showing significant association with VTE, thus characterized as both positive and original.
title: Cross-Ancestry Investigation of Venous Thromboembolism Genomic Predictors

finding: The SNP rs9298897, located in the intronic region of the LINGO2 gene, was identified as part of a novel genetic interaction with the 2q14.1 variant (rs17710829). This interaction was important in understanding disease progression in the context of the Parkinson's Progression Markers Initiative (PPMI) and LABS-PD cohorts.
title: Elucidating Molecular Networks Underpinning Heterogeneity in Parkinson’s Disease Progression Across Clinical Manifestation Spectrum

finding: The SNP rs2517 was associated with increased asthma susceptibility, asthma severity, and longitudinal asthma exacerbations. It was highlighted in multiple studies which demonstrated its risk alleles linked to these asthma-related conditions.
title: PGAP3 regulates human bronchial epithelial cell mRNAs present in asthma and respiratory virus reference data sets

finding: This SNP was found to have the highest population attributable DALYs, with minor allele carriers associated with 447 yearly population DALYs per 100,000 in the Finnish population, primarily linked to ischemic heart disease, which had a HR of 1.17 and a very high significance (P=4.1×10^-231).
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The variant rs1537371 was associated with ischemic heart disease risk as well, contributing to overall DALY calculations within the genetic analysis framework, but specific DALY figures were not detailed in this context.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The lead sQTL SNP rs1537712 was found to colocalize with ALS risk and was associated with the splicing of intron J1 in the C9orf72 gene. This relationship suggested that the splicing effect was likely driven by the hexanucleotide repeat expansion.
title: Integrative genetic analysis of the amyotrophic lateral sclerosis spinal cord implicates glial activation and suggests new risk genes

finding: The T allele of rs2282192 was associated with increased TSH, increased hypothyroidism risk, and decreased risk of nontoxic multinodular goitre and thyroid cancer.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The rs62575331 variant showed a significant association with symptom remission in the placebo group with a P-value of 2.95 × 10⁻⁸. The G allele was associated with symptom remission, indicated by a hazard ratio of 1.57 (95% CI 1.34-1.84). By day 15, 46%, 62%, and 64% of those with CC, CG, and GG genotypes respectively achieved symptom remission. In accelerated failure time analysis, the G allele yielded an acceleration factor of 0.71 compared to the C allele.
title: Genetics of symptom remission in outpatients with COVID-19

finding: This SNP was one of three causal variants found in the CDKN2B-AS1 region, shared among 7 trait pairs that relate to AAA and other cardiovascular diseases.
title: Shared Genetic Susceptibility between Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm and Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The SNP rs616154 was identified in the context of analyzing the causal relationship between cardioembolic stroke (CES) and SARS-CoV-2 infection. The analysis indicated that this SNP was invalid as an instrumental variable because its ratio estimate of the causal effect (0.525) was significantly different from those of other SNPs, indicating it did not receive support from other relevant SNPs. Further investigations revealed that rs616154 was associated with Interleukin-6 (IL-6) levels, suggesting potential horizontal pleiotropy, which might confound the relationship being studied. After excluding this SNP, the causal effect estimate by the MR-SPI method approached zero, implying that cardioembolic stroke may not be a risk factor for SARS-CoV-2 infection. In contrast, other methods that included rs616154 yielded biased estimates.
title: Selecting Valid Genetic Instruments and Constructing Robust Confidence Intervals for Two-sample Mendelian Randomization Using Genome-wide Summary Statistics

finding: The SNP rs600075 was noted as significant with a potential relevance to Kawasaki disease through its linkage to intronic SNPs in PTPRD, indicating a notable genetic risk factor.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: This variant was associated with activating PIK3CA mutations in the discovery analysis and was the top variant related to PIK3CA activation in the MyBrCA study.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: Showed significant association with PIK3CA H1047R/L mutations in both the discovery set and multi-ancestry validation study.
title: Association of ESR1 germline variants with TP53 somatic variants in breast tumors in a genome-wide study

finding: The SNP rs9695393 was identified as tagging an ASD-SV that overlaps with a NUP98-HOXA9 binding site. This finding was significant as it was adjacent to the microRNA mir-873, which is known to reduce the expression of ASD risk genes such as ARID1B, SHANK3, and NRXN2. Therefore, this SNP was suggested to be involved in the regulatory disruptions related to autism.
title: Maintenance of Heterochromatin links Chromatin Modifiers and Neurodevelopment in Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The rs143745791 variant in NCBP1 was identified in the breast cancer-specific analysis, showing a high association with double diagnoses of breast and cervical cancer, with an odds ratio of 5.95 and a p-value of 3.76×10^-6.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The rs7872034 variant in SMC2 was associated with increased risk of breast cancer, showing an odds ratio of 1.16 when compared to individuals with no cancer, contributing to the understanding of shared genetic mechanisms.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: The strongest association in CTEPH was identified for SNP rs687289 located in the ABO gene, which determines the ABO blood group. This SNP was associated with a higher risk of CTEPH, particularly in patients with non-O blood groups, and had established links to DVT.
title: CTEPH has shared and distinct genetic associations with pulmonary embolism in a genome-wide association study

finding: The rs9411378 SNP associated with the ABO gene and located on chromosome 9 demonstrated a significant link to SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility in the European population (P = 2.436 × 10-11). This association remained significant after controlling for other comorbid conditions, suggesting a direct involvement of this locus in susceptibility to COVID-19.
title: Genetic risk factors associated with SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility in multiethnic populations

finding: The variant rs17696570, found in C9orf72, showed significant association with clusters C0 and C1, highlighting its potential impact in the context of neurodegenerative disease genetics.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The rs505922 SNP correlated with ABO gene expression and plasma protein levels, suggesting a causal relationship with both susceptibility to COVID-19 and severe COVID-19. The protein-increasing allele was noted to also be a risk variant for venous thromboembolism (VTE), a condition that has been observed in critically ill COVID-19 patients.
title: Multi-omics highlights ABO plasma protein as a causal risk factor for COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs199690076 was identified as likely pathogenic in a case of biallelic SLC34A3-associated urinary stone disease (USD). This variant was part of a genetic diagnosis related to hereditary hypophosphataemic rickets with hypercalciuria. As such, this finding contributed to understanding the genetic risk factors for USD.
title: Rare variants in SLC34A3 explain missing heritability of urinary stone disease

finding: The SNP rs11507683 was determined to be a novel locus for anxiety and is within the exonic region of the EXD3 gene, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk variants for anxiety.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs7858 was identified as a shared locus between anxiety and schizophrenia, indicating overlapping genetic risk factors.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The intronic variant rs507666 (G>A) in the ABO blood group gene acted as a trans-pQTL for VEGF-R3 levels, reaffirming its association seen in previous analyses, with a P-value less than 9.1e-12.
title: Common variation in a long non-coding RNA gene modulates variation of circulating TGF-β2 levels in metastatic colorectal cancer patients (Alliance)

finding: The SNP rs1053878 was associated with protein levels of the Histo-Blood Group ABO System Transferase (ABO), indicating its role in increasing risks of pregnancy-related venous complications and haemorrhoids, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.207 (95% CI: 1.107-1.316). This finding was validated by strong evidence of colocalization (91.3%) with the outcomes.
title: The effect of protein levels of ABO on pregnancy related outcomes: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs10965215, located in the CDKN2B-AS1 gene, was noted as the most statistically significant exonic SNP with P<sub>MTAG_HF</sub> = 2.87×10<sup>-58</sup>, indicating it was a positive original finding.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs564398, associated with the CDKN2B-AS1 gene, was recognized as the most significant exonic SNP in non-coding RNA with P<sub>MTAG_HF</sub> = 1.95×10<sup>-54</sup>, marking it as a positive original finding.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP was previously associated with protective effects of blood group O for earlier variants of SARS-CoV-2 but showed no significant association in the current study.
title: Central role of glycosylation processes in human genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infections with Omicron variants

finding: Identified as the lead SNP tagging blood group B, which indicated a protective effect against Omicron infection, differing from prior associations.
title: Central role of glycosylation processes in human genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infections with Omicron variants

finding: In the FOXE1 gene, the rs965513 SNP was associated with a protective effect against thyroid disorders, as indicated by a lower risk allele frequency (RAF) of 0.03125 in cases compared to 0.0556 in controls. The odds ratio (OR) was found to be 0.548, suggesting a decreased likelihood of developing hypothyroidism. The study linked this SNP with an increased risk of autoimmune thyroid diseases and papillary thyroid cancer in other populations.
title: SNP Genes Effect on Thyroid Disorders in a Chinese Demographic

finding: The SNP rs10965215 was the most statistically significant exonic SNP (P MTAG HF = 2.87×10^-58) mapped to the CDKN2B-AS1 gene and was associated with heart failure.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs564398 was the most significant non-coding exonic SNP (P MTAG HF = 1.95×10^-54), also mapped to the CDKN2B-AS1 gene and associated with heart failure.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: Identified in the DBH gene on chromosome 9, this SNP had a p-value of 2.55E-16 and significantly related to smoking behaviors, as it encodes an enzyme crucial in dopamine norepinephrine conversion.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: Also located in the DBH gene on chromosome 9, this SNP had a p-value of 8.74E-12, underscoring its relevance in smoking behavior through modulation of dopamine transmission.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The missense variant in DBH was associated with lower vanillylmandelate levels, indicating its metabolic importance.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This NR5A1 variant was linked to pregnenediol sulfate, indicating its role in steroidogenesis.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: This PTRH1 variant was associated with N-formylmethionine, underlining its role in mitochondrial peptide processing.
title: Genome-wide association study of 1,391 plasma metabolites in 6,136 Finnish men identifies 303 novel signals and provides biological insights into human diseases

finding: rs144210190 was linked to the CNTN1 gene, associated with dementia with Lewy bodies, thereby implying its role in nervous system development and possibly contributing to PD.
title: Machine learning identifies six genetic variants and alterations in the Heart Atrial Appendage as key contributors to PD risk predictivity

finding: The SNP rs75260654 was identified as significantly associated with early-onset persistent wheeze with a p-value of less than 6.7×10^-9. It was shown to reduce expression of the nearby gene ANXA1 in naive B-cells. Moreover, in murine models, ANXA1 expression increased in response to allergen exposure, indicating a role in regulating pulmonary immune responses.
title: A meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies of childhood wheezing phenotypes identifies ANXA1 as a susceptibility locus for persistent wheezing

finding: SNP rs10974438, associated with the GLIS3 gene, linked to diabetes risk, was identified with a meta-analysis p-value of 4.0 x 10^-14, but not robustly replicated in UK Biobank data (p-value=0.001), emphasizing the role of fasting status in the observed associations.
title: Genome-wide characterization of circulating metabolic biomarkers reveals substantial pleiotropy and novel disease pathways

finding: The SNP rs12376738 was identified in relation to resistance against depression and anxiety-like symptoms. It was found to be positioned within genic regions and showed prior evidence of involvement in generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) and memory consolidation.
title: Comorbid-phenome prediction and phenotype risk scores enhance gene discovery for generalized anxiety disorder and posttraumatic stress disorder

finding: This non-coding transcript exon variant was noted in the CEA GWAS, indicating its significant impact on cancer marker associations.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The SNP rs919642 demonstrated a significant association with knee pain, with a primary GWAS p-value of 1.25 × 10^-17 and was replicated with a p-value of 1.17 × 10^-3. This SNP is located near the COL27A1 gene, which is critical for cartilage structure and integrity, implicating its potential influence on knee pain and osteoarthritis.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Found to be significantly associated with knee pain, rs3892354 had a primary GWAS p-value of 1.29 × 10^-8 and was successfully replicated with a p-value of 3.25 × 10^-3. This SNP relates to multiple conditions and highlighted its involvement in male-specific factors, further implicating it in osteoarthritis.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: This male-specific SNP rs891720 had a significant association with knee pain in the male GWAS, indicated by a p-value of 5.55 × 10^-11, linking it to COL27A1, which is critical for cartilage function.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs149411423 was identified as a high-risk variant that disrupts a glucocorticoid response element regulating the GCNT1 gene, which is associated with IgE levels and pulmonary immune response, thereby illustrating its relevance to asthma risk.
title: Glucocorticoid-regulated bidirectional enhancer RNA transcription pinpoints functional genetic variants linked to asthma

finding: The SNP rs746100 was part of a novel locus between the genes ABCA1 and SLC44A1 on chromosome 9. It was significantly associated with five BMD traits, including lumbar spine and femur neck, with a notable P-value of 1.64×10^-9.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs1039406 was located near the ABCA1 gene and showed association with multiple BMD sites, particularly overlapping with rs746100, enhancing the evidence of the novel locus.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs138702233 was associated with MBzP, demonstrating an effect size of 0.394 and a p-value of 4.29E-08, related to the RAPGEF1 gene.
title: Common genetic variants associated with urinary phthalate levels in children: a genome-wide study

finding: The SNP rs4744112 affected the proportion of CCR6+CXCR3+CCR4-T helper 1 cells in T1D, with the minor allele G resulting in a decreased proportion compared to the major allele T, indicating its importance in T1D pathophysiology.
title: Genetic and environmental effects on the immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: The variant rs10967273 was associated with MS severity in females through the l-MSSS analysis (β_female = 0.8289, p=3.52×10-08) but did not reach significance in the l-ARMSS analysis.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The rs295254 SNP was identified as predictive of reaching irreversible EDSS milestones, with an adjusted hazard ratio (aHR) of 1.33 (p=9.10×10-4) for irEDSS3 and 1.32 (p=7.37×10-4) for irEDSS6, indicating that the presence of the minor allele decreased the time to these disability milestones.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The SNP rs534551495 showed a significant association with AAO of CI in the Amish cohort, leading to a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.82, indicating that the allele was associated with delayed onset of cognitive impairment.
title: Genetic variants in the SHISA6 gene are associated with delayed cognitive impairment in two family datasets

finding: The SNP rs6474550 in the DMRT2 gene showed significant association with ASATadjBMI (P = 1.3 x 10^-9). This gene had higher expression in ASAT compared to GFAT in previous studies evaluating fat depot-specific transcriptome signatures.
title: Inherited basis of visceral, abdominal subcutaneous and gluteofemoral fat depots

finding: The variant rs10156602 was related to fractional anisotropy of the body of the corpus callosum, showing genetic correlations with insomnia.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Genetic data revealed the role of this variant in the impact of sleep on brain conditions.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: Identified as one of the significant loci, associated with cognitive traits and included in the set of previously reported SNPs related to educational attainment.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The SNP rs56175925 on chromosome 9 demonstrated significant association with a p-value of 1.83×10−08. This SNP contributes to the genetic understanding of alcohol traits, particularly in the AFR population.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs1571536, located in the SEMA4D-GADD45G locus, was identified as a novel genetic locus associated with habitual coffee consumption in a genome-wide meta-analysis (GWMA). This finding was significant in previous studies and contributed to understanding genetic factors influencing coffee intake.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The SNP rs17180299 was identified as being associated with plasma concentrations of methadone R- and S-enantiomers in the context of a genome-wide pharmacogenomic study focused on methadone maintenance treatment for heroin-dependent patients. This finding highlighted the relevance of genetic variations in influencing drug response, particularly in opioid addiction treatment.
title: AI-Enhanced Integration of Genetic and Medical Imaging Data for Risk Assessment of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: SNP rs864882 displayed a p-value of 1.24×10⁻⁹ in the OUD-MTAG context, suggesting a significant association with RABEPK and potential implications for OUD pathology.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs4237150 was predicted to be the likely causal SNP for a T2D signal, exhibiting a high posterior probability of association (PPA=0.96). The C allele increased the enhancer probability, disrupted binding motifs for NR3C1 and ZNF528, and was linked to increased allele-specific imbalance in islet data, enhancing luciferase activity in MIN6 beta cells.
title: Modeling islet enhancers using deep learning identifies candidate causal variants at loci associated with T2D and glycemic traits

finding: This SNP was associated with tamoxifen response in acute myeloid leukemia (AML), showing an exome-wide significant level association (p=3.68 x 10^-7). The variant is a missense variant in the CCIN gene, which encodes a cytoskeleton protein important for maintaining nuclear structure, suggesting its role in influencing drug response through cytoskeletal dynamics in epithelial to mesenchymal transition (EMT).
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukemia patients

finding: The strongest association in CTEPH was found with SNP rs687289 in the <italic>ABO</italic> gene, which determines blood group type. This association paralleled findings in DVT, with evidence suggesting that individuals with non-O blood groups are at a higher risk for developing CTEPH.
title: CTEPH has shared and distinct genetic associations with pulmonary embolism in a genome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs8176719-TC showed the strongest association with higher plasma concentrations of soluble CD209 in three separate proteomic datasets, with extremely significant p-values (p = 6.03 × 10<sup>−258</sup>, p = 1.00 × 10<sup>−307</sup>, and p = 1.27 × 10<sup>−75</sup>), implying a strong connection to COVID-19 risk.
title: A proteome-wide genetic investigation identifies several SARS-CoV-2-exploited host targets of clinical relevance

finding: This SNP was previously associated with atopic dermatitis in European populations and was noted for being close to the genome-wide significance threshold in the European-only analysis of the current study.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: Identified as a significant contributor to PSA level variation, thus relevant to prostate cancer studies.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs10811656 was identified as the lead single nucleotide variant near the <italic>CDKN2B-AS1</italic> locus, which showed a significant association with coronary artery disease (CAD) in the analysis, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14 and a P-value of 6.48×10⁻⁷. This association was consistent with prior studies linking <italic>CDKN2B-AS1</italic> to CAD.
title: Common and Rare Variants Associated with Cardiometabolic Traits across 98,622 Whole-Genome Sequences in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The SNP rs1053878 was associated with the protein level of Histo-Blood Group ABO System Transferase (ABO) at a genome-wide significant level (P < 5x10-8). It was part of the discovery cohort from deCODE, and its individual instrument strength was confirmed to be strong.
title: The effect of protein levels of ABO on pregnancy related outcomes: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs687621, which was merged with rs950529388 in analyses, showed a strong correlation with the leading SNP for venous complications (LD r2 > 0.8), suggesting a potential causal relationship with pregnancy-induced venous complications and haemorrhoids, validated by a high colocalization probability (91.3%).
title: The effect of protein levels of ABO on pregnancy related outcomes: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs944801 showed significant association with normal tension glaucoma (NTG) and POAG, with an OR of 1.26. It was linked with eQTLs affecting CDKN2A and CDKN2B, suggesting a mechanism where altered expression of these genes potentially increased POAG risk.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP was identified as one of the strongest associations in the European GWAS for POAG, with an OR of 1.3, implicating changes in the expression of nearby genes as a mechanism for increased disease risk.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: Linked to hospitalization and critical illness in COVID-19 patients, also exhibiting significant differences in effect sizes by sex.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: This intergenic SNP was identified in the meta-analysis and associated with COVID-19 hospitalization.
title: A genome-wide association study of COVID-19 related hospitalization in Spain reveals genetic disparities among sexes

finding: The rs600038/SURF1 variant was also confirmed in association with HF, in agreement with the prior reports from the HERMES and MVP studies.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: It was associated with polyvascular coronary artery disease (PRP-5). This SNP was part of a group linked to an odds ratio (OR) of 5.2 (p = 0.007) for complex coronary artery disease in patients with type 2 diabetes.
title: Complexity of Coronary Disease and a Genetic Risk Profile in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes in Colombia

finding: The rs505922 variant, located in the ABO locus, demonstrated dominance effects on plasma levels of proteins CD209 and CLEC4M, according to analyses conducted on a cohort from the UK Biobank (n=51,214 for CD209, n=44,040 for CLEC4M). This finding was replicated in the FinnGen project, reaffirming its impact on these proteins.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: Similar to rs505922, the rs8176719 variant from the ABO locus exhibited dominance effects influencing plasma levels of CD209 and CLEC4M. Results from the UK Biobank validated these effects and were confirmed in the FinnGen analysis.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: This variant in the ABO locus revealed an epistatic interaction with the FUT2 locus variant rs2307019, significantly affecting the plasma levels of proteins ALPI, MUC2, and FAM3D. The interaction was highlighted in the UK Biobank findings and replicated in the FinnGen cohort.
title: Non-linear genetic regulation of the blood plasma proteome

finding: The lead SNP rs77641763 was found in intron 15 of the Exonuclease 3'-5' Domain Containing 3 (EXD3) gene on chromosome 9. It was significantly associated with the anxiety symptom group, with a P-value of 4.08×10-10, and linked to various anxiety, phobic, and dissociative disorders, highlighting its relevance to mental health conditions.
title: Environmental profiles of urban living relate to regional brain volumes and symptom groups of mental illness through distinct genetic pathways

finding: The lead SNP rs77786116 was located in the Intraflagellar Transport 74 (IFT74) gene on chromosome 9, showing significant association with the emotional instability symptom group (P=4.16×10-10). IFT74 is critical for neuronal migration and has associations with paranoid schizophrenia, underscoring its potential implications in mental illness.
title: Environmental profiles of urban living relate to regional brain volumes and symptom groups of mental illness through distinct genetic pathways

finding: The SNP rs13287767 was significantly associated with phecode 418.1 ‘Precordial pain’ with a p-value <2.36×10−8 and an odds ratio of 2.58. This variant is located within an intron of the NCS1 gene, known for its role in calcium-mediated signaling in the heart.
title: Systematic comparison of phenome-wide admixture mapping and genome-wide association in a diverse biobank

finding: SNP rs17474001 at 9q34.2 demonstrated a significant association with breast cancer and COVID-19 phenotypes, with a p-value of 2.48×10^-26.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs9411395 located at 9q34.2 was similarly associated with breast cancer and exhibited a significant p-value of 4.71×10^-26.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs554833 at 9q34.2 showed exceptional significance with a p-value of 1.28×10^-88, indicating its strong association with epithelial ovarian cancer.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The SNP rs657152 also at 9q34.2 displayed a significant association with epithelial ovarian cancer, with a p-value of 6.25×10^-25.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs56343119 at 9q34.2 was identified to correlate significantly with epithelial ovarian cancer, holding a p-value of 1.28×10^-22.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs12216896 was identified as a candidate causal SNP for breast cancer in connection with COVID-19 infection.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: SNP rs550057 was confirmed as a replicated pleiotropic SNP linked to COVID-19 severity and endometrial cancer.
title: Are female-specific cancers long-term sequelae of COVID-19? Evidence from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The finding was significant as it related to myeloproliferative disease, where the association was known to be entirely due to this single missense somatic mutation.
title: A power-based sliding window approach to evaluate the clinical impact of rare genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs919642 showed a significant association with knee pain as well, located in the COL27A1 gene on chromosome 9 with a p-value of 1.25 × 10^-17. This indicated a potential impact on collagen fibril formation and structural integrity of cartilage, contributing to knee pain and OA.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Known for its role in knee pain association, the SNP rs3892354 exhibited a p-value of 1.29 × 10^-8 associated with the GLIS3 gene. It was linked to cellular transcriptional regulation critical for cartilage health.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: Identified in the male GWAS, the SNP rs891720 had a p-value of 5.55 × 10^-11, reinforcing the idea of sex-specific contributions to knee pain.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The SNP rs1011970 was associated with both coronary artery disease (CAD) and breast cancer. It showed an inverse relationship, indicating that a high genetic burden for CAD correlated with a lower incidence of breast cancer among participants. Specifically, rs1011970 had a beta of -0.0407 (p=6.94×10^-10) for CAD and a beta of 0.053 (p=3.1×10^-5) for breast cancer. The finding suggested that genetic mechanisms predisposed to CAD could exhibit protective effects against breast cancer, potentially due to the gene CDKN2B-AS1's role in silencing genes epigenetically, impacting both CAD risk and breast cancer progression.
title: Inference of causal relationships based on the genetics of cardiometabolic traits and conditions unique to females in >50,000 participants

finding: Variant rs1576900 within ADAMTSL1 was significantly associated with increased T1 time (P = 3.63×10−11), suggesting that this ADAMTS-like protein plays a role in extracellular matrix turnover affecting myocardial interstitial fibrosis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: The SNP rs58774558 near KANK1 became borderline significant (P = 7.16×10−8) in sensitivity analysis of IVS GWAS, indicating a role in myocardial fibrosis despite lacking overt association in the main analysis.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: In the provided study, intronic rs1923778 located on chromosome 9 within the NFIB gene showed a suggestive association with symptom severity among clozapine-treated patients, with a p-value of 3.78×10^{-7}. Although it did not meet significance thresholds for genome-wide association, it was noted that dose-adjusted clozapine level differences were not detected between genotype groups at this locus, suggesting that the observed association was not merely due to variations in medication dosage.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of symptom severity among clozapine-treated patients with schizophrenia spectrum disorder

finding: The SNP rs4742565, also on chromosome 9 within the PTPRD gene, was the most significantly associated locus for the binary outcome in the study, reporting a p-value of 1.64×10^{-6}. This suggests an association between this locus and symptom severity, aligning with previous findings linking PTPRD to various brain phenotypes and disorders.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of symptom severity among clozapine-treated patients with schizophrenia spectrum disorder

finding: This locus in COL27A1 differentiated Tibetan HAPC patients in terms of protein functionality and stability assessment.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: In both Tibetan and Han Chinese groups, this variant in LINC01507 was significantly associated with HAPC susceptibility, marking a common risk feature.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: RS1030005 in LPAR1 was related to lower blood parameters in Han Chinese, suggesting its role in HAPC susceptibility profiles.
title: Differences in pathogenetic mechanism between Tibetan and Han high-altitude polycythemia based on a whole genome-wide association study

finding: The lead variant rs1537373 was found to be significantly associated with intracranial aneurysm (IA), with a 52.3% frequency of the G allele, an odds ratio (OR) of 1.20 (95% CI: 1.19-1.21), and a p-value of 8.7×10⁻⁴⁶. This SNP is located within CDKN2B-AS1, which encodes for the long non-coding RNA ANRIL, linked to various cardiovascular and neoplastic disease states.
title: Dissecting the Genetic Architecture of Intracranial Aneurysms

finding: The SNP rs2231231 from the AQP3 gene was found to be associated with preeclampsia (PE) and the development of hypertension in women 2–16 years post-pregnancy. It was also linked to a greater risk of cardiovascular disease (CVD) in women with a history of PE, showing different genotype distributions across four varying groups of women.
title: Genomic variation associated with cardiovascular disease progression following preeclampsia: A systematic review

finding: The SNP rs7035976 was identified at the 9q33.3 locus and was associated with cleft hard palate (CHP), achieving genome-wide significance (p=4.24×10<sup>-8</sup>). This locus spanned the genes RALGPS1 and ANGPTL2, highlighting its relevance in craniofacial development.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: The SNP rs2417050 was part of the credible set at the 9q33.3 locus for which there was 100% confidence of association with cleft hard palate (CHP), as determined by the fine-mapping analysis.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: The SNP rs777676 was also included in the credible set from the fine-mapping analysis of the 9q33.3 locus, contributing to the association with cleft hard palate (CHP).
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: Similar to rs2417050 and rs777676, the SNP rs12350252 was found within the credible set for the 9q33.3 locus, indicating its association with cleft hard palate (CHP).
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: The SNP rs13294166 was significantly associated with subsequent major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.52, indicating an increased risk for the outcome. This finding was established in the AFR GWAS for subsequent AIS with an uncorrected p-value of 3.77x10^-08.
title: Protein identification for stroke progression via Mendelian Randomization in Million Veteran Program and UK Biobank

finding: SNP rs746100 was significantly associated with five BMD traits, including lumbar spine, femur neck, total femur, pelvis, and trunk, with a strongest P-value of 1.64 × 10^-9.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: SNP rs1039406 was associated with five BMD sites in the same locus identified with rs746100.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs2075533, which is a novel functional promoter variant in the apoptosis gene TNFSF8, was associated with an increased risk of lung cancer. This finding was highlighted in a study conducted in the context of a Texas lung cancer genome-wide association study, indicating its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: A comprehensive bioinformatics analysis to identify potential prognostic biomarkers among TNFSF superfamily in breast cancer

finding: The frequency of rs3128509 allele, linked to CTSL expression, was significantly reported to confer increased susceptibility to COVID-19 in the Indian population.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The T allele frequency of rs2519093 was highlighted as influencing protein levels related to COVID-19 severity.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The rs10972300-T allele demonstrated an association with Alzheimer's disease (AD) in a US cohort, indicating a potential role of this SNP in the genetic predisposition to AD. However, this association was not replicated in a UK cohort, suggesting variability in genetic influences across populations.
title: Genetic analysis of VCP variants in a Turkish dementia cohort

finding: The minor allele of a rare, nonsynonymous variant rs3025380 in the DBH gene was associated with lower blood pressure, highlighting its role in blood pressure regulation.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: The novel SNP rs115555854 at the SLC28A3 locus showed a strong association with HbF levels, with an effect size of -0.73 (P = 2.52 x 10^-8), indicating its potential importance in modifying sickle cell disease outcomes specific to the Nigerian cohort.
title: The genetic dissection of fetal haemoglobin persistence in sickle cell disease in Nigeria

finding: In the GWAS for vestibular schwannoma, a genome-wide significant association was found at rs7341786 (p=1.4e-15, MAF=0.47437, OR=1.395), indicating a link to cancer risk through the CDKN2A-CDKN2B genes.
title: Large-scale trans-ethnic replication and discovery of genetic associations for rare diseases with self-reported medical data

finding: The missense variant rs28368148:C>G in IFNA10 was associated with an increased risk for critical illness (OR = 1.56, 95% CI = 1.38–1.77, P = 3.7 × 10^-12).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs7036656 SNP, located at chr9p21.3, was significantly associated with multiple splenic radiomics features, including energy (P=1.5x10^-20), GLRLM run length non-uniformity (P=1.6x10^-16), GLSZM large area low gray level emphasis (P=8.0x10^-9), GLSZM gray non-uniformity (P=3.4x10^-9), and GLCM inverse difference (P=3.2x10^-8). This locus is known as one of the strongest CAD loci and has remained mechanistically unclear since its initial identification.
title: Deep learning-derived splenic radiomics, genomics, and coronary artery disease

finding: The rs11515 SNP, also located at chr9p21.3, was significantly associated with energy (P=2.4x10^-11) and run length non-uniformity (P=3.3x10^-9), contributing to the understanding of the splenic axis in relation to CAD. This finding supports its involvement at one of the strongest CAD loci.
title: Deep learning-derived splenic radiomics, genomics, and coronary artery disease

finding: The locus rs1537373, located near CDKN2B, was identified as shared across multiple cardiovascular diseases, including atrial fibrillation (AF), coronary artery disease (CAD), heart failure (HF), and ischemic stroke. It had a consistent effect allele that conferred risk across these diseases, suggesting a universal genetic contribution to atherosclerotic outcomes.
title: Deciphering the genetic architecture of atrial fibrillation offers insights into disease prediction, pathophysiology and downstream sequelae

finding: The rs8176719 polymorphism in ABO blood group was found to have a marginal association with parasite density (p=0.01), but a highly significant association with plasma PfHRP2 concentration (p=10^-7).
title: The impact of malaria-protective red blood cell polymorphisms on parasite biomass in children with severe Plasmodium falciparum malaria

finding: At the ABO locus, the variant rs2519093 was associated with 28 traits in Europe as part of a broader pleiotropic analysis.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The variant rs8176747 at the ABO locus was investigated for its association with various disease risks, noting that blood-type A was linked to an increased risk of gastric cancer.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: Similar to rs8176747, rs8176746 at the ABO locus was examined in the context of blood type-related disease associations, including risks for ulcers.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs8176719 was also part of the ABO locus investigation, contributing to understanding blood type's impact on disease susceptibility.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs10810632 was identified as having indirect associations with type 1 diabetes complications (T1DC) traits via its relationship with HbA1c, a shared risk factor. This was corroborated by a joint analysis showing that the association was significant after a Bonferroni correction for multiple testing.
title: Characterization of direct and/or indirect genetic associations for multiple traits in longitudinal studies of disease progression

finding: The variant rs4977756 exhibited the strongest association with longevity among the GWAS variants analyzed, with a significance of p=0.019 and an odds ratio of 0.78. This variant was linked to glaucoma and showed that centenarians carried this risk allele at lower frequencies.
title: Targeted Sequencing of the 9p21.3 Region Reveals Association with Reduced Disease risks in Ashkenazi Jewish Centenarians

finding: The SNP rs734250 was linked to brain shape variance, confirming previous associations with brain volumes and positioning it as relevant for subcortical features.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: In this study, rs10983205 was associated with variation in brain shape particularly in subcortical regions, consistent with earlier findings regarding brain volume.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP rs10961435, related to NFIB, displayed significant association with low T1D PRS, indicating its relevance in type 1 diabetes genetic risk.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs11559334, tagging TBC1D2/GABBR2, was significantly associated with low T1D PRS, contributing to the genetic landscape of type 1 diabetes.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The tolerated missense variant, rs2282192 (T allele, frequency 28.8% in European ancestry), was linked to increased TSH, increased hypothyroidism risk, and decreased risk of nontoxic multinodular goitre and thyroid cancer. It also correlated with lower mean corpuscular volume and HbA1c levels.
title: Genome-wide association study of thyroid-stimulating hormone highlights new genes, pathways and associations with thyroid disease susceptibility and age-of-onset

finding: The SNP rs2517, within the PGAP3 gene, was previously associated with increased asthma susceptibility, severity, and exacerbations. It demonstrated an independent association with increased PGAP3 lung expression, implying a link between genetic variation and asthma pathology.
title: PGAP3 regulates human bronchial epithelial cell mRNAs present in asthma and respiratory virus reference data sets

finding: The rs9411378 variant at the ABO locus was found to increase susceptibility to Covid-19 among non-O blood group carriers, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.10, demonstrating a significant association with the disease.
title: A year of Covid-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: Identified as associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), reinforcing the notion of genetic variability influencing disease course.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: At 9q22.31, this variant was identified as a QTL for CENPP and was associated with increased kidney-related functions in the LLFS cohort.
title: Discovery of genomic and transcriptomic pleiotropy between kidney function and soluble receptor for advanced glycation end-products using correlated meta-analyses: The Long Life Family Study (LLFS)

finding: The SNP rs505922 was discovered in the 9q34.2 locus and was significantly associated with severe COVID-19. The ABO gene was prioritized as a potential causal gene based on its association with this SNP.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The rs2453555 SNP tagged a pathogenic repeat expansion in C9orf72. Conditional analysis revealed no residual signal after conditioning on the repeat expansion, indicating the expansion was the causal variant.
title: Common and rare variant association analyses in Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis identify 15 risk loci with distinct genetic architectures and neuron-specific biology

finding: The rs8176719 variant at the ABO locus was associated with a hypercoagulable state and deep vein thrombosis. Studies indicated a relationship between blood group types and COVID-19 severity, where group A exhibited a higher prevalence while group O presented a lower risk for severe disease.
title: A comprehensive knowledgebase of known and predicted human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 susceptibility and severity

finding: The T allele of rs391957 from the HSPA5 gene was found to be more common in LLIs and was associated with reduced anxiety and neuroticism, presenting an odds ratio of 1.586 for longer survival.
title: Genetic variants associated with longevity in long-living Indians

finding: The SNP rs149411423 was found to be functionally significant as it disrupted a glucocorticoid response element regulating the transcription of the GCNT1 gene, which is implicated in pulmonary immune responses. The study presented strong evidence that this genetic variant influenced glucocorticoid receptor (GR) mediated induction, thereby supporting its role as a risk factor for asthma through its regulatory effects on immune signaling activities.
title: Glucocorticoid-regulated bidirectional enhancer RNA transcription pinpoints functional genetic variants linked to asthma

finding: Located in the PTCH1 gene within the 9q22.32 locus, rs16909898 was reported as a lead variant associated with pulmonary function parameters.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The study identified rs61751937 with a highly significant association (P=9.20×10−16) with platelet reactivity (PR). Although no genome-wide significant single-variant association had been reported before, a gene-based genetic association between SVEP1 and PR was noted with a borderline P-value of P=2.6×10−6, indicating potential relevance.
title: A signature of platelet reactivity in CBC scattergrams reveals genetic predictors of thrombotic disease risk

finding: The SNP rs3849943, located at chr9:27543382, was associated with C9orf72 repeat status, with a Fisher p-value of 0.00001. This finding indicated its relevance to the genetic factors influencing amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) risk.
title: Cumulative genetic risk and C9orf72 repeat status independently associate with ALS status in two case-control studies

finding: The SNP rs657152 was identified as a significant risk factor for COVID-19 by Ellinghaus et al., located near the ABO gene, indicating its relevance in infection dynamics.
title: AncestryDNA COVID-19 Host Genetic Study Identifies Three Novel Loci

finding: This SNP was associated with the ABO locus and was confirmed in MTAG analyses of CES, although it was not described as a novel finding.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: SNP rs13284665 was linked with RETN expression and associated with multiple other genes, underlining its role in the extensive regulation of genetic networks related to cardiovascular traits.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The SNP rs524137 was associated with shorter leukocyte telomere length (LTL) through its linkage disequilibrium with the causal variant chr9:133004155:C:T, which was previously validated in GWAS for myeloproliferative neoplasms.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: This SNP was linked to the GFI1B gene, a known transcription factor important for hematopoietic stem cell quiescence, indicating a role in regulating telomere length proximal to cancer pathogenesis.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: This variant at locus CKS2 was linked with telomere length regulation as it interacts with cyclin-dependent kinases, impacting cell cycle progression.
title: Genomic, phenomic, and geographic associations of leukocyte telomere length in the United States

finding: Embryo FE136 carried a heterozygous missense mutation in TLE4 that caused a substitution of a polar amino acid. Although predicted to be tolerated (SIFT score of 0.18) and benign (PolyPhen score of 0.003), TLE4 was classified as highly intolerant to loss of function. This SNP’s high CADD score demonstrated significant potential functional impact, linking TLE4 to implantation and trophoblast functionality.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: Found exclusively in embryo FE106, this intergenic variant was reported to significantly associate with recurrent miscarriages in a cohort study. It was also noted to physically interact with TLE4, highlighting its relevance in miscarriage predictions.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: The SNP rs1063192 located in the CDKN2B locus exhibited a higher odds ratio in the top quartile of cardiovascular disease (CVD) topic weight (1.19±0.02) compared to the bottom quartile (1.08±0.02), with a P-value of 4×10^-5 indicating statistical significance. This suggested that CDKN2B was linked with both type 2 diabetes (T2D) and coronary artery disease, implying shared biological pathways.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: This SNP had a significant association with NAFLD among African Americans, with a finding indicating its importance in that specific ancestry.
title: A genome-wide association study for nonalcoholic fatty liver disease identifies novel genetic loci and trait-relevant candidate genes in the Million Veteran Program

finding: Located in the ABO gene region, rs687621 was associated with a lower risk of neonatal jaundice (OR = 0.46, p-value = 1.4×10−12). Its effects were linked to maternal-fetal blood group incompatibility, demonstrating its significant role.
title: Genome-wide analyses of neonatal jaundice reveal a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: The deletion-tagging variant rs2174926 was associated with an HR of 2.332 for graft loss time, suggesting it is a risk factor for LT outcomes. It also showed altered binding to transcription factors such as Foxj2_1 and Foxl1_1.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes
