finding: The rs62565993 variant was linked to glycine and exhibited strong eQTL associations for GLDC gene in whole blood, suggesting a significant role in glycine metabolism.
title: Genome-wide characterization of 54 urinary metabolites reveals molecular impact of kidney function

finding: The rs8176719 SNP within the ABO locus demonstrated a significant negative association with alkaline phosphatase across six ancestries. This enzyme is linked to protective effects against diabetes, suggesting a relevant relationship between COVID-19 severity and diabetes.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes and in over 1 million participants

finding: This SNP was indicated to be likely pathogenic and was studied for its positive association with myocardial infarction (MI) in Han Chinese male patients.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP was associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) in Caucasians, Japanese, and Korean populations, and with MI in German populations.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP was previously associated with MI in Italian populations, as well as with CAD in Korean populations.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP shows change in African and Middle-Eastern populations for type 2 diabetes and coronary artery disease (CAD).
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: The SNP rs181518405 in LHX6 showed nominal significance (p=3.90×10^-7) among suggestive associations.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The rs35767802 variant on the ADAMTSL2 gene was identified as the most prevalent among the original 103 variants in severely ill patients, with a notable 45% occurrence in this group. The ADAMTSL2 gene's role in the degradation of the extracellular matrix links it to various genetic disorders, including Type VIIC Ehlers–Danlos syndrome (EDS). There is a suggested comorbidity between EDS and Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome (ME/CFS), characterized by joint hypermobility, a common symptom observed in ME/CFS patients.
title: A Network Medicine Approach to Investigating ME/CFS Pathogenesis in Severely Ill Patients: A Pilot Study

finding: The SNP rs505922 was associated with the increased levels of CD209, the receptor implicated in COVID-19 severity. Colocalization analysis yielded a posterior probability of 0.98, suggesting that rs505922 likely contributed to shared genetic signals influencing both COVID-19 outcomes and CD209 protein levels, indicating its role in the underlying pathology of increased COVID-19 risk.
title: An atlas connecting shared genetic architecture of human diseases and molecular phenotypes provides insight into COVID-19 susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs657152 was linked to an increased risk of COVID-19 respiratory failure and elevated levels of CD209, with analysis suggesting that the same causal variants may underlie both conditions, enhancing the understanding of genetic factors influencing COVID-19 severity.
title: An atlas connecting shared genetic architecture of human diseases and molecular phenotypes provides insight into COVID-19 susceptibility

finding: This variant acted as a vQTL for platelet count and displayed a significant negative interaction with rs35417585.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: This SNP exhibited a significant negative interaction with rs35417585 for platelet count and was linked to a reduced risk of JAK2 V617F clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: The SNP rs10124571 was associated with educational attainment (p=8 × 10^-19); this may reflect socio-economic factors influencing both mental health outcomes and the severity of COVID-19.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs10810153 demonstrated a significant association with smoking initiation (p=3 × 10^-18), suggesting that tobacco use could mediate the relationship between anxiety disorders and COVID-19.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs1323342 was linked to brain morphology (p=4 × 10^-12), pointing to structural brain characteristics that may contribute to the comorbidity of anxiety and severe COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: SNP rs616154 was identified as a potentially invalid instrumental variable in the causal relationship from cardioembolic stroke (CES) to SARS-CoV-2 infection. It was detected as invalid due to its ratio estimate of the causal effect being significantly different from other SNPs, indicating a lack of support from other SNPs for its validity. Furthermore, rs616154 was found to be associated with Interleukin-6 (IL-6) levels, a biomarker that may relate to COVID-19 progression, suggesting potential horizontal pleiotropy. After excluding this SNP from the analysis, the estimated causal effect indicated that cardioembolic stroke might not be a risk factor for SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Robust Mendelian Randomization Analysis by Automatically Selecting Valid Genetic Instruments for Inferring Causal Relationships between Complex Traits and Diseases

finding: The SNP rs3891689 was identified as the GWAS lead risk variant for migraine. It was found that rare variants associated with migraine in the Polycomb Response Element within the ASTN2 locus were independent of this lead variant, indicating that rs3891689 had a significant role in the genetics of migraine.
title: Rare risk variants associate with epigenetic dysregulation in migraine

finding: Identified as significant in the replication analysis, this SNP contributed to the genetic landscape of ocular diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The rs72737013 SNP located near the ANXA1 gene was identified as a novel genome-wide significant variant associated exclusively with PET amyloid levels (Effect=0.813, P=2.39e-08). ANXA1 is linked to processes such as anti-inflammatory reactions and degradation of Aβ species.
title: Connecting genomic and proteomic signatures of amyloid burden in the brain

finding: This SNP was also linked to the A2 dimension, contributing to its characteristics of schizophrenia-like traits and neuroanatomical changes in brain structure.
title: Three Imaging Endophenotypes Characterize Neuroanatomical Heterogeneity of Autism Spectrum Disorder

finding: The rs657152 variant near the ABO gene located in the 9q34.2 locus was also associated with risk of hospitalization and severe COVID-19, with an odds ratio of 1.39 (P=4.9×10^-8). This confirmed its significance as previously reported in multiple studies.
title: Genetic association analysis of SARS-CoV-2 infection in 455,838 UK Biobank participants

finding: The study confirmed the allele frequency difference for rs657152, previously associated with severe COVID-19, showing an allele frequency of 0.3632 in COVID patients compared to 0.2436 in the general population (p-value=5.25E-05).
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: The allele frequency for rs56390333 was significant with an AF of 0.076 in COVID-19 patients and AF of 0 in the general population, with p-value=2.47E-103.
title: COVID-19 relevant genetic variants confirmed in an admixed population

finding: This variant was identified as a novel secondary signal at the CDKN2B-AS1 locus, with a low MAF (0.01) and significant conditional P value of 8.2×10^-6, indicating its potential role in T2D risk.
title: Rare Non-coding Variation Identified by Large Scale Whole Genome Sequencing Reveals Unexplained Heritability of Type 2 Diabetes

finding: This SNP was noted for its significant relationship with PSA levels and variable effects.
title: Genetically Adjusted PSA Levels for Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The SNP rs3181356 at TNFSF8 locus yielded significant results in the analysis, correlating with serum IgA levels (Beta=0.07, P=1.13×10^-18).
title: Genetic regulation of serum IgA levels and susceptibility to common immune, infectious, kidney, and cardio-metabolic traits

finding: Found to be associated with CAD in people with T2D, significant after Bonferroni correction, this variant indicated consistent directionality with general population studies.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: Identified as significant among CAD variants, with its association also being consistent with findings in the general population.
title: Time-to-Event Genome-Wide Association Study for Incident Cardiovascular Disease in People with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

finding: This SNP was located at the 9p24.2 locus within the intronic region of GLIS3. It has associations with mood disorders and was identified in the context of depression and T2D.
title: Multi-trait genetic analysis identifies novel pleiotropic loci for depression and SCZ in East Asians

finding: The variant rs146597587 was found to have a strong association with allergy, with an odds ratio of 0.60 and a p-value of 9.52×10^-27. This variant, identified in the dataset, disrupted a canonical splice acceptor site before the last coding exon of IL33, indicating its significant role in allergic responses.
title: Exon variants associated with asthma and allergy1

finding: Identified as the lead SNP at locus 9q33.3, achieving genome-wide significance associated with cleft hard palate (CHP). It was linked to the gene ANGPTL2, which plays a role in osteoblast differentiation and was expressed in human craniofacial tissue during embryogenesis.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: Included in the credible set for the 9q33.3 locus with 100% confidence of being associated with cleft hard palate (CHP). Fine mapping indicated this SNP lies within a craniofacial super enhancer near ANGPTL2.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: Part of the credible set associated with the 9q33.3 locus for cleft hard palate (CHP), showing strong linkage to the gene ANGPTL2.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: Included in the credible set of SNPs associated with cleft hard palate (CHP) at the 9q33.3 locus and located in a region of relevance to craniofacial development.
title: Trio-based GWAS identifies novel associations and subtype-specific risk factors for cleft palate

finding: The variant rs7862828 was identified near the AUH and NFIL3 genes and recognized as an eQTL for LINC00484. Its association relates to several traits like waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for BMI, and glycosuria in pregnancy.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: rs7470773 emerged as a significant risk factor for PE-FGR, associated with genes under investigation but without clear biological explanation.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The intergenic variant rs7028982 was involved in a significant association with preeclampsia, where its allele was found to reduce the expression of linked long non-coding RNAs and had implications related to placental vascular remodeling.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The SNP rs768719522, an intronic variant in PTPRD, was linked to a large relative risk of HGSOC, reinforcing the involvement of tumor suppressor mechanisms in cancer risk.
title: Large-scale genome-wide association study of 398,238 women unveils seven novel loci associated with high-grade serous epithelial ovarian cancer risk

finding: The rs7036656 SNP was significantly associated with multiple splenic radiomic features including energy (P=1.5x10^-20), GLRLM run length non-uniformity (P=1.6x10^-16), GLSZM large area low gray level emphasis (P=8.0x10^-9), GLSZM gray non-uniformity (P=3.4x10^-9), and GLCM inverse difference (P=3.2x10^-8). This SNP was part of the chr9p21 locus, which has been linked to coronary artery disease (CAD) but lacked mechanistic insights prior to this study.
title: Deep learning-derived splenic radiomics, genomics, and coronary artery disease

finding: The rs11515 SNP was found to be significantly associated with energy (P=2.4x10^-11) and run length non-uniformity (P=3.3x10^-9) in splenic features. It is located at the chr9p21 locus, which is one of the strongest CAD loci but previously lacked a clear mechanistic link.
title: Deep learning-derived splenic radiomics, genomics, and coronary artery disease

finding: The rs697449-T variant was identified as a vQTL for PAEP levels with an additive main effect. The analysis revealed significant interactions based on sex, highlighting a stronger effect in males compared to females, thus illustrating how this variant influenced both protein levels and body weight correlations.
title: Systematic discovery of gene-environment interactions underlying the human plasma proteome in UK Biobank

finding: This lead SNP near the ABO gene replicated across all four susceptibility phenotypes plus one severity phenotype, Hospitalized/Unscreened. Its association with severity was attributed to the large number of unscreened controls, which might blend susceptibility and severity aspects.
title: Novel COVID-19 phenotype definitions reveal phenotypically distinct patterns of genetic association and protective effects

finding: The variant rs495828 at the ABO locus was associated with the largest number of phenotypes (53) in the context of COVID-19. It demonstrated a significant association with venous embolism with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.33 (p=1.32 × 10^-199). Additionally, it was implicated in a hypercoagulable state with OR=1.48 and p=1.84 × 10^-40.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs505922 variant at the ABO locus was associated with 59 phenotypes, with a strong association observed in thrombosis marked by an OR of 1.33 (p=2.2 × 10^-265). Its analysis also linked it to a hypercoagulable state where it exhibited an OR of 1.51 and p=2.11 × 10^-55.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The rs2891168 variant, located in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus, was associated with various cardiovascular and neoplastic traits and showed interaction with rs33912345 of the SIX6 locus affecting vascular traits in POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs10811650 variant, also found in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus, demonstrated interactions with rs33912345 to affect gene expressions related to POAG and vascular traits, highlighting its cooperative effect in disease pathology.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs1008878 variant in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus was identified as an exonic variant with dominant influence on TWAS results suggesting substantial links to gene trait correlations in POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs1741032 variant was evaluated for its effect on the CELSR2 gene expression, revealing significant differences indicating its importance in the context of POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs616154 was identified as an invalid instrumental variable in the causal relationship from cardioembolic stroke (CES) to SARS-CoV-2 infection. It exhibited a causal effect estimate ratio of 0.525, which was inconsistent with other SNPs' estimates, indicating a violation of instrumental variable assumptions. Additionally, this SNP was associated with Interleukin-6 (IL-6) levels, suggesting a potential role in COVID-19 progression and confirming its horizontal pleiotropy. Excluding rs616154 from the analysis resulted in a near-zero causal effect estimate, suggesting that CES may not be a risk factor for SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Robust Mendelian Randomization Analysis by Automatically Selecting Valid Genetic Instruments for Inferring Causal Relationships between Complex Traits and Diseases

finding: The SNP rs10781542, located at the 9q34.3 locus, had the highest RDB score of 1a, indicating strong evidence of functionality in relation to Crohn's disease and stroke. This SNP showed statistically significant associations and was noted for its potential impact on disease mechanisms.
title: Genetic analyses identify shared genetic components related to autoimmune and cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs370237172 was an ultra-rare variant identified as a 48 bp insert at the exon 2 splice donor site of CACNA1B. It was found in two affected siblings diagnosed with PANS. Although this variant is part of a larger set of multiallelic insertion variants with an overall MAF of 0.017, the specific 48 bp insert was ultra-rare and previously unobserved in control datasets.
title: Identification of ultra-rare genetic variants in Pediatric Acute Onset Neuropsychiatric Syndrome (PANS) by exome and whole genome sequencing

finding: The SNP rs145791381 was associated with the non-AD inflammation component (PC4), indicating elevated YKL-40 levels not linked to other AD biomarkers or AD status. It was notably robust across sexes, exhibiting strong effect sizes and genome-wide significance.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP rs9298673 was located in a region upstream of <italic>DMRT2</italic> and was found to be associated with right ventricular end-systolic volume (RVESV) specifically in women.
title: Sex-specific genetic determinants of right ventricular structure and function

finding: This SNP in SCAI was significant only in males, showing a strong eQTL association in aorta, indicating its biological relevance.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The minor allele of the rare variant rs3025380 in the DBH gene was associated with lower blood pressure, reinforcing its role in hypertension-related phenotypes.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: The rs657152 polymorphism located at locus 9q34.2 was found to be associated with ABO blood group status. Specifically, it showed a higher risk of COVID-19 in individuals with blood group A, indicated by an odds ratio of 1.45 (P=0.0001). Conversely, blood group O was shown to have a protective effect against COVID-19 with an odds ratio of 0.65 (P=0.000001). This suggests that the ABO blood group may influence the severity of COVID-19 rather than predisposing individuals to infection.
title: Correlation of Body Mass Index (BMI), initial neutralizing antibodies (nAb), ABO group and kinetics of nAb and anti-nucleocapsid (NP) SARS-CoV-2 antibodies in convalescent plasma (CCP) donors – A longitudinal study with proposals for better quality of CCP collections

finding: The SNP rs10811662, located in the CDKN2A-CDKN2B locus, was associated with GDM (p=4.1×10−9). Its previous association with T2D highlighted its potential role in the shared etiology of GDM and T2D.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide association study of gestational diabetes mellitus highlights genetic links with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP was associated with high regulatory activity, impacting 43 prioritized genes including MAN1B1. This locus was speculated to influence longevity through mechanisms related to Alzheimer's disease and type-2 diabetes treatment, indicating its broad health importance.
title: Polygenic prediction of human longevity on the supposition of pervasive pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs35196838, located near the LMX1B gene on chromosome 9q33.3, was identified as a novel risk locus for restless legs syndrome (RLS) with a p-value of 2.2 × 10^-9 and an odds ratio (OR) of 1.14 (95% CI 1.09-1.19). It was replicated in an independent cohort with a p-value of 2.6 × 10^-5, OR of 1.10 (95% CI 1.05-1.14).
title: Genomic analysis identifies risk factors in restless legs syndrome

finding: The SNP rs10901252 was identified as part of the ABO gene loci that obtained the most prominent GWAS signal in plasma von Willebrand factor (VWF) levels. It was associated with the blood group determination that can discriminate B and O blood groups from A. The study indicated that individuals with blood group O had lower VWF plasma concentrations compared to individuals with non-O blood groups, suggesting a relevance to COVID-19 severity.
title: Coagulation factors and COVID-19 severity: Mendelian randomization analyses and supporting evidence

finding: The SNP rs687621 was also part of the ABO gene loci and showed a similar functionality by discriminating between blood groups. The finding noted that the plasma VWF levels were associated with ABO genotypes, where ABO blood group played a significant role in the risk of severe COVID-19, linking this SNP to the underlying mechanisms of coagulation in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: Coagulation factors and COVID-19 severity: Mendelian randomization analyses and supporting evidence

finding: This SNP was used as a proxy in the analyses for those that were not directly available, maintaining the link between inherited fat levels in the pancreas and PDAC risk.
title: Genetic Evidence Causally Linking Pancreas Fat to Pancreatic Cancer: A Mendelian Randomization Study

finding: Identified as one of the notable novel SNPs showing genetic correlation between BMI and MS.
title: Investigating shared genetic architecture between obesity and multiple sclerosis

finding: Carriers of the rs471364-G variant had a notably high odds ratio of 3.1 (2.1-4.5) for fatty liver with metabolic syndrome, which was linked to increased expression of the TTC39B gene in the liver.
title: Severe liver damage, low bone mineral content, and PDXDC1/TTC39B gene variations linked to NAFLD with metabolic syndrome

finding: The SNP rs505922 was identified as the variant with the highest importance for classifying venous thromboembolism (VTE) in the GLN-model. This SNP is an intron variant in the ABO gene, which has substantial genetic associations with VTE risk, thereby reinforcing its predictive utility in modeling VTE.
title: An assessment of the value of deep neural networks in genetic risk prediction for surgically relevant outcomes

finding: This SNP was characterized as an African-enriched eQTL for NIPSNAP3A, showing a significant association with p = 1.35e-61 and a beta of -1.44, present at a frequency of 3.9% in 1000 Genomes African populations.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The CCL21 gene contained the rs951005 SNP, which indicated an increased risk of rheumatoid arthritis when the minor allele was present.
title: Location of joint involvement differentiates Rheumatoid arthritis into different clinical subsets

finding: Variant rs1888909 (upstream of IL33) showed a marked increase in PIP (ΔPIP = 0.99) in GBMI, indicating enhanced significance in asthma association studies.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: This intronic variant in TGFBR1 was associated with a protective effect against otosclerosis and diminished expression of TGFBR1, showing its potential relevance.
title: Genome-wide Screen of Otosclerosis in Population Biobanks: 18 Loci and Shared Heritability with Skeletal Structure

finding: Knocked associative effects of this variant with lung cancer in European populations were observed.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The intergenic variant in association with adenocarcinoma was identified in 9p21.3.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: Near AQP3-AQP7, this SNP was identified as a new sentinel variant related to adenocarcinoma.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP was a supporting variant for the VLDLR gene shared between patients diagnosed with both IIH and PAP, indicating its relevance in these conditions.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: This variant also supported the VLDLR gene associated with IIH and PAP, underscoring its significance through overlapping findings.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: Found associated with the VLDLR gene, which was acknowledged as important for both IIH and PAP.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: Identified in the context of coding GWAS as associated with the SLC28A3 gene, with implications in ciliary function relevant to IIH.
title: The genetics of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH): Integration of population studies and clinical data

finding: The study found a novel association near the genes AUH and NFIL3 with exceptional support from eQTL data. The variant rs7862828 was associated with several traits including glycosuria in pregnancy.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The variant rs7470773 revealed a significant association near AUH and LINC00484, showing different mechanisms compared to rs7862828 in the two phenotypes, emphasizing the complexity of preeclampsia pathology.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: The intergenic variant rs7028982 was identified as a significant finding (p-value 6.7e-09) related to PE-FGR, associated with reduced expression of LINC00484 and NFIL3, critical for uterine natural killer cell function and vascular remodeling.
title: GWAS of preeclampsia and hypertensive disorders of pregnancy uncovers genes related to cardiometabolic, endothelial and placental function

finding: This missense variant was found to be associated with lower white blood cell (WBC) and neutrophil counts in the African population.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP showed strong positive associations with minimum joint space width (mJSW), hip osteoarthritis (HOA), and height, indicating that it could influence these traits.
title: Hip joint space width is causally related to hip osteoarthritis risk via distinct protective and susceptibility mechanisms: findings from a genome-wide association study meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was part of Cluster two and was situated close to the ASTN2 locus, showing a strong association with higher mJSW and increased risk of HOA.
title: Hip joint space width is causally related to hip osteoarthritis risk via distinct protective and susceptibility mechanisms: findings from a genome-wide association study meta-analysis

finding: This SNP was associated with severe COVID-19 and had the strongest association with hypercoagulable states, demonstrating an odds ratio (OR) of 1.48 in critical COVID and 1.51 in hospitalized COVID-19 patients. The association appeared significant across 53 phenotypes.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: Similar to rs495828, this SNP also associated with severe COVID-19, showing significant associations with hypercoagulable states, along with 59 phenotypes, with an OR of 1.33 for thrombosis.
title: A Phenome-Wide Association Study of genes associated with COVID-19 severity reveals shared genetics with complex diseases in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs2007153 was found to be novel for the African American population, associated with TUD with a p-value of 9.35E-21 in the DBH gene, which plays a role in dopamine metabolism.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorder prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs2519155 had a significant association with TUD (p-value of 7.25E-13), underscoring the involvement of the DBH gene in smoking behaviors.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorder prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The variant (chr9:21206606:C:G) in the IFNA10 gene, predicted as a missense mutation, indicated a strong association with critical COVID-19 with an odds ratio of 1.74 but showed a narrow failure of replication.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies multiple loci for critical illness caused by COVID-19

finding: SNP rs4977574 was associated with Coronary atherosclerosis, Angina pectoris, and Unstable angina, demonstrating its relevance to cardiovascular conditions through significant findings in both logistic regression and Poisson models.
title: Overcome the Limitation of Phenome-Wide Association Studies (PheWAS): Extension of PheWAS to Efficient and Robust Large-Scale ICD Codes Analysis

finding: The SNP rs59906468 was identified as a strong cis eQTL for CD274 expression in whole blood, showing that the A allele reduced CD274 expression (beta = 0.26, p=3.6×10^{-25}). This finding was validated in the adalimumab cohort where a similar trend was observed for CD274 protein expression in dendritic cell (DC) subsets. Additionally, putative associations with adalimumab response outcomes were noted in the CD274 region at both 3m and 6m for PASI75 and PASI90 outcomes, with p-values ranging from 0.10 to 8.8×10^{-6}. Bayesian colocalization analysis indicated that rs59906468 might act as a shared causal variant influencing both CD274 expression and adalimumab response, especially for PASI90 response at 6m, with a posterior probability of 0.66.
title: Enhanced NF-κB signaling in type-2 dendritic cells at baseline predicts non-response to adalimumab in psoriasis

finding: The variant rs8176746 in the ABO gene signaled a strong association with COVID-19 susceptibility across 21 tissues, emphasizing blood type's potential role in susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: At the ABO locus, rs8176719 was determined to have very high posterior probability of being causal, distinguishing blood types and contributing to the understanding of reduced COVID-19 infection risk.
title: Insights into genetic factors contributing to variability in SARS-CoV-2 susceptibility and COVID-19 disease severity

finding: The SNP rs3750434 was related to the protein GBA2, demonstrating significant associations with dietary habits. Like the previous SNPs, it accounted for over 60% of the colocalization probability regarding BMI and protein levels.
title: Genetic control of body weight by the human brain proteome

finding: Colocalization analysis revealed that rs12336113 was a shared causal genetic variant between ADHD and RLS, located in an intronic region of the PTPRD gene. This gene, known for its expression in brain tissue, is linked to functions such as spatial learning, synaptic plasticity, and motor neuron axon guidance. The identification of this SNP further supported the genetic connection between ADHD and RLS, highlighting its potential role in regulating PTPRD expression, which may contribute to the comorbidity observed between these two disorders.
title: Shared genetic architecture and causal pathways between attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and restless legs syndrome

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I), indicating its relevance to milder symptom expression.
title: Integrative analyses of multimodal clinical, neuroimaging, genetic, and transcriptomic data identify subtypes and potential treatments for heterogeneous Parkinson’s disease progression

finding: The deletion mismatch associated with rs2174926 exhibited an increased risk of graft loss with a hazard ratio (HR) of 2.332 (95% CI: 1.145–4.752, P-value 0.020). This variant also impacted regulatory motifs for transcription factors such as Foxj2 and Foxl1.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: The SNP rs6477754 was identified as one of the two additional significant loci found on chromosome 9 during the GWAS for C4 protein concentration, with its involvement possibly related to complement functions.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: The SNP rs944801 was confirmed through meta-analysis as significantly associated with age-related ocular diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: This SNP in ALDH1B1 indicated a protective effect against alcohol consumption, suggesting its role in the enzymatic pathway influencing alcohol metabolism. It showed significant interaction with the rs671 variant.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: Identified in ALDH1A1, this SNP showed association with drinking status, and further validation was needed to elucidate its functional role in alcohol metabolism.
title: Genotype-stratified GWAS meta-analysis reveals novel loci associated with alcohol consumption

finding: Linked to CDKN2B-AS1, this SNP demonstrated an association with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) and had a significant p-value of 8.35×10^-19, implicating it in eye health.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: Also part of identified credible sets, this SNP signaled potential causal involvement in ERM given its statistical significance.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: This proxy for rs4838069 showed significant p-value associations with DENND1A expression changes, supporting its role in retinal phenotypes.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: The SNP rs28450540 was part of the LD block with a deletion at the 9q22.1 locus associated with lower monocyte counts and lower monocyte percentages. This suggests a link between the SNP and monocyte traits.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies common and rare structural variants contributing to hematologic traits in the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The SNP rs41276777 was located in the 5' untranslated region of both PRPF4 and CDC26 and was associated with spleen iron levels (beta=0.17, p=2.1e-9). It colocalized with signals relevant to other iron traits like serum ferritin and serum iron, hinting at its broader implications in body iron homeostasis.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron homeostasis and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs4077515 in the gene CARD9 was significant as it was associated with an increased blood transcript level of CARD9. Specifically, the risk allele (rs4077515-T) was identified as a nonsynonymous substitution leading to a S12N change in exon 2 of CARD9, which resulted in an increase in expression and a significant splice quantitative trait locus (QT) as demonstrated in GTEx.
title: GWAS defines pathogenic signaling pathways and prioritizes drug targets for IgA nephropathy

finding: The variant rs8176719 was found to colocalize with gene expression of the gene RALGDS specifically in T effector memory (TEM) cells 16 hours post-stimulation, demonstrating the importance of cell stimulation on colocalization.
title: Colocalization of expression transcripts with COVID-19 outcomes is rare across cell states, cell types and organs

finding: In the absence of detection of rs8176719 in T naive cells 16 hours post-stimulation, the variant rs7036642, which is in linkage disequilibrium with rs8176719, was highlighted as significant.
title: Colocalization of expression transcripts with COVID-19 outcomes is rare across cell states, cell types and organs

finding: The SNP was included in gene-based analysis near the HLA region and showed significant associations, being replicated in public datasets.
title: Genome-wide analysis of individual coding variants and HLA-II-associated self-immunopeptidomes in ulcerative colitis

finding: The minor allele of the rare, nonsynonymous variant <italic>DBH</italic> (rs3025380) was associated with lower blood pressure. This provided evidence of a protective effect against hypertension.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs630014 was strongly associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection among SLE patients, indicated by a meta P-value of 4.10×10−32.
title: Disentangling the common genetic architecture and causality of rheumatoid arthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus with COVID-19 outcomes: genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: Successfully identified as an association with OUD (p=1.24×10^-09) in the study, this SNP belongs to the RABEPK gene and indicates its contribution to OUD risk.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: The SNP rs507666 was identified as a risk locus for varicose veins. It also represented a pleiotropic trans-expression quantitative trait locus (trans-pQTL) affecting members of the vascular endothelial growth factor receptor family (VEGFR2 and VEGFR3), linking it to vascular development and health.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: The SNP rs72775784 was reported as another novel risk variant for varicose veins at the NOTCH1 locus, linking it to key roles in vascular morphogenesis, which may contribute to the development of primary varicose veins.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of Varicose Veins Reveals Polygenic Architecture, Genetic Overlap with Arterial and Venous Disease, and Novel Therapeutic Opportunities

finding: The rs489347 variant in the TEK gene was significantly associated with an increased risk of stroke in sickle cell disease (SCD) patients, with a P-value of 0.0008127 and an odds ratio of 2.46 (95% CI 1.45-4.17), indicating that this genetic variant could potentially heighten susceptibility to stroke.
title: Genetic variants associated with the risk of stroke in sickle cell disease: a systematic review and meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs3217992 was associated with cardiometabolic multimorbidity (CMM) trajectories, being one of the unique SNPs under the gene CDKN2B-AS1 which contributed to the understanding of CMM development. Its association was nominally significant with a p-value less than 0.05.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: The SNP rs4977574 was also linked to CMM trajectories, showing relevance under the gene CDKN2B-AS1 with at least two unique variants within this locus and having a nominal p-value less than 0.05.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: The SNP rs7859727 associated with CMM trajectories and was among the significant variants located within the CDKN2B-AS1 gene, indicating that it played a role in the development of CMM, with a nominal p-value less than 0.05.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: This SNP was associated with the non-AD inflammation component (PC4), showing a negative association with low scores of the component (-1.01SD, SE=0.18, p=6.0*10^-9). Notably, it showed consistent effect sizes and genome-wide significance in both sexes.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The variant rs10761240 at locus 9q22.31 was found to be associated with insomnia and had shared genetic effects with DTI parameters of the corpus callosum.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: In the female-only analysis, rs73581580 was identified as a genome-wide significant risk locus on chromosome 9, corresponding to the locus for the gene EXD3, with a p-value of 2.83×10−8, indicating its role in contributing to borderline personality disorder (BPD).
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: The rs600038/SURF1 variant corresponded with previously established associations with heart failure, underlining its significance.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify drug targets for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs3125011 was associated with the gene NOTCH1, with a P-value of 7.9×10^-7, and had high CADD and RegulomeDB scores indicative of strong potential effects on gene regulation.
title: Integrated multi-omics data analysis identifies a novel genetics-risk gene of IRF4 associated with prognosis of oral cavity cancer

finding: SNP rs28937594 was found to have a notably higher minor allele frequency in Iranian Jews (cluster MAF: 0.024, Fisher's exact test p-value: 5.58e-28) compared to the general biobank MAF of 5.80e-05. This SNP, located in the GNE gene, was linked to hereditary inclusion-body myopathy and highlighted as a founder mutation in the Iranian Jewish population.
title: Health care utilization of fine-scale identity by descent clusters in a Los Angeles biobank

finding: The findings indicated that rs657152 exhibited a more homogeneous distribution across populations, with the highest frequencies found in Sub-Saharan Africa (over 50%) and moderate frequencies in various Eurasian populations (40-50%). Notably, the allele was significantly correlated with death rates from COVID-19 (r=0.63, p=0.01) in the Russian dataset, suggesting a strong linkage to severe disease outcomes. This SNP was associated with the ABO blood group locus, further connecting it to the genetic factors influencing COVID-19 severity.
title: THE VARIATION OF GENOME SITES ASSOCIATED WITH SEVERE COVID-19 ACROSS POPULATIONS: THE WORLDWIDE AND NATIONAL PATTERNS

finding: The SNP rs677622 at 9p22.3 presented a strong association with MacTel (P=3.2×10^-9), indicating its role in the genetic landscape of the disease.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs10810632, located in the BNC2 gene on chromosome 9p22.2, was identified in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) as having an indirect association with both time-to-diabetic retinopathy (DR) and time-to-diabetic nephropathy (DN) traits via its influence on the longitudinal risk factor Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c). The findings indicated that as the sample size increased, the classification results suggested a shift from being classified solely as an indirect association to being classified as both direct and indirect associations with T1DC traits.
title: Characterization of direct and/or indirect genetic associations for multiple traits in longitudinal studies of disease progression

finding: This SNP, proximal to DENND4C, held significance with a p-value of 1.64×10⁻¹⁵ and was hypothesized to be involved in neurodegeneration, particularly relating to PD.
title: Hemochromatosis Neural Archetype Reveals Iron Disruption in Motor Circuits

finding: The SNP rs9411335, associated with the gene MED27, was identified as a novel variant linked to soluble vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 2 (sVEGFR2) levels. The analysis suggested that higher sVEGFR2 levels, predicted by this SNP, were protective against the risk of macular pucker (MP), which was confirmed by a odds ratio (OR) of 0.86.
title: Genetic Evidence for Soluble VEGFR2 as a Protective Factor Against Macular Pucker

finding: Recognized for its interactions with SIX6 in influencing the expression of critical genes related to POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: This variant consistently demonstrated associations with POAG, particularly concerning vascular-related traits.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: Linked to various cardiovascular traits and also implicated in interaction effects on POAG risk.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: This variant exhibited male-specific associations impacting protein expression in the context of POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: Located intronic to ABO, this SNP was found to have shared trans-regulation effects for miR-126-3p and its validated target gene TCF4.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: This SNP was identified as a trans-miR-eQTL for six miRNAs and overlapped with pQTLs, being associated with traits such as monocyte count and coagulation factor levels.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: Associated with 40 protein biomarkers, this SNP was linked to cardiovascular traits, signifying its influence on multiple phenotypes.
title: An atlas of genetic regulation and disease associations of microRNAs

finding: The rs9411378:A variant in ABO demonstrated an association with COVID-19 positive individuals compared to controls, with a MAF of 24%, an OR of 1.12, and a p-value of 2×10^-10.
title: Common genetic variants identify targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs8176685 was significantly associated with early onset ischemic stroke (IS), showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.17 (95% CI: 1.11-1.22) compared to late onset IS (OR = 1.05). This variant marked a 12 base pair insertion/deletion polymorphism at the ABO locus, which has been previously associated with stroke. Higher genetic risk associated with this SNP indicated that blood group A was more prevalent in early onset cases.
title: Genetic Contributions to Early and Late Onset Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs529565 was associated with early onset ischemic stroke with an odds ratio of 0.88 (95% CI: 0.85-0.91), indicating a protective effect. This variant was linked with blood group O1 and showed stronger associations with early compared to late onset IS.
title: Genetic Contributions to Early and Late Onset Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs11145951 in <italic>PTGDS</italic> was reported to be significantly associated with central corneal thickness (CCT) in the European population (P=9.20×10<sup>−12</sup>), highlighting its potential as a genetic determinant for CCT. However, no significant association was found in the Asian population (P=2.30×10<sup>−2</sup>), suggesting an ethnic-specific effect.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified genes pleiotropically associated with central corneal thickness

finding: This SNP was associated with susceptibility to pulmonary hypertension, epilepsy, and neurodegenerative diseases, indicating its relevance in these conditions.
title: The Mechanism of Vascular Endothelial Dysfunction Induced by Ferroptosis Mediated by NARFL Knockout

finding: The lead variant rs28368148:C>G, a missense variant (p.Trp164Cys) located within the IFN-α gene cluster, increased the risk for critical illness (OR = 1.56, 95% CI = 1.38–1.77, P = 3.7 × 10−12).
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs687289 variant was identified at the chr19:10351837:C:T locus, contributing to severe COVID-19 association, with statistical significance noted.
title: Detailed stratified GWAS analysis for severe COVID-19 in four European populations

finding: This novel AA-specific variant located near OLFM1 was found associated with AUDIT-C, with relevance to smoking behavior.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: Noted for its strong direct effects on AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This variant also showed strong effects on AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This SNP was observed in the FANCC locus with a minor allele frequency of 0.5% and an odds ratio of 1.58, pointing to its role in AF risk within East Asian populations.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: An association was detected between post-vaccination immune responses to measles vaccination and genetic polymorphism in the DDX58 gene, specifically the rs669260 SNP. This finding highlighted the significance of genetic variants in influencing individual immune responses following live measles vaccination.
title: A systematic review and modelling insights of factors impacting measles vaccine effectiveness

finding: The variant rs8176719 was noted as the lead variant at the ABO locus and related to the O blood group. Its deletion resulted in the O allele, which showed a significant correlation (OR = 1.14, P = 6.0 × 10−14) with a higher risk of PUD.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: The SNP rs12347577 was identified as a lead variant associated with gastric ulcers (GU) in HP-negative individuals. It showed a significant association (P < 0.05), highlighting its relevance in understanding genetic factors linked to PUD.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: An association between ABO blood type and COVID-19 was indicated, with ABO blood type being genetically determined and unlikely to be influenced by later life exposures. This SNP, among others, was used to infer blood type in participants of the UK Biobank study.
title: Socioeconomic inequality in SARS-CoV-2 testing and COVID-19 outcomes in UK Biobank over the first year of the pandemic: can inequalities be explained by selection bias?

finding: This SNP was part of the genetic determination of ABO blood type, which demonstrated an association with COVID-19 infection in previous studies, suggesting that blood type influences the likelihood of SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Socioeconomic inequality in SARS-CoV-2 testing and COVID-19 outcomes in UK Biobank over the first year of the pandemic: can inequalities be explained by selection bias?

finding: The association of ABO blood type with COVID-19 was again supported through this SNP, indicating a genetic basis for the observed differences in infection rates related to blood type.
title: Socioeconomic inequality in SARS-CoV-2 testing and COVID-19 outcomes in UK Biobank over the first year of the pandemic: can inequalities be explained by selection bias?

finding: The rs78254323-T variant was identified as related to overt hyperthyroidism with an odds ratio of 1.72, demonstrating its significance in the genetic landscape of thyroid dysfunction during pregnancy.
title: Genome-wide association studies of thyroid-related hormones, dysfunction, and autoimmunity among 85,421 Chinese pregnancies

finding: Associated with Long COVID, rs644234 (T being the effect allele) had an OR of 0.95 (95% CI: 0.94, 0.97, p=3.66 X 10^-09). It is linked to the ABO gene, which has been previously implicated in COVID-19 susceptibility and severity.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: This variant, located within the ABO locus, was in linkage disequilibrium with rs644234 and is significant in determining the ABO blood group, which has been linked to COVID-19 outcomes.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of Long COVID identifies immune-related loci and etiological links to chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia and depression

finding: At the Chr9q34.2 locus, rs687289 was associated with changes in expression levels of metabolites and was linked to phosphatidylcholine metabolism, showing a connection to metabolic pathways relevant to diabetes.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: rs558240 was part of the five SNPs at the Chr9q34.2 locus and was associated with expression levels of various metabolites, particularly phosphatidylcholines, indicating its role in metabolic regulation.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: Associated with metabolite expression levels at the Chr9q34.2 locus, rs176694 contributed to changes in phosphatidylcholine metabolites, providing insight into potential pathways influencing type 2 diabetes.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: The SNP rs11244083 at the Chr9q34.2 locus was linked to the expression of metabolites and phosphatidylcholines, suggesting its importance in metabolic disturbances associated with diabetes.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: rs592514 was also associated with metabolite levels at the Chr9q34.2 locus, implicating it in the regulation of phosphatidylcholine metabolism and potential pathways related to type 2 diabetes.
title: MiR-139-5p is a causal biomarker for type 2 diabetes; Results from genome-wide microRNA profiling and Mendelian randomization analysis in a population-based study

finding: The rs12554549 variant in the PTPN gene was significantly linked to RT-induced acute skin ulceration in breast cancer patients, underlining its role in cell growth and differentiation processes related to radiation treatment.
title: Systematic Review of Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Acute Pain and Relevant Acute Toxicities Induced by Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer

finding: The SNP rs10122243 at the CDKN2B-AS1 locus (9p21.3) showed significant association at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 1.75x10^-6 regarding endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs62576127 at the ASTN2 locus (9q33.1) was significant at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 9.01x10^-4, linked to endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs495828 at the ABO locus (9q34.2) demonstrated significance at a Bonferroni-corrected threshold with a p-value of 5.87x10^-4 in relation to endometriosis.
title: Enhancing Genetic Association Power in Endometriosis through Unsupervised Clustering of Clinical Subtypes Identified from Electronic Health Records

finding: This SNP was previously associated with atopic dermatitis (AD) only in Europeans and was just below the genome-wide significance threshold in the European-only analysis.
title: European and multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of atopic dermatitis highlights importance of systemic immune regulation

finding: The SNP rs612169 was included as one of the pQTLs associated with GOLM1, which was found to be a causal plasma protein for COVID-19 infection with an MR P value of 2.65×10−8. This association indicated higher levels of GOLM1 corresponding to COVID-19 infection.
title: Plasma proteomics of SARS-CoV-2 infection and severity reveals impact on Alzheimer and coronary disease pathways

finding: The SNP rs17180299 was associated with plasma concentrations of methadone R- and S-enantiomers in heroin-dependent patients, indicating its relevance in pharmacogenomics related to substance dependence treatments. This finding was part of a broader analysis that examined multiple haplotypes, showcasing the impact of genetic variations on drug metabolism and response.
title: AI-driven Integration of Multimodal Imaging Pixel Data and Genome-wide Genotype Data Enhances Precision Health for Type 2 Diabetes: Insights from a Large-scale Biobank Study

finding: The rs41307447 polymorphism in the TLE4 gene resulted in a missense mutation. Although this variant was categorized as tolerated and benign based on SIFT and PolyPhen scores, TLE4 is classified as highly intolerant to loss of function. Its role in embryonic development through regulation of pluripotency raises concerns about its potential relevance in miscarriage.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: The intergenic variant rs7859844 was identified in the context of TLE4 and showed a significant association with recurrent miscarriages in previous studies. This SNP was relevant as it physically interacted with TLE4, suggesting a genetic predisposition linking it to miscarriage risk.
title: Prioritization of putatively detrimental variants in euploid miscarriages

finding: The SNP rs147288039 was identified as a significant locus in the multi-ancestry meta-analysis, showing a higher allele frequency of 0.23% in East Asians and 0.75% in South Asians. This suggested its role in enhancing the power of genetic discovery for heart failure (HF) within diverse populations.
title: Polygenic risk score from a multi-ancestry GWAS uncovers susceptibility of heart failure

finding: The SNP rs507666 related to ABO was found to be associated with hypercholesterolemia through the CC-liability analysis. Prior research also linked this SNP to cholesterol traits, confirming its impact.
title: Genetic association studies using disease liabilities from deep neural networks

finding: Variant rs17696570 located in <italic>C9orf72</italic> was associated with C0 and C1 clusters, underlining its contribution to the genetic landscape of neurodegenerative disorders.
title: Genetic risk factor clustering within and across neurodegenerative diseases

finding: The risk allele rs687621-G was significantly associated with elevated levels of von Willebrand factor (VWF), with a p-value of 9.58×10^-20. This association likely mediated through genetic regulation, as VWF levels correlate with COVID-19 severity.
title: The genetic risk for COVID-19 severity is associated with defective innate immune responses

finding: The SNP rs687621 located at 9q34.2 in the ABO gene region showed an association with neonatal jaundice (OR = 0.46; p-value = 1.4 × 10^-12), and it was confirmed that this SNP reflects maternal-fetal ABO blood group incompatibility effects on jaundice risk.
title: Genome-wide analysis of neonatal jaundice reveals a marked departure from adult bilirubin metabolism

finding: The SNP rs1927914 in the TLR4 gene demonstrated a significant association with gastric cancer (OR = 1.23; p = 0.021) following adjustment for covariates, underscoring its contribution to gastric cancer susceptibility.
title: Ornithine Decarboxylase (ODC1) gene variant (rs2302615) is associated with gastric cancer independently of Helicobacter pylori CagA serostatus

finding: The SNP rs2453555, located intronically within the gene C9orf72, was identified as the top single-variant association signal for Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS), with an odds ratio of 1.19 and a p-value of 1.78e-41. This SNP is known to tag a hexanucleotide repeat expansion that is one of the most common genetic causes of ALS.
title: The Neurodegenerative Disease Knowledge Portal: Propelling Discovery Through the Sharing of Neurodegenerative Disease Genomic Resources

finding: Associated with the contrast between COVID-19 positive and negative or unknown individuals, with a MAF of 23%, OR of 1.12, and notable P-value of 6×10^(-10). However, it did not relate to COVID-19 severity.
title: Common genetic variants identify therapeutic targets for COVID-19 and individuals at high risk of severe disease

finding: The SNP rs10960087 reached genome-wide significance in the SCQ stereotyped GWAS with a p-value of 2.5 × 10^-8. Despite its significance, it did not map within 100 kb of any gene, but was located approximately 120 kb downstream of DMRT2, a gene associated with ADHD.
title: Clinical autism subscales have common genetic liability that is heritable, pleiotropic, and generalizable to the general population

finding: The SNP rs7854303 was found to be a low frequency variant with a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 3.4×10−4, which showed a significant association with chronic lymphoid leukemia when analyzed using lower MAF cutoffs (MAF ≤ 0.01% and 0.1%), yielding a p-value of 7.5×10−7. This was compared to a less significant p-value of 5.4×10−4 when testing all variants with MAF ≤ 1%. This finding illustrated that significant association signals were largely enriched in the rarer variants within the PDCD1LG2 gene.
title: Set-based rare variant association tests for biobank scale sequencing data sets

finding: The study reported a prominent mutation in the GRHPR gene identified as rs180177314 (G>A), which was found in 30% of the individuals assessed. This mutation was noted to show a significantly higher frequency in the patient group (29.2%) compared to the controls (5.9%), indicating a 6.59-fold increased risk of nephrolithiasis progression in individuals carrying the A allele. This SNP was studied for the first time and demonstrated a significant correlation with increased urinary calcium levels compared to the GG genotype.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing (WES) identifies Homozygous mutation in g.37429732G>A in GRHPR gene is responsible for early onset of nephrolithiasis in the population of West Bengal, India

finding: SNP rs11794648 was recognized as an intronic variant in TMEM245 showing novel associations with substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs1106260 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus associated with non-response to SSRIs in a study of 114,324 individuals, showing an odds ratio of 1.0502 and a p-value of 3.55e-08. It was indicated that rs1106260 relates to the gene OLFM1, which is implicated in neuropsychiatric disorders and depression.
title: Genome-wide meta-analyses of non-response to antidepressants identify novel loci and potential drugs

finding: The SNP rs505922 exhibited consistent associations with E-selectin in both the DCS (p = 1.23e-15) and GoDARTS (p = 1.40e-16) cohorts. This finding indicated a relevant relationship between rs505922 and immune or inflammatory pathways that could be implicated in the pathophysiology of type 2 diabetes.
title: Novel subgroups of type 2 diabetes based on multi-Omics profiling: an IMI-RHAPSODY Study

finding: SNP rs2274836 was associated with a downregulation of the OA risk gene <italic>TNC</italic> in cartilage (noted that <italic>TNC</italic> was upregulated in lesioned cartilage, suggesting its complex role in OA pathology).
title: Allelic expression imbalance in articular cartilage and subchondral bone refined genome-wide association signals in osteoarthritis

finding: This SNP was associated with Subtype I, marking its relevance to the mild progression character of the subtype.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The rs202207045 variant, p.Ala382Val in GTF3C5, was associated with lower LDL cholesterol and non-HDL cholesterol (p=0.02 for both) and replicated in GWAS data, indicating its importance in lipid metabolism.
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The rs189383196 variant, a deleterious start-lost variant in GTF3C5, was associated with multiple cardiovascular phenotypes, including non-ischemic cardiomyopathy (p=2.8×10^-5). This variant was highly enriched in the Finnish population and highlighted the gene's role in cardiovascular risk.
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: The rs369889499 variant, p.Tyr347Cys in GTF3C5, was associated with angina pectoris (p=9.20×10^-5) and ischemic heart disease (p=6.10×10^-4), reinforcing the significance of GTF3C5 in cardiovascular conditions.
title: Novel protein-altering variants associated with serum apolipoprotein and lipid levels

finding: This SNP was identified as the functional variant that differentiates between O and non-O blood type alleles. It was used extensively to determine blood types across various studies, revealing significant linkage disparities among populations, with a median r² of 0.443 in African populations compared to much higher values in East Asian (0.946) and European (0.869) groups.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: This SNP served as one of the functional variants for differentiating A and B blood type alleles. In African populations, it was part of a set of SNPs displaying high linkage and performing well when used in conjunction with other functional variants.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: Similar to rs7853989, this SNP was included among functional variants determining A and B blood types, demonstrating strong linkage with others in the set within certain superpopulations.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: Recognized as a key SNP for A versus B blood type differentiation, it featured prominently in analyses across ancestry groups and consistently exhibited high linkage with other SNPs determining ABO blood types.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: This SNP also contributed to the A versus B blood type determination, and was noted for maintaining linkage with other functional variants particularly in some populations.
title: Disparities in ABO Blood Type Determination Across Diverse Ancestries: A Systematic Review and Validation in the All of Us Research Program

finding: The homozygous recessive genotype (G/G) at rs2013566 was associated with worsened somatic symptoms such as headache, back pain, joint pain, muscle pain, and somatization, as well as diminished sleep quality, energy level, and overall quality of life in individuals with IBS. This was validated by external data from the UK Biobank, indicating an increased likelihood of headaches.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: Significant associations were found between rs1627784 and muscle pain in the U.S. cohort. In the UK Biobank data, while not directly confirmed for muscle pain, it was associated with increased odds of depression.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant associations with muscle pain in the U.S. cohort and was additionally validated in the UK Biobank data, where it was associated with decreased somatization and increased depression.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: The homozygous recessive genotype (G/G) at rs1147198 was positively associated with muscle pain in the analyses across different models.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: Identified to have a significant association with having IBS, showing approximately 3.4 times higher odds; however, it did not correlate with specific somatic or psychological symptoms.
title: Genetic Variations in TrkB.T1 Isoform and Their Association with Somatic and Psychological Symptoms in Individuals with IBS

finding: SNP rs41276777[A], positioned in the 5' UTR of <italic>PRPF4</italic> and <italic>CDC26</italic>, was associated with altered expressions of both genes, linking it to regulation of iron traits in blood.
title: Analysis of MRI-derived spleen iron in the UK Biobank identifies genetic variation linked to iron recycling and erythrocyte morphology

finding: The variant rs687289 was found to be associated with increased risk of pancreatic cancer, with an odds ratio of 1.23 (95% CI 1.08 - 1.40, P=0.002). Sensitivity analyses indicated that this association was mainly driven by rs687289, which is linked to non-O blood group, potentially influencing both VTE and pancreatic cancer through independent pathways.
title: Causal relationships between risk of venous thromboembolism and 18 cancers: a bidirectional Mendelian randomisation analysis

finding: ABO rs635634 interacted with TREH rs12225548, contributing to alkaline phosphatase levels, showing another example of gene-gene interaction.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: This SNP was noted for its association with chronic pain in the identified locus which contained a unique signal, reinforcing its contribution to the genetics of shared chronic pain conditions.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: The SNP rs10758593 was found to be associated with both type 1 and type 2 diabetes. This highlighted its role in diabetes-related phenotypes and supported the notion of pleiotropy in the genetic landscape.
title: Exploiting collider bias to apply two-sample summary data Mendelian randomization methods to one-sample individual level data

finding: The SNP rs748741, associated with the NEK6 gene, was also identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus related to PMR, indicating the importance of this gene in the inflammatory processes of the disease.
title: Modifiable risk factors and inflammation-related proteins in polymyalgia rheumatica: genome-wide meta-analysis and Mendelian randomisation

finding: The deletion mismatch for rs2174926 was significantly associated with graft loss time and produced an HR of 2.332 (95% CI: 1.145–4.752, P = 0.020). It also showed altered binding patterns of several forkhead box transcription factors, suggesting a potential regulatory role in LT outcomes.
title: The impact of genome-wide histocompatibility on liver transplantation outcomes

finding: This SNP was identified near the CDKN2B-AS1 locus and demonstrated strong association with diabetes-related HF after correcting for collider bias (OR 1.06, 95% CI 1.04-1.08, p-value 2.91×10^-9), validating its relevance to HF in diabetic patients.
title: Correction for Collider Bias in the Genome-wide Association Study of Diabetes-Related Heart Failure due to Bidirectional Relationship between Heart Failure and Type 2 Diabetes

finding: The SNP rs56175925 was found in the vicinity of B4GALT1 on chromosome 9, with a p-value of 1.83×10^-08, marking it as a significant contributor to MaxAlc in African ancestry subjects.
title: Genome-wide investigation of maximum habitual alcohol intake (MaxAlc) in 247,755 European and African Ancestry U.S. Veterans informs the relationship between habitual alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorder

finding: The SNP rs10811662 at the CDKN2B-AS1 locus was also part of the seven identified SNPs shared between type 2 diabetes and depression.
title: Bi-directional Mendelian randomization and multi-phenotype GWAS show causality and shared pathophysiology between depression and type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4977756 in 9p21.3 was associated with shared influences between vertical cup-to-disc ratio (VCDR_regressed_left) and Glioma, with evidence of overlaps with traits related to cognitive function.
title: Eye-brain connections revealed by multimodal retinal and brain imaging genetics in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs1107329 was associated with increased plasma CRAT protein abundance and altered levels of 2-methylmalonylcarnitine, which tied the genetic variant to carnitine metabolism and atopic dermatitis risk.
title: Multi-ancestry Genome-Wide Association Meta-Analysis Identifies Novel Loci in Atopic Dermatitis

finding: The SNP rs8176719 at the ABO locus exhibited a significant negative association with alkaline phosphatase across all ancestries. This finding was particularly relevant as alkaline phosphatase has protective effects against diabetes when present in sufficient concentrations, relating it to COVID-19 severity outcomes.
title: Host genetic liability for severe COVID-19 overlaps with alcohol drinking behavior and diabetic outcomes in over 1 million participants

finding: The rs2519093 SNP was associated with multiple plasma proteins, including E-selectin and PECAM-1, within a region on chromosome 9 known as the ABO locus, contributing to significant variation in plasma protein levels.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs635634 SNP colocalized with rs2519093 in the ABO locus and was linked to the protein Cadherin-1. It displayed high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs2519093, indicating a shared influence on plasma protein levels.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: The rs687621 variant was identified as a trans-pQTL associated with FAS plasma levels, contributing to an increased expression of FAS. This SNP is also located within the ABO locus, recognized for influencing the expression of multiple plasma proteins.
title: Integrative genetic and immune cell analysis of plasma proteins in healthy donors identifies novel associations involving primary immune deficiency genes

finding: Variant rs10964101 located in SMARCA2 displayed a notable frequency difference of 0.819 in UKB-AFR as opposed to 0.094 in UKB-EUR (p = 9.49 x 10<sup>-322</sup>), indicating its potential role in population-based genetic studies.
title: Mapping Epigenetic Gene Variant Dynamics: Comparative Analysis of Frequency, Functional Impact and Trait Associations in African and European Populations

finding: Rs4744112 was identified as a T1D specific locus that influenced the proportion of CCR6+ CXCR3+ CCR4- T helper 1 cells, with the minor allele G associated with a decrease in these cells compared to the major allele T.
title: Genetic factors affecting immune phenotypes in type 1 diabetes

finding: The rs7034200 SNP, located at the GLIS3 locus, exhibited significant discordant effects on birth weight depending on whether it was inherited from the mother or the fetus. In this study, it was associated with an increased offspring birth weight in the maternal genome, while showing a decreased birth weight effect when present in the fetal genome (p-value<sub>2df</sub> = 1.15 × 10<sup>−12</sup>). The locus is known for its relation to type 2 diabetes and pancreatic beta cell function.
title: Direct and INdirect effects analysis of Genetic lOci (DINGO): A software package to increase the power of locus discovery in GWAS meta-analyses of perinatal phenotypes and traits influenced by indirect genetic effects
