finding: The SNP rs11244061 showed the strongest association with COVID-19 hospitalization, localized near the ABO gene at locus 9q34.2, with a P-value of 3.64×10^-28. This indicated a shared genetic basis for COVID-19 hospitalization and VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs550057 was strongly associated with SARS-CoV-2 infection and was located near the ABO gene at locus 9q34.2, with a P-value of 1.56×10^-51. This finding further supported the genetic link between SARS-CoV-2 infection, COVID-19 traits, and VTE.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs149181677 was identified as having a significant association with VTE, being located in the ADAMTS13 gene on chromosome 9. However, its direct linkage to COVID-19 traits was not detailed.
title: Shared genetic etiology and causality between COVID-19 and venous thromboembolism: evidence from genome-wide cross trait analysis and bi-directional Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs3217992 was one of the variants associated with cardiometabolic multimorbidity (CMM) trajectories, being part of the CDKN2B-AS1 gene, which had multiple unique SNPs related to type II diabetes (T2D). This association was part of a broader context linking genetic predisposition to CMM risk.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: The SNP rs4977574 was identified as a significant genetic variant associated with CMM trajectories. It was part of the CDKN2B-AS1 gene, relevant to both ischemic heart disease (IHD) and T2D, indicating its role in contributing to the risk of developing CMM.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: The SNP rs7859727 was another variant located within the CDKN2B-AS1 gene that showed nominal association with CMM trajectories. Its identification highlighted the importance of this gene in the context of genetic predisposition toward multiple cardiometabolic diseases.
title: Long-term air pollution, cardiometabolic multimorbidity, and genetic susceptibility: a multi-state modeling study of 415,855 participants

finding: The rs2891168 variant was identified as part of the CDKN2B-AS1 locus and showed significant interaction effects with the SIX6 locus variants on POAG-related gene expression.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The rs10811650 SNP is associated with multiple vascular and neoplastic traits, with analyses revealing that it interacts with the SIX6 locus SNP rs33912345, affecting the expression of associated genes, implicating it in POAG pathogenesis.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: This exonic variant in the CDKN2B-AS1 locus was pivotal in trait associations identified, demonstrating its role in the genetic architecture of POAG.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel ancestry-specific primary open-angle glaucoma loci and shared biology with vascular mechanisms and cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs2383207, associated with cyclin dependent kinase inhibitor (CDKN2A/CDKN2B), was significantly linked to ischemic stroke (IS) in the same population, suggesting its role in the genetic susceptibility to IS.
title: Integrative genetic analysis reveals new relationships between intraocular pressure, glaucoma and ischemic stroke risk: A study based on combined SNP-to-gene, mendelian randomization and pathway investigations

finding: The pLoF variant rs74853476 in the gene DBH was associated with a decrease in diastolic blood pressure (DBP) by 1.2 mmHg for carriers of one copy. This variant was characterized as pathogenic in ClinVar and linked to reduced BP.
title: Association analyses of predicted loss-of-function variants prioritized 15 genes as blood pressure regulators

finding: This SNP located in the 3’ untranslated region of CACNA1B suggested it may increase risk of BD through enhanced cortical expression of the gene.
title: Fine-mapping genomic loci refines bipolar disorder risk genes

finding: The lnc-ABCA1-1:1 lincRNA RP11-217B7.2 was identified in the shared POAG and IOP locus on chromosome 10 for the variant rs2472494.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: Similar to rs2472494, the lnc-ABCA1-1:1 lincRNA RP11-217B7.2 was noted for its involvement in the shared POAG and IOP locus.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: Identified as the most significant NTG association, this variant colocalized with eQTLs for CDKN2A and CDKN2B-AS1, linking increased expression to POAG risk.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: This SNP was connected to POAG, with significant changes related to the CDKN2B eQTL influencing the risk for this phenotype.
title: Integrating genetic regulation and single-cell expression with GWAS prioritizes causal genes and cell types for glaucoma

finding: The rs558240 SNP at the ABO locus was identified as the lead SNP significantly associated with Endoglin plasma levels (p = 4.25 x 10^-262). It contributed to approximately 5% of the inter-individual variability of ENG plasma levels.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The intronic rs10987756 SNP in the ENG gene ranked third among loci associated with Endoglin plasma levels (p = 2.35 x 10^-13). This finding highlighted its role in the modulation of Endoglin levels.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs2519093 SNP at the ABO locus was genetically characterized as A1 blood group and associations with Endoglin levels highlighted blood group polymorphisms' involvement in Endoglin regulation.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs1053878 SNP, linked to the A2 blood group at the ABO locus, was involved in the variance of Endoglin levels, shedding light on blood group genetic predispositions.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs8176743 variant associated with the B blood group was found to influence Endoglin plasma levels, reinforcing the genetic links between blood types and Endoglin regulation.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs8176719 SNP linked to the O1 blood group contributed to differences in Endoglin levels, displaying the genetic diversity in blood group-related Endoglin regulation.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs41302905 variant, associated with the O2 blood group at ABO, illustrated further genetic factors influencing Endoglin plasma levels in relation to blood group phenotypes.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The rs943786398 variant, creating a uCUG-initiated upORF, was identified in two unrelated patients with suspected HHT. The variant was classified as a variant of uncertain significance (VUS) in ClinVar and has been associated with atypical HHT presentations.
title: Unveiling Endoglin non canonical regulation: spotlight on the new role of the uPAR pathway

finding: The SNP rs558240 was highlighted as the lead variant at the ABO locus with a significant association (p=4.25e-262) to Endoglin plasma levels in a meta-analysis of two GWAS involving 46,091 healthy individuals.
title: Unveiling Endoglin non canonical regulation: spotlight on the new role of the uPAR pathway

finding: The rs10987756 variant linked to the ENG locus showed a significant association (p=2.35e-43) with Endoglin levels, reinforcing the role of ENG variants in regulating plasma Endoglin.
title: Unveiling Endoglin non canonical regulation: spotlight on the new role of the uPAR pathway

finding: The SNP rs77641763, situated within the EXD3 gene on chromosome 9q34.3, exhibited a highly significant association with hip pain, with a p value of 2.20 x 10^-13. This finding was original and indicative of a potential relationship between genetic variants in the EXD3 gene and hip pain.
title: A genome-wide association study identifies genetic variants associated with hip pain in the UK Biobank cohort (N=221,127)

finding: The variant rs10988865 near NR4A3 was significantly associated with testosterone in men (β = -0.0161, P = 4.33E-08), indicating its role in the hormonal pathways affecting reproductive health.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The ABO locus variant rs9411378 was found to affect Covid-19 susceptibility with an OR of 1.10 and a P-value of 7.36×10⁻¹⁰. The association was notably more significant in men compared to women (P=0.01).
title: A year of COVID-19 GWAS results from the GRASP portal reveals potential SARS-CoV-2 modifiers

finding: Variant rs3010439 interacted significantly with a fruit and vegetable dietary pattern, indicating that higher intake of these foods was associated with lower HbA1c values, especially in individuals with certain genotypes. The effect size was enhanced in alternate allele homozygotes, suggesting a potential protective effect.
title: Genome-wide gene-diet interaction analysis in the UK Biobank identifies novel effects on Hemoglobin A1c

finding: This SNP shows evidence of colocalisation with cis-eQTL signals for the LMX1B gene, which is linked to Nail-patella syndrome, an important factor in limb development.
title: Investigation of the genetic architecture of cam morphology, and its relationship with hip osteoarthritis, using alpha angle as a proxy measure

finding: An intergenic variant located approximately 18 kb upstream of IL33, attributed increased association significance in the meta-analysis, achieving a PIP of 1.0.
title: Meta-analysis fine-mapping is often miscalibrated at single-variant resolution

finding: The minor allele of a rare nonsynonymous variant in DBH (rs3025380) was associated with lower blood pressure, indicating its potential protective effect against hypertension.
title: Analysis of 200,000 exome-sequenced UK Biobank subjects implicates genes involved in increased and decreased risk of hypertension

finding: The missense variant in DBH was found to reduce the risk of hypertension, revealing its protective role against cardiovascular disease.
title: Genetic associations of protein-coding variants in human disease

finding: This SNP was part of the replicated loci in the analysis, reinforcing its significance within the genetic landscape of age-related ocular diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: For rs657152 located near the ABO gene on 9q34.2, 40 novel phenotype associations were identified, with individuals carrying the A risk allele demonstrating significantly higher odds of heart failure (OR 1.09, 95% CI 1.03-1.14, q=0.004), diabetes mellitus (OR 1.05, 95% CI 1.02-1.07, q=0.004), and hypercholesterolemia (OR 1.04, 95% CI 1.02-1.06, q=6.3×10⁻⁵). This SNP's association with severe COVID-19 was established in previous studies.
title: A Phenome Wide Association Study of Severe COVID-19 Genetic Risk Variants

finding: The study found that the FOXE1 polymorphism rs965513 was associated with an increased predisposition to thyroid cancer in a European cohort. This finding relates to the context of follicular thyroid carcinoma (FTC), highlighting the impact of FOXE1 dysregulation linked to NF-κB-mediated inflammation disrupting thyroid-specific signaling pathways.
title: NF-κB Mediated Thyroid Inflammation and Its Implications for the Risk of Follicular Thyroid Carcinoma: a systematic review

finding: The SNP rs13301996 was associated with waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for body mass index (WHRadjBMI) in both combined sexes and was shown to replicate in an independent sample of African American individuals (P=2.88×10^-8). This SNP is located intronically within CDK5RAP2 and was significantly associated with the expression of multiple genes in various tissues, indicating a potential regulatory role.
title: Genome-wide association study of body fat distribution traits in Hispanics/Latinos from the HCHS/SOL Study

finding: The variant rs57862396 on chromosome 9 replicated for the FEV1/FVC phenotype, where the T (alternate) allele was associated with a slower rate of FEV1/FVC decline, resulting in a 0.48% per year attenuation in the discovery cohorts (p-discovery=3.939E-08) and a 0.13% per year attenuation in the replication cohorts (p-replication=0.011).
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study reveals novel genetic signals for lung function decline

finding: Located in an intron of the PTPRD gene, this SNP was associated with both TR and THR outcomes in naltrexone-treated patients, displaying a p-value of 7.7E-08 for TR and 6.1E-08 for THR, with hazard ratios of 2.2 and 2.4 respectively.
title: Genetic Contributions to Alcohol Use Disorder Treatment Outcomes: A Genome-wide Pharmacogenomics Study

finding: The <italic>C9orf72</italic> gene, where this SNP is located, had a significant finding in the study. This SNP was part of a pathogenic <italic>C9orf72</italic> hexanucleotide repeat expansion, identified in 24 out of 34 participants carrying pathogenic variants. The association was noted particularly among both sporadic and familial cases of MND.
title: Genetics of Motor Neuron Disease in New Zealand

finding: The A allele at rs35209758 was associated with lower levels of OMD, while also being linked to increased Asporin and Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34, providing insights into the biological pathways influenced by metformin.
title: The Effect of Metformin Treatment on the Circulating Proteome

finding: The rs113985677 variant in CCIN was significantly associated with Tamoxifen response (p=3.68x10-7). This missense variant was discussed in the context of its role in altering cytoskeleton dynamics during epithelial to mesenchymal transition (EMT), which is relevant for drug response.
title: Exome-wide association study reveals 7 functional variants associated with ex-vivo drug response in acute myeloid leukaemia patients

finding: This SNP was confirmed to be genome-wide significantly associated with pancreatic cancer (P<3.84×10^-5) in this meta-analysis.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population

finding: The variant rs193181528 in the JAK2 gene was associated with an increase in AAA prevalence, with a p-value of 3.26 x 10^-8 and an odds ratio of 2.776, suggesting a risk factor for the condition.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: The SNP rs73493041, associated with the SNORA26/C9orf170 gene, demonstrated significant 1df interactions with short sleep duration (STST) in the primary analysis of 62,969 individuals and was replicated in 59,296 individuals. It was also identified as an eQTL for the GAS1 gene and significantly linked to self-reported chronotype, suggesting a connection between sleep patterns and elevated blood pressure through circadian preference mechanisms.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide gene-sleep interactions identify novel loci for blood pressure

finding: The SNP rs524137 was located 11.5 kb downstream of GFI1B and was found to have trans-regulatory effects on 569 differentially expressed genes, suggesting a broad impact on gene expression related to blood traits. Among these genes, 321 were replicated in prior studies targeting the rs524137 locus.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: The SNP rs73660574 was identified as a weaker, intronic enhancer for GFI1B and influenced the expression of 28 differentially expressed genes. Notably, 24 of these genes were also affected by the perturbation of rs524137, indicating shared regulatory mechanisms.
title: Discovery of target genes and pathways of blood trait loci using pooled CRISPR screens and single cell RNA sequencing

finding: The SNP rs10758656 was shown to interact with JAK2, affecting its expression and chromatin accessibility, confirming its role in red blood cell traits and potential functions in erythropoietin signaling.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: This synonymous SNP in the PAPPA gene transcript was previously identified and was mentioned in relation to cerebellar-specific interactions and its significant association with cerebellar volume.
title: Identifying genetic variants associated with cerebellar volume in 33,265 individuals from the UK-Biobank

finding: The alternative A allele of rs10821415 was associated with decreased H3K27ac peak height within a C9orf3 intron, with a trend observed for reduced gene expression.
title: Disease and phenotype relevant genetic variants identified from histone acetylomes in human hearts

finding: The SNP rs7040887 was associated with a variant of HPV16 that exhibited early integration into the host genome, leading to a transcriptomic profile marked by increased proliferation and chromosomal instability. This was linked to a high incidence of cervical cancer, indicating the SNP's potential role in the pathogenesis of HPV-related cancers.
title: Human papillomavirus type 16 sub-lineages and integration in cancer

finding: The SNP rs73581580 was associated with chronic back pain in the discovery cohort, indicating its relevance to pain perception and chronic pain conditions.
title: Analysis of genetically independent phenotypes identifies shared genetic factors associated with chronic musculoskeletal pain at different anatomic sites

finding: This SNP was associated with the TEK gene, an angiopoietin-1 receptor critical for blood vessel growth, and linked to AML.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The missense variant rs551564683 (p.Asn352Ser) in the B4GALT1 gene was found to be strongly associated with a decrease of 13.5 mg/dl in LDL-C and 26 mg/dl in fibrinogen levels. This finding was obtained from a study of 5,890 OOA subjects and was supported by linkage disequilibrium analysis revealing it as the sole causal variant in its region.
title: Genetic and functional evidence relates a missense variant in B4GALT1 to lower LDL-C and fibrinogen

finding: The study identified that the TLR4 variant rs41426344 was associated with increased susceptibility to rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) in a central south Chinese Han population. This finding was significant as it related to the broader context of TLR4+ T cells' roles in RA pathogenesis.
title: Direct tissue sensing reprograms TLR4+ Tfh-like cells inflammatory profile in the joints of rheumatoid arthritis patients

finding: The SNP rs10979182 showed strong long-range interactions with the KLF4 gene, confirming it as a critical regulatory SNP linked to psoriasis, with studies demonstrating enhanced KLF4 expression in stimulated cells after CRISPR activation.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: The SNP rs6477612, located within the third enhancer, exhibited the highest regulatory potential and was linked to interactions with KLF4, ultimately contributing to a significant increase in KLF4 expression upon enhancer activation in HaCaT cells.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: The SNP rs62541556 was identified as a germline SNP in JAK2 that tagged the 46/1 haplotype implicated in myeloproliferative neoplasms (MPNs), showing a significant association with an increased susceptibility to V617F-mutant clonal hematopoiesis, with a p-value of 8.85E-21.
title: Iron homeostasis governs erythroid phenotype in Polycythemia Vera

finding: The variant rs811688 was identified as a prioritized candidate contact within a stretch of interactions involving the PAPPA promoter at the risk locus 9q33.1 in MCF7 breast cancer cells. This SNP is linked to an increased risk of breast cancer, specifically due to its association with PAPPA, which plays a role in the insulin-like growth factor system and is overexpressed in luminal B breast tumors.
title: Chromatin interactome mapping at 139 independent breast cancer risk signals

finding: This SNP colocalized with the sQTL for CDKN2B-AS1 at the 9p21 CAD locus, suggesting a significant role in the splicing regulation of CAD risk-related transcripts in SMCs.
title: Genetic regulation of human aortic smooth muscle cell gene expression and splicing predict causal coronary artery disease genes

finding: The rs602075 SNP was associated with the abundance of the genus Allisonella (P=3.57×10−8), implicating its role in the microbial landscape through potential interactions with host metabolism.
title: Large-scale association analyses identify host factors influencing human gut microbiome composition

finding: A specific RBP (QKI) demonstrated differential binding to the SNP harboring lncRNA compared to the WT sequence, though no significant docking score difference was found.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The SNP rs2519093 was identified as a trans pQTL on E-selectin and other proteins, and was linked to the ABO locus which is known to affect multiple metabolic-related conditions.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: SNP rs8176741 was associated with multiple trans effects on proteins such as Tie-1, and suggested to influence binding sites for transcription factors, implicating complex regulatory roles.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The minor C allele of the SNP rs7873784 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis and Type 2 diabetes mellitus, suggesting its contribution to inflammatory and metabolic processes relevant to coronary artery disease.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The ABCA1 rs2230806 variant was confirmed to have an association with coronary artery disease risk, underscoring its relevance in lipid metabolism and cardiovascular risks.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs913588, reflecting a previously reported AAM signal in KDM4C encoding a lysine-specific demethylase, was recognized as a non-synonymous variant significantly related to male puberty timing.
title: Expanded genomic analyses for male voice-breaking highlights a shared phenotypic and genetic basis between puberty timing and hair colour

finding: The SNP rs4143815 in the CD274 gene was found to decrease in frequency moving from sub-Saharan Africa to Latin America, hinting at its impact on the immune response variability to ZIKV.
title: Hypothetical Human Immune Genome Complex Gradient May Help to Explain the Congenital Zika Symdrome Catastrophe in Brazil: A New Theory

finding: The SNP rs10988589, located in the GPR107 gene on chr9:130092203 with a minor allele frequency of 0.227, was found to be the most important feature when merging exome and metabolome data. This suggested its potential as a biomarker for developmental dyslexia.
title: A data-fusion approach to identifying developmental dyslexia from multi-omics datasets

finding: The SNP rs1563 was identified as an original finding in the metabolic reconstruction of maize metabolism, which demonstrated its significance in plant metabolic processes. The context of this finding was associated with the genome-scale metabolic model for Zea mays, highlighting the complexities and interrelations in metabolic pathways that could also inform studies related to other plant species, including Quercus suber.
title: iEC7871 Quercus suber model: the first multi-tissue diel cycle genome-scale metabolic model of a woody tree

finding: The study linked a homozygous nonsense variant (c.802C>T; p.Arg268*) in the WDR31 gene to a typical ciliopathy phenotype. This variant, identified in a male patient, was associated with multiple clinical features such as renal agenesis, congenital hydrocephalus, right microtia, right preaxial polydactyly, and congenital heart disease. It was categorized as a rare mutation (MAF 0.0000239 in gnomAD) and confirmed through Sanger sequencing to be present in the affected male, while his parents and two unaffected sisters were heterozygous carriers.
title: WDR31 is a novel ciliopathy protein displaying functional redundancy with GTPase-activating proteins ELMOD and RP2 in recruiting BBSome to cilium

finding: The study identified an association between the thyroid cancer polygenic risk score (PRS) and BRAF somatic mutations. It was suggested that the presence of specific germline alleles at rs1588635 could influence the likelihood of acquiring a BRAF mutation, which is linked to a higher risk of developing thyroid cancer.
title: The landscape of interactions between cancer polygenic risk scores and somatic alterations in cancer cells

finding: At the PTPRD locus, the SNP rs7870388 showed a significant association with disease pseudotime in the ROS/MAP cohort (p = 1.31 x 10^-6). This locus was linked to susceptibility to neurofibrillary tangles independent of amyloid deposition.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: SNP rs8176685 appeared to correlate with pancreatic fat (p-value = 1.6e-12, beta = 0.077) and showed a connection with lipid levels.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: This SNP was associated with increased CT in MDD, illustrating its contribution to morphological brain changes.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: This SNP associated with greater SA in BD indicated its potential impacts on structural brain measures.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Associated with higher CT in BD, showcasing its potential links to genetic influences in psychiatric structures.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The rs10757274 SNP (A>G) on chromosome 9p21 was associated with an approximate 30% increase in coronary heart disease (CHD) risk, acting independently of traditional lipid risk factors. Analysis showed that individuals homozygous for the GG genotype had significantly reduced levels of lysophospholipids (lysoPLs) and lysophosphatidic acids (lysoPAs), with metabolic dysregulation observed, indicated by the uncoupling of lysoPL-lysoPA interconversion from autotaxin (ATX) levels. Additionally, the presence of the risk allele was correlated with altered expression of several lipid metabolism enzymes in vascular smooth muscle cells (VSMCs) derived from individuals with the risk genotype, suggesting that the biological mechanism behind the increased risk involves complex alterations in immune-bioactive phospholipid metabolism regulated through ANRIL.
title: Metabolic dysregulation of the lysophospholipid/autotaxin axis in the chromosome 9p21 gene SNP rs10757274

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) with a P-value of 8.99×10⁻⁷², indicating its relevance in coagulation pathways.
title: Phenome-wide association study of a comprehensive health check-up database in a Korea population: Clinical application & trans-ethnic comparison

finding: The SNP rs3793577 was identified to be associated with sociability, residing within the ELAVL2 gene. This gene is a neural-specific RNA-binding protein linked to MDD, reinforcing the relationship between sociability and mental health disorders.
title: Genetic underpinnings of sociability in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs7020813 was associated with variations in voltage-gated ion channel activity, influencing cancer cell proliferation. It was identified in a study by Rao et al. (2015) that investigated the role of ion channels in cancer, linking genetic variations to the regulation of hERG activity, which is critical for cellular functions and could affect tumor growth.
title: Mechanism of hERG inhibition by gating-modifier toxin, APETx1, deduced by functional characterization

finding: At a B cell-specific site, rs13294415 was identified as a caQTL with significant effects (π=0.79, q-value=0.003) that were attributable to its specific activity in B cells.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The SNP rs10821415, found within the <italic>C9orf3</italic>-AF region, was confirmed to be associated with AF. Studies showed that this SNP correlated with lower expression of <italic>C9orf3</italic> in atrial tissue, suggesting its regulatory function in the context of cardiac arrhythmias.
title: Systematic in vivo interrogation identifies novel enhancers and silencers associated to Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The study confirmed that the SNP rs1563963464 was associated with Ataxia-oculomotor apraxia syndrome. This mutation was predicted to significantly alter RNA binding affinity to U2AF2, a pre-mRNA splicing factor, and the experimental validation using EMSA demonstrated a change in binding between U2AF2 and RNA due to this mutation. This finding highlighted the mutation's role in disrupting normal protein functionality, thereby contributing to the disease mechanism.
title: Reformer: Deep learning model for characterizing protein-RNA interactions from sequence at single-base resolution

finding: This SNP was associated with a range of coronary heart disease traits, showing consistent high correlations across the related phenotypes.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: This SNP was associated with HDL and total cholesterol, demonstrating moderate connections with myocardial infarction.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The common variant rs1333048, located in the 9p21 region, was significantly associated with prevalent CHD, indicating its potential role in increasing heart disease risk.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs4977574 in the 9p21 region was significantly associated with prevalent CHD, contributing to the understanding of genetic predispositions to heart disease.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs10757278 in the 9p21 locus was associated with incident MI, emphasizing its relevance in cardiovascular events.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs1333049, also within the 9p21 region, was significantly associated with incident MI, supporting its contribution to the risk of future heart attacks.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The T2D risk allele rs4744423 (T) was linked to increased chromatin accessibility of a cytokine-induced CRE and was predicted to enhance BATF binding, leading to the upregulation of the gene AOPEP, associated with protein metabolism under cytokine stress conditions.
title: Comparative Multi-omic Mapping of Human Pancreatic Islet Endoplasmic Reticulum and Cytokine Stress Responses Provides Insights into Type 2 Diabetes Genetics

finding: The SNP rs657152 was identified at locus 9q34.2 in the same GWAS involving severe COVID-19 patients. It was associated with increased severity of the disease.
title: Human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 severity are enriched in immune and epithelium regulatory networks

finding: The rs631287 (G/A) variant was mapped as a puQTL associated with the minor promoter of the MAPKAP1 gene with a significant P-value of 1.64 x 10^-38 but showed no association with overall gene expression (P = 0.046). It was found to be associated with a GWAS link to diverticular disease.
title: Mapping of promoter usage QTL using RNA-seq data reveals their contributions to complex traits

finding: This SNP was identified as a novel signal of selection, contributing to the expanded understanding of selective pressures within the population.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: This missense mutation involved in TLR4 gene was crucial for its association with susceptibility to malaria, marking its significance within the context of population immunity.
title: Scalable probabilistic PCA for large-scale genetic variation data

finding: The SNP rs7020815 was associated with the detection and management of breast cancer, specifically implicating age-related effects. It contributed to understanding how age influences tumor characteristics in patients.
title: Age and obesity-driven changes in the extracellular matrix of the primary tumor and metastatic site influence tumor invasion and metastatic outgrowth

finding: The SNP rs1023000, associated with the FNBP1 gene, was identified as associated with sensitivity to uprosertib. This finding came from a quantitative trait locus (QTL) analysis that revealed associations between signaling features and 55 SNPs and 38 copy number variations (CNVs).
title: Deciphering the Signaling Network Landscape of Breast Cancer Improves Drug Sensitivity Prediction

finding: The variant rs2491353 was associated with the CRB2 locus and was included in the 99% credible set for T2D risk variants. It was observed to overlap with transcription factor binding sites, supporting its role in the regulation of pancreatic developmental processes relevant to T2D.
title: Pancreatic progenitor epigenome maps prioritize type 2 diabetes risk genes with roles in development

finding: The rs28592848 SNP showed a genome-wide significant eQTL signal associated with the PTGDS gene, which was upregulated in islets from T2D donors. It correlated significantly with INS expression and was also suggestively associated with acute insulin response and peak insulin response during intravenous glucose tolerance test (IVGTT) with p-values of 8.65 x 10^-4 and 7.40 x 10^-4 respectively.
title: Islet Gene View - a tool to facilitate islet research

finding: Similar to rs28592848, the rs28375538 SNP also showed a genome-wide significant eQTL signal related to PTGDS expression. The expression of PTGDS was positively correlated with BMI and INS expression, providing insight into its role in the context of T2D related phenotypes.
title: Islet Gene View - a tool to facilitate islet research

finding: The SNP rs146597587, a splice-site variant in IL33, showed a protective effect against asthma with a significant association (p=8.0×10^-10, OR=0.58). This finding underlined its role as a protective variant in early-onset asthma cases.
title: A broad exome study of the genetic architecture of asthma reveals novel patient subgroups

finding: The SNP rs10120484 was associated with the glucocorticoid receptor (GR) signaling pathway, which was significantly more expressed in Sarcomatoid Urothelial Bladder Cancer (SARC) samples compared to conventional urothelial carcinoma (UroCa) samples. This study's findings suggested that variants like rs10120484 may play a role in SARC progression and response to targeted therapies based on GR signaling.
title: Patient-derived organoids identify tailored therapeutic options and determinants of plasticity in sarcomatoid urothelial bladder cancer

finding: The study identified rs7034653 as a causal variant within the TRAF1/C5 locus that mediates risk for both juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). The G risk allele was linked to reduced binding of the transcription factor FRA2, resulting in lower TRAF1 expression and increased TNF production in monocytes.
title: Identification of a regulatory pathway governing TRAF1 via an arthritis-associated non-coding variant

finding: SNP rs7039505 was confirmed as a causal variant associated with JIA, achieving significant association with a p-value of 2.39 × 10^-7. It was revealed that this SNP resided in close physical proximity to other variants previously associated with JIA and RA.
title: Identification of a regulatory pathway governing TRAF1 via an arthritis-associated non-coding variant

finding: This SNP in the ABO locus was associated with pancreatic fat and had connections to cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: Associated with pancreatic fat, this SNP tagged the A1 allele, relevant in lipid metabolism.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI

finding: The finding indicated that maternal alcohol consumption modified the genetic relative risk (GRR) at SNP rs4621895. Without genetic structure adjustment, maternal alcohol consumption increased the GRR by approximately 2.1 for all trios. However, after adjusting for population structure, it was found that the GRR decreased by a factor of 0.73 for East Asian trios and increased by 2.4 for European trios, suggesting a significant effect of population ancestry on the interaction.
title: Inference of gene-environment interaction from heterogeneous case-parent trios

finding: The analysis of SNP rs2780841 revealed that the confidence intervals for the East Asian trios covered one, indicating no significant interaction there, whereas for the European trios, it did not cover one, indicating a significant interaction. This suggests that the gene-environment interaction related to maternal alcohol consumption was primarily observed in European ancestry trios.
title: Inference of gene-environment interaction from heterogeneous case-parent trios

finding: The variant rs8176747 (Gly267Ala) was one of the SNVs used to infer A antigen expression, contributing to a high concordance of 98% for blood type inference.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs8176746 (Leu265Met) was utilized in inferring B antigen expression, aiding in achieving a concordance of 98% during blood type inference.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The variant rs8176719 (Thr87AspfsTer107) was important in the inference of O antigen; it was primarily linked with A antigen expression but caused discordance in findings. It was confirmed that an individual was heterozygous for this variant.
title: Characterization of Blood Group Variants in an Omani Population by Comparison of Whole Genome Sequencing and Serology

finding: The SNP rs581080 in the TTC39B gene was found to be associated with serum lipid levels and the risk of coronary artery disease (CAD). This finding was contextualized within the analysis of genetically determined HDL characteristics that were investigated for their independent association with CAD.
title: High-density lipoprotein characteristics and coronary heart disease: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs579459, located near the ABO gene, was identified as one of the key variants contributing to the protective effect of elevated ALP against preeclampsia with an overall OR of 0.89 (0.82-0.97), p=0.008. Carriers of the C-allele, which corresponds to blood group A, were noted to have increased LDL cholesterol and a higher risk of adverse cardiac outcomes, linking this SNP to cardiovascular traits that may influence preeclampsia risk.
title: Risk of preeclampsia in patients with genetic predisposition to common medical conditions: a case-control study

finding: The variant rs7848647 was identified at the TNFSF15 locus, which demonstrated a genetic association with IBD. This SNP also exhibited significant correlations with chromatin accessibility and TNFSF15 expression levels in LCLs.
title: Chromatin accessibility variation provides insights into missing regulation underlying immune-mediated diseases

finding: The SNP rs1563 was found to be associated with the maize metabolic reconstruction in the work published by Saha et al. (2011). This finding related to the metabolic pathways in Zea mays and underscored its relevance in genome-scale metabolic models, contributing to the understanding of metabolic behavior under varying environmental conditions.
title: iEC7871 Quercus suber model: the first multi-tissue diel cycle genome-scale metabolic model of a woody tree

finding: The SNP rs1412832 was situated in the CDKN2B-AS1/ANRIL gene and showed a genome-wide significant association with increased risk of developing pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, as reported by Giaccherini et al.
title: Explainable models using transcription factor binding and epigenome patterns at promoters reveal disease-associated genes and their regulators in the context of cell-types

finding: The SNP rs7029757 was identified as having a potential association with various tissues but was not linked to any known traits at the time.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs8176685 had associations (p=1.6e-12, beta=0.077 for pancreatic fat) and colocalized with various cardiovascular traits.
title: Systematic quantification of health parameters from UK Biobank abdominal MRI using deep learning

finding: The SNP rs10121905 was associated with urbanization impacts on vegetation phenology in China. The finding highlighted that this SNP played a role in the phenological response of vegetation to urbanization, indicating changes in timing related to the seasonal onset of vegetation.
title: The phenological response of European vegetation to urbanisation is mediated by macrobioclimatic factors

finding: Identified at the 9p21 locus, this variant related to ANRIL/CDKN2B-AS1 maps to peaks shared across SMC, fibroblast, and pericyte cell types, highlighting its role in CAD.
title: Cell-specific chromatin landscape of human coronary artery resolves regulatory mechanisms of disease risk

finding: Associated as a trans pQTL within the ABO region, located 141Kb upstream of ADAMTS13, impacting the levels of the VWF protein.
title: Genetic regulation of the human plasma proteome in 54,306 UK Biobank participants

finding: The SNP rs357564 was highlighted with the highest XPEHH score of 4.5412 within the PTCH1 gene located on chromosome 9, relating to adaptive pigmentation phenotypes.
title: Genomic insights into the population history and biological adaptation of Southwestern Chinese Hmong-Mien people

finding: The SNP rs17180299 was identified in the context of a study examining the genetic factors influencing the plasma concentrations of methadone enantiomers in heroin-dependent patients. This genetic variation related to opioid response was discussed in the broader context of substance use traits, suggesting it might play a role in the heritable risk architectures within the reward circuitry of the brain.
title: Single Nucleus Transcriptomics Reveals Pervasive Glial Activation in Opioid Overdose Cases

finding: The SNP rs3847302 was located within a NR-specific enhancer region and was known to be associated with HDL cholesterol levels. Further analysis indicated that this SNP might disrupt binding with key transcription factors such as HNF4A, highlighting its potential contribution to NASH resistance.
title: Super-enhancer signature reveals key mechanisms associated with resistance to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis in humans with obesity

finding: As a T2D GWAS variant, rs10811660 was linked to decreased chromatin accessibility in INShigh beta cells, affecting the regulation of the gene CDKN2A. The risk allele G was associated with increased MAFA binding which further upregulated CDKN2A expression, implicating its role in T2D risk.
title: Deconvolution of polygenic risk score in single cells unravels cellular and molecular heterogeneity of complex human diseases

finding: This SNP was associated with alkaline phosphatase (beta=0.096, p=3.69×10^-116), emphasizing its role in metabolic phenotypes.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: Significantly associated with coronary artery disease, this SNP formed part of the evidence linking archaic introgression to cardiovascular traits.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: The polymorphism rs10811661 upstream of the CDKN2A/2B gene was found to be associated with gestational diabetes mellitus in women, suggesting a genetic link that may influence GDM risk.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: This SNP coincided with a GWAS peak for Parkinson's disease, implicating its role in disease pathways through altered ASM.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The rs7856850 SNP, located in an intron of the gene PTPRD, was significantly associated with obsessive-compulsive (OC) traits at a genome-wide significance level (p=2.48×10-8). It was additionally associated with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) in a meta-analysis of three independent case/control datasets (p=0.0069). This SNP represented the first validated genome-wide significant variant for OC traits, indicating that there is shared genetic risk between OC traits measured in community samples and clinical OCD.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pediatric Obsessive-Compulsive Traits: Shared Genetic Risk between Traits and Disorder

finding: The SNP rs10120514 was identified in the context of racial disparities in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC), particularly highlighting how obesity, biology, and socioeconomic factors contributed to the complexities of TNBC in African American women. This finding provided significant insights into potential risk factors associated with this genetic variant, suggesting a critical role in understanding the poor prognosis and therapeutic responses in this demographic.
title: Integrative spatial omics reveals distinct tumor-promoting multicellular niches and immunosuppressive mechanisms in African American and European American patients with TNBC

finding: The SNP rs1572905 was associated with differences in the analysis of prime editing (PE) modifications in samples analyzed by CRISPR-A and CRISPResso2. In cases where SNP rs1572905 was identified, CRISPResso2 reported a high number of reads classified as having reference modifications or as having modifications due to SNPs, which contributed to discrepancies in the classification of editing outcomes. This resulted in CRISPR-A reporting higher editing percentages for template-based edition in several cases, indicating that the presence of this SNP negatively impacted the efficiency of CRISPResso2's analysis, especially when dealing with templates shorter than 13 nucleotides.
title: CRISPR-Analytics (CRISPR-A): a platform for precise analytics and simulations for gene editing

finding: The dynamic eQTL for GADD45G indicated that individuals homozygous for the G allele experienced rapid decreases in gene expression during the dexamethasone response pseudotime, with association to environmental stress responses and diseases like asthma.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs146597587 was identified as a driver variant for LOSF variants in the gene IL33, which was associated with eosinophil counts in sequential analysis.
title: Whole exome sequencing and characterization of coding variation in 49,960 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The study identified rs10114470 as a high-confidence fine-mapped Crohn's disease (CD)-associated variant located in the 3' UTR of the TL1A gene, which encodes a TNF family cytokine crucial for ILC3 proliferation and cytokine production. This variant was revealed to have a significant functional implication in CD, suggesting its potential as a target for therapeutic intervention in inflammatory bowel disease.
title: High-resolution promoter interaction analysis in Type 3 Innate Lymphoid Cells implicates Batten Disease gene CLN3 in Crohn’s Disease aetiology

finding: This SNP showed a strong association with Bifidobacterium bifidum, exhibiting a significant p-value of 5.5×10^-15, indicating a robust genetic influence of the ABO locus on specific gut microbial taxa.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: Associated with Collinsella aerofaciens, rs550057 demonstrated a significant association (p-value of 2.0×10^-8). Findings indicated that SNPs at the ABO locus had an important impact on the microbial composition.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: This SNP was linked to the metabolic pathway for lactose and galactose degradation with a p-value of 5.38×10^-15, suggesting its relevance in microbial metabolic functions associated with diet.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: This intronic variant in the AKNA gene was associated with lower levels of glucosylceramide species with longer acyl chains, supporting its regulatory role.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: This SNP was associated with increased BMI and diabetes risk, particularly in individuals with low exercise levels, suggesting that physical activity significantly influenced the effect of rs4743930 on these traits. It regulated the BARX1 gene, a critical player in Wnt signaling pathways related to obesity and diabetes.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: The O blood group-encoding mutation rs8176719 was identified to have a significant protective effect against severe malaria, particularly in African populations, with variations showing opposite effects in populations like Papua New Guinea.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: The SNP rs28368130 at chromosome 9p21 was definitively associated with primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) and was found to influence the expression of the gene CDKN2B in the retinal ganglion cell 1 (RGC1) population, with a disease-status false discovery rate p-value of 4.67×10^-4.
title: Retinal ganglion cell-specific genetic regulation in primary open angle glaucoma

finding: An intronic variant in LPAR1 gene associated with EHR-OSA in the Geisinger dataset (beta=0.05, p=3.57x10^-2).
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The SNP rs2997560 was associated with predicted changes in chromatin information enrichment (CIE) specifically in pancreatic islets. The analysis indicated that variations in f-VICE (a measure of TF-chromatin interaction) correlated with the genotype at this SNP, suggesting that this genetic variation influenced chromatin accessibility and regulatory dynamics within those cell types.
title: Chromatin information content landscapes inform transcription factor and DNA interactions

finding: The G allele at rs11265809 extinguished GADD45G expression most rapidly in individuals homozygous for this allele along the dexamethasone response pseudotime, relating it to asthma and systemic lupus erythematosus.
title: Genetic control of the dynamic transcriptional response to immune stimuli and glucocorticoids at single cell resolution

finding: The SNP rs364477, associated with the gene DMRT1, exhibited a similar pattern where the ancestral allele was more prevalent in North West India and South West coastal populations in contrast to the Gangetic plain, suggesting significant admixture events related to these groups.
title: Genetic affinities and adaptation of the South West coast populations of India

finding: The minor C allele of the SNP rs7873784 was found to be associated with rheumatoid arthritis and type-2 diabetes mellitus. This SNP was demonstrated to bind the transcription factor PU.1 and enhance TLR4 expression, linking it to immune responses and potential inflammatory pathways relevant to these conditions.
title: Adversary of DNA integrity: a long non-coding RNA stimulates driver oncogenic chromosomal rearrangement in human thyroid cells

finding: This SNP, located on 9q31.3, was associated with left putamen connectivity, with a z-score of 7.35, indicating its importance in language-related brain circuitry.
title: Genetic architecture of the white matter connectome of the human brain

finding: At the 9q31 locus, rs10979182 showed long-range interactions with KLF4, supported by evidence that its expression could be upregulated through CRISPR activation, entrenching its significance in gene regulation linked to psoriasis.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: Regarded as the most likely regulatory SNP within enhancer 3, rs6477612 was shown to significantly increase KLF4 expression when activated in HaCaT cells, thereby substantiating its functional role in enhancer-promoter interactions.
title: Chromatin-based techniques map DNA interaction landscapes in psoriasis susceptibility loci and highlight KLF4 as a target gene in 9q31

finding: This SNP was reported in the context of a significant protein-protein interaction influencing body mass index, showing a previously known association between TNC and BMI.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: This SNP was annotated as a 3 prime UTR variant of the ABO locus and associated with red blood cell traits, playing a role in the genetic regulation of these traits.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: This SNP was also annotated as a 3 prime UTR variant in the ABO locus; it contributed to the known genetic variation affecting red blood cell counts.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: This SNP was annotated as an intron variant in the ABO locus, previously validated in meta-analysis for its association with red blood cell traits.
title: CoffeeProt: An online tool for correlation and functional enrichment of proteome-wide systems genetics

finding: The study indicated that sample PD4781 was heterozygous for the 46/1 haplotype at the rs12343867 locus. In contrast, sample c27 from the dominant JAK2-mutant clade became wildtype for the 46/1 haplotype due to 9pUPD, whereas sample d01 from the JAK2-mutant minor clade exhibited homozygosity for 46/1.
title: Phylogenetic reconstruction of myeloproliferative neoplasm reveals very early origins and lifelong evolution

finding: The SNP rs774358 was associated with the expression levels of the gene C9orf72 and DNAm of a nearby CpG site (cg01126010). The effect of the molQTL increased with the abundance of monocytes and neutrophils. This SNP was also identified as an NK cell imeQTL with a negative direction of effect, possibly due to the inverse relationship between neutrophil and NK cell proportions. The C9orf72 repeat expansion is noted as a genetic hallmark of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), indicating a possible link between this variant and ALS pathology.
title: Interaction molecular QTL mapping discovers cellular and environmental modifiers of genetic regulatory effects

finding: The SNP rs755109, located at chr9:100,696,202, was found to be associated with a cell-type-specific enhancer (chr9:100,695,253-100,696,742) and linked to the nearby cell-type-specific expressed gene HEMGN in K562 cells and adult CD34+ primary cells. Deletion of the E1 enhancer using CRISPR/Cas9 resulted in decreased expression of Hemgn in mouse MEL cells, but not in mouse embryonic stem cells, indicating its specific regulatory role in adult stages.
title: Enhancer-dependence of gene expression increases with developmental age

finding: The lead variant rs10117940 was found to have an effect on DENND1A expression in allele-specific analysis, contributing to PCOS phenotypes; it showed an interaction with other regulatory variants.
title: Gene regulatory activity associated with PCOS revealed DENND1A-dependent testosterone production

finding: The rs10114470 SNP was identified as a high-confidence fine-mapped variant associated with Crohn's disease (CD). It was located in the 3' UTR of the TL1A gene (TNFSF15), which is significantly involved in the activation of innate lymphoid cells type 3 (ILC3s) and plays a role in intestinal inflammation. This finding established a direct link between genetic variation in TL1A and its potential impact on ILC3 function and proliferation in the context of CD.
title: High-resolution promoter interaction analysis in Type 3 Innate Lymphoid Cells implicates Batten Disease gene CLN3 in Crohn’s Disease aetiology

finding: The minor C allele of rs7873784 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis and type-2 diabetes mellitus, binding PU.1 and enhancing TLR4 expression.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: The rs7044343 SNP was reported to be associated with decreased risk of developing coronary artery disease and central obesity, which implied its role in regulating IL-33 production, thus impacting immune responses including those against pulmonary infections.
title: IL-33 controls IL-22-dependent antibacterial defense by modulating the microbiota

finding: Homozygote carriage of the major allele rs56405676-T within the NTRK2 gene was significantly associated with greater hippocampal volumes. This finding was especially noteworthy in individuals older than 60, where it remained the only significant association with hippocampal volume after correction for false discovery rates.
title: Investigating neurotrophin genetics and hippocampal volume

finding: This SNP showed significant effects in the GenIE assay for both deletions and knock-in alleles, impacting gene expression in the C9orf84 locus, supporting its role as a regulatory variant.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: This SNP was linked with the GFI1B gene, showing a strong association with differential transcript usage, implicating it in splicing regulation.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: This variant regulated GFI1B expression impacting its roles in megakaryocyte function.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs55682638 in the SLC24A2 gene demonstrated a significant impact on GMD of the pallidum and putamen. High pain sensitivity participants exhibited lower GMD in these regions. Furthermore, mediation analysis indicated an indirect effect of this SNP on pain threshold via GMD measures.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic profiles influence on brain morphology and their interactions with pain sensitivity individual differences

finding: The intronic lead variant from the ABO locus with a p-value of 8.5×10^-14, causally associated with multiple disease endpoints including anemias.
title: An expanded analysis framework for multivariate GWAS connects inflammatory biomarkers to functional variants and disease

finding: The study by Xu et al. (2017) identified that the polymorphism of JAK2 rs56118985 served as a predictive marker for treatment responses in acute myeloid leukemia (AML) patients. This finding highlighted the significance of genetic variations in influencing chemotherapy efficacy, thereby aiding risk stratification and improving patient prognostics in AML.
title: Clinical Forecasting using Ex Vivo Drug Sensitivity Profiling of Acute Myeloid Leukemia

finding: The SNP rs13284520 was noted as being significant in association with nicotine dependence (ND) as an intronic SNP of DBH. Its established connection with smoking traits was extended further in this analysis.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: The rs2381416 SNP was associated with asthma, revealing an effect size of -0.11. This SNP was significant as it contributed to the polygenic hazard score (PHS) for asthma, where 14.2% of individuals in the top 1% of the PHS score developed asthma by age 20.5, compared to only 1.1% in the bottom 10%. Furthermore, rs2381416 had been previously linked to eosinophil count and severity of childhood asthma.
title: Fast Lasso method for Large-scale and Ultrahigh-dimensional Cox Model with applications to UK Biobank

finding: For SNP rs55695858, Borzoi demonstrated its role in splicing regulation by correctly predicting a weakening of an alternative 3' splice site, which led to upregulation of the corresponding exon. This finding highlighted the variant's significant impact on mRNA processing.
title: Predicting RNA-seq coverage from DNA sequence as a unifying model of gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs11145917 was found to be located near the INPP5E gene and was associated with two genes involved in the alpha interferon response. Although only two genes reached genome-wide significance, several other associated genes were close to the significance threshold, indicating potential effects on upstream signaling components. The INPP5E locus has been implicated in various autoimmune diseases and blood immune-cell composition phenotypes, suggesting its role may influence the baseline activity of the alpha interferon pathway, revealing a testable prediction with clinical implications.
title: DataRemix: a universal data transformation for optimal inference from gene expression datasets

finding: The study found that rs8176719 was a well-characterized frameshift indel that resulted in early termination in exon 6, acting as a major determinant of histo-blood group antigens. Individuals homozygous for the deletion were identified as blood group O, which was established to be protective against Crohn's Disease (CD). Furthermore, there was a trend towards higher ABO expression in CD tissue compared to non-IBD controls.
title: eQTL in diseased colon tissue identifies novel target genes associated with IBD

finding: The rs199476103 SNP, related to Cartilage Hair Hypoplasia (CHH), was another target in the editing pipeline. The introduction of this SNV into the editing procedure demonstrated a considerable capacity for efficiency in correcting T cells, aligning with the aim of restoring normal function in patients.
title: T cell correction pipeline for Inborn Errors of Immunity

finding: The rs61751937 SNP was identified as a novel missense variant in SVEP1 with a potential deleterious effect, highlighting its relevance in POAG pathology associated with lymphangiogenesis.
title: A large cross-ancestry meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies 69 novel risk loci for primary open-angle glaucoma and includes a genetic link with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs8176749 SNP was identified as a synonymous variant in ABO that had relevance in POAG; its specific role was discussed in terms of genetic correlation with POAG-related traits.
title: A large cross-ancestry meta-analysis of genome-wide association studies identifies 69 novel risk loci for primary open-angle glaucoma and includes a genetic link with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs11145917 was found to have a cis effect on the CARD9 gene and was associated with genes in the alpha interferon response, including potential implications for Crohn's disease and Ulcerative colitis. The analysis suggested that CARD9 might affect the baseline activity of the alpha interferon pathway.
title: DataRemix: a universal data transformation for optimal inference from gene expression datasets

finding: The SNP rs10821352 was reported to have a significant trans-eQTL effect with CYP2C8, marking it as the first replicated trans-eQTL in human brain data. This interaction was supported by a high p-value in the replication dataset, although the precise mechanistic relationship with CYP2C8 expression remains unclear.
title: DataRemix: a universal data transformation for optimal inference from gene expression datasets

finding: The SNP rs774358 was positively associated with the expression levels of the gene C9orf72 and showed effects on methylation of the nearby CpG site cg01126010. This effect was context-specific, increasing with the abundance of monocytes and neutrophils, indicating its role as a cell type-specific QTL. The C9orf72 repeat expansion is linked to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), highlighting the SNP's relevance to this disease.
title: Interaction molecular QTL mapping discovers cellular and environmental modifiers of genetic regulatory effects

finding: The T allele of the nonsense polymorphism (rs2039381, Gln71Stop) in the interferon-epsilon (IFNε) gene was identified as a risk factor for the development of intracerebral hemorrhage. This finding indicated the significance of the IFNε pathway in influencing immune responses and potentially contributing to disease susceptibility.
title: Constitutive expression and distinct properties of IFN-epsilon protect the female reproductive tract from Zika virus infection

finding: The SNP rs72743916 on chromosome 9 was the most statistically significant SNP within its associated locus. This SNP is located in an intron of the gene ERCC6L2, with previous studies suggesting that mutations in this gene are linked to bone marrow failure syndrome 2, indicative of developmental delays and learning difficulties, which may contextually relate to happiness.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Analysis of Happiness: Consistent Genetic Effects Across the Lifespan and Across Genetic Ancestries in Multiple Cohorts

finding: The genotype at the asthma-associated SNP rs1888909 was shown to be associated with IL33 gene expression in human airway epithelial cells and IL-33 protein expression in human plasma. This SNP was implicated in mediating allele-specific regulatory activity and IL33 expression, providing a novel mechanism by which it contributes to genetic risk for asthma.
title: Asthma-associated variants induce IL33 differential expression through a novel regulatory region

finding: This SNP, while not located within the primary regulatory region, was shown to be in high LD with rs1888909, and its genotype was associated with IL33 expression, albeit more modestly in African American populations.
title: Asthma-associated variants induce IL33 differential expression through a novel regulatory region

finding: This SNP was included in a credible set of SNPs and was associated with asthma risk as part of the study's Bayesian fine-mapping efforts, along with rs1888909.
title: Asthma-associated variants induce IL33 differential expression through a novel regulatory region

finding: The regulatory activity and enhancer blocking function in vitro for rs10975479 were demonstrated and linked to IL33 expression, supporting its involvement as an asthma risk variant.
title: Asthma-associated variants induce IL33 differential expression through a novel regulatory region

finding: The SNP rs28505901 was found to demonstrate significantly stronger chromatin interaction with the DNLZ promoter at the GPSM1 locus, correlating with evidence of regulation by chromatin dynamics in EndoC-βH1 cells.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: Identified as a driving missense mutation in SMC5, this SNP showed a significant gene-alcohol interaction on triglyceride levels, an association not previously reported for this locus.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: The common variant rs1333048 located in the 9p21 region was significantly associated with prevalent coronary heart disease (CHD) and increased risk of incident myocardial infarction (MI), suggesting its relevance in cardiovascular risk.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs4977574 in the 9p21 region showed significant associations with prevalent coronary heart disease (CHD) and incident myocardial infarction (MI), corroborating its importance in cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs10757278 within the 9p21 locus was significantly associated with incident myocardial infarction (MI), pointing towards its role in cardiovascular disease progression.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: The common variant rs1333049 in the 9p21 locus was significantly associated with incident myocardial infarction (MI), further underscoring the role of this region in cardiovascular risk.
title: Genetic loci associated with prevalent and incident myocardial infarction and coronary heart disease in the Cohorts for Heart and Aging Research in Genomic Epidemiology (CHARGE) Consortium

finding: This variant was found to have significant effects as a positive finding in the GenIE assays, implicating it in regulation of the C9orf84 gene.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The synonymous variant rs150813342 in the GFI1B gene was associated with ATU events that impacted the transcript usage of GFI1B.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: It influenced GFI1B expression, playing a key role in transcriptional regulation.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: This SNP was found to reduce chromatin accessibility and JAK2 expression, reinforcing its role as an effector gene linked to erythropoietin signaling and consequent RBC trait alterations.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The index SNP rs2236496 was shown to connect with JAK2, an essential gene influencing erythropoietin signaling pathways relevant to RBC traits.
title: An integrated platform to systematically identify causal variants and genes for polygenic human traits

finding: The SNP rs104894097, found in the CDKN2A gene, was also identified as significantly associated with distinguishing PCAND from T2DM, with a notable p-value of 0.001. This SNP was included in the combined models for clinical assessment distinguishing these two conditions.
title: Sorcin-STAT3-Serpin E1/CCL5 axis can be the trigger of pancreatic cancer-associated new-onset diabetes

finding: The SNP rs7040170 was associated with novelty seeking through mediation of the cortical surface area of the insula. The context of the finding relates to how individual differences in the insula's architecture may influence temperamental traits such as novelty seeking, which could be relevant to understanding the endophenotypes associated with anorexia nervosa.
title: Neuroanatomical correlates of temperament and cognitive function in women with and without anorexia nervosa

finding: The SNP rs10120520 was positively associated with the oncogenic activation of Nrf2, where a specific knockout of the full-length Nrf1 alpha was identified to act as a dominant tumor repressor. This finding highlighted the complex interplay between Nrf1 and Nrf2 in regulating tumor growth, with implications for enhancing the survival of patients with hepatocellular carcinoma.
title: TCF11 Has a Potent Tumor-Repressing Effect than Its Prototypic Nrf1α by Definition of both Similar yet Different Regulatory Profiles, with a Striking Disparity from Nrf2

finding: As a known cis variant associated with PDL2, rs62556120 was causally linked to increased risks of ulcerative colitis and inflammatory bowel disease.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs2230805 in the ABCA1 gene was identified as a common genetic variant that was associated with an increased risk of developing Alzheimer’s disease (AD). This finding was based on the role of ABCA1 in lipid metabolism and its impact on glial lipid droplet formation that is essential in protecting neurons from oxidative stress related toxicity.
title: Neuronal ROS-Induced Glial Lipid Droplet Formation is Altered by Loss of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated Genes

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs2230806 in the ABCA1 gene was also recognized as a common variant linked to Alzheimer's disease risk. Its association underscores the significance of ABCA1 in the neurobiological processes that involve lipid dysregulation and the neuronal response to oxidative stress, contributing to AD pathology.
title: Neuronal ROS-Induced Glial Lipid Droplet Formation is Altered by Loss of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated Genes

finding: It was identified as an independent lead variant associated with cardiometabolic diseases, specifically in type 2 diabetes, including coronary artery disease and chronic kidney disease. This variant resided within an intron of the REPS1 gene.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The SNP rs4297160 was identified as a trans-eVariant associated with both the genes MAPRE3 and ARFGEF3 in thyroid tissue, with p-values of 6.6 × 10<sup>-11</sup> and 2.2 × 10<sup>-16</sup>, respectively. This SNP is located within the lincRNA gene PTCSC2, which has been linked to a predisposition for papillary thyroid cancer. Association tests indicated that rs4297160 was a trans-eVariant for 34 different genes in thyroid, including HECW1, COL-GALT2, and FMO5, suggesting significant implications for thyroid gene regulation within the context of this locus at 9q22.
title: Telescoping bimodal latent Dirichlet allocation to identify expression QTLs across tissues

finding: The variant rs7030256, located in the PTCSC2 gene, was significantly associated with five different signature clusters in thyroid tissue (P < 6.62×10^-12). Histological assessment revealed an increase in colloid and enlarged follicles associated with the G allele, which suggested potential goiter development. This result was confirmed by whole-slide images at lower resolutions. Furthermore, changes in the expression levels of 128 genes were linked to this locus, indicating its relevance to thyroid physiology.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI-enabled Framework for Automated Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes in Histology Cohorts

finding: The finding related to the SNP rs7040902 was reported in the context of its association with the characteristics and roles of cancer-associated fibroblasts (CAFs) in tumor growth. This research highlighted the direct role of CAFs in promoting cancer invasion and their significance in driving vasculogenesis and angiogenesis when analyzed within a biomimetic 3D in vitro model of colorectal cancer.
title: Cancer Associated Fibroblasts Mediate Cancer Progression and Remodel the Tumouroid Stroma

finding: The T2D risk allele (T) at rs564398, located within ANRIL exon 2, was associated with higher ratios of circular to linear ANRIL abundance. This SNP indicated a significant correlation with circ/linANRIL levels, linking it to beta cell proliferation.
title: High-throughput analysis of ANRIL circRNA isoforms in human pancreatic islets

finding: The SNP rs7856850 was significantly associated with overall obsessive-compulsive (OC) traits measured by the Toronto Obsessive-Compulsive scale (TOCS), achieving genome-wide significance with a p-value of 2.48x10^-8.
