This finding indicated that rs7856850, located in an intron of the gene PTPRD, was the first replicated genome-wide significant variant for OC traits and shared genetic risk with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD). In a meta-analysis, this SNP was also associated with increased odds of being an OCD case (p=0.0069).
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pediatric Obsessive-Compulsive Traits: Shared Genetic Risk between Traits and Disorder

finding: The SNP rs2182089 in SH3GL2 demonstrated significant association with OC traits (p=1.9x10^-7) and was identified among SNPs linked to CNS gene development, suggesting its contribution to the genetic risks for OC traits.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pediatric Obsessive-Compulsive Traits: Shared Genetic Risk between Traits and Disorder

finding: In the context of CTSL expression, the rs2378757 variant was identified as a significant lung-specific eQTL variant that conferred highly variable expression levels. The genotype associated with this variant resulted in lower baseline expression of CTSL, which was hypothesized to correlate with a better response to SARS-CoV-2, potentially indicating a relationship between lower CTSL expression and reduced viral load.
title: “Amantadine disrupts lysosomal gene expression; potential therapy for COVID19”

finding: The rs114063116 variant was identified as significantly affecting the splicing ratios of CTSL transcripts, particularly in lung tissues. This finding indicated that the variant plays a role in the alternative splicing of the CTSL transcript, contributing to tissue-specific regulatory mechanisms and potentially impacting susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: “Amantadine disrupts lysosomal gene expression; potential therapy for COVID19”

finding: The SNP rs10810645 in the BNC2 gene was noted for its association with self-reported facial aging, further linking pigmentation with perceived aging.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: Identified as one of the independent significant SNPs associated with eye colour, located downstream of the TYRP1 gene, rs1326779 exhibited moderate effects on eye pigmentation.
title: Investigating the genetic architecture of eye colour in a Canadian cohort

finding: The SNP rs1927911 was associated with the rate of motor decline in Huntington's disease patients. This finding indicated that the TLR4 gene, related to immune and inflammatory responses, influences the progression of motor symptoms in HD.
title: Deletion of the microglial transmembrane immune signaling adaptor TYROBP ameliorates Huntington’s disease mouse phenotype

finding: The SNP rs10116253 correlates with the rate of motor decline in Huntington's disease, suggesting that variations in TLR4 may play a role in the progression of motor deficits associated with the disease.
title: Deletion of the microglial transmembrane immune signaling adaptor TYROBP ameliorates Huntington’s disease mouse phenotype

finding: The SNP rs532436 was found to be genome-wide significantly associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) levels (P=9.98×10^{-112}), total cholesterol (TC) (P=1.68×10^{-98}), and breast cancer risk (P=2.9×10^{-8}). This SNP resided within an intron of the ABO gene and was correlated with changes in gene expression of ABO across multiple tissues, indicating its potential role as a causal gene for these associations.
title: Assessing a causal relationship between circulating lipids and breast cancer risk: Mendelian randomization study

finding: Similar to rs532436, the SNP rs635634 was also associated with LDL levels (P=9.98×10^{-112}), total cholesterol (TC) (P=1.68×10^{-98}), and breast cancer risk (P=2.9×10^{-8}), lying within the same intron of the ABO gene. The high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs532436 (r^2=0.99) suggested both SNPs could influence the same genetic traits.
title: Assessing a causal relationship between circulating lipids and breast cancer risk: Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP, found near the AL162389.1 gene on 9q31.2, was involved in associations with acute myocardial infarction and related conditions.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: Located in the AKNA gene (9q32), this SNP had associations with HDL and total cholesterol.
title: A method to map and interpret pleiotropic loci using summary statistics of multiple traits

finding: The variant rs10993329 had a PPA of 31% and overlapped a snATAC-seq peak. It was predicted to affect transcription factor binding, specifically associated with the loss of motifs for ETS transcription factors, indicating it was functionally relevant in the context of pancreatic development and a more likely candidate for being causal for T2D.
title: Regulatory variants active in iPSC-derived pancreatic progenitor cells are associated with Type 2 Diabetes in adults

finding: The SNP rs532436 was associated with low-density lipoprotein (LDL) levels and total cholesterol (TC) with genome-wide significant p-values (P=9.98×10^-112 for LDL and P=1.68×10^-98 for TC). Additionally, it showed a significant association with breast cancer (P=2.9×10^-8). This finding suggested that rs532436 is located within an intron of the ABO gene, implicating it as a possible causal gene for these trait associations.
title: Assessing a causal relationship between circulating lipids and breast cancer risk via Mendelian randomization

finding: Similar to rs532436, the SNP rs635634 was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium (r²=0.99) and was also strongly associated with both LDL (P=9.98×10^-112) and TC (P=1.68×10^-98), alongside a significant correlation to breast cancer risk (P=2.9×10^-8). Like rs532436, it was located within the intron of the ABO gene, further supporting the potential causal link with lipid traits and breast cancer.
title: Assessing a causal relationship between circulating lipids and breast cancer risk via Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs12379440 was identified as a candidate associated with epilepsy after correcting the phenotype using the PheLEx framework. This candidate SNP was found in the gene OR2S2, which had not been previously linked to epilepsy. Its improved statistical significance was noted after correcting for potential misclassification of phenotypes, indicating its potential relevance to epilepsy.
title: Identifying novel associations in GWAS by hierarchical Bayesian latent variable detection of differentially misclassified phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs7853477 showed substantial improvement in statistical significance for bipolar disorder phenotype after applying the PheLEx correction. It was located within the gene RNF168, which has not been directly associated with bipolar disorder but is linked to other psychiatric conditions through its LD with SNPs in ATP13A4 and KCNH8, which have been associated with schizophrenia.
title: Identifying novel associations in GWAS by hierarchical Bayesian latent variable detection of differentially misclassified phenotypes

finding: The variant rs10757282 is another T2D-associated SNP that maps to beta cell cREs with diminished accessibility under higher BMI conditions (PIP=0.99), further highlighting its potential role in diabetes metabolism.
title: Single cell multiome profiling of pancreatic islets reveals physiological changes in cell type-specific regulation associated with diabetes risk

finding: The SNP rs143563851 was identified with a CADD deleteriousness score of 24.2. It was recently reported in 1% of individuals in a cohort of 211 Palestinians studied for blood group antigen synthase GBGT1, suggesting a potential ascertainment of population-specific health implications.
title: An integrated personal and population-based Egyptian genome reference

finding: The CARD9^G111E mutation was identified as a candidate germ-line activating mutation, associated with several comorbidities, including constipation and irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), although it lacked a direct disease phenotype.
title: “Franken-CARD9”: chimeric proteins for high-resolution studies of activating mutations in CARD10, CARD11 and CARD14

finding: The SNP rs1049430, located in the 3’-UTR of SH3GL2, was found to regulate its expression. This finding was significant as it had clinical and prognostic implications in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, highlighting its role in cancer biology.
title: Estimating allele-specific expression of SNVs from 10x Genomics Single-Cell RNA-Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs1563 was associated with the first comprehensive genome-scale metabolic reconstruction of maize metabolism, named iRS1563. This reconstruction, referred to in the context of multi-compartment models, illustrated significant advancements in the simulation of inter-organ interactions among maize organs such as root, stalk, kernel, and leaf. The findings indicated that this model, through its detailed organ-specific reactions, could better address the impacts of temperature stresses on maize productivity, particularly in light of global climate change.
title: Multi-organ Metabolic Model of Zea mays Connects Temperature Stress with Thermodynamics-Reducing Power-Energy Generation Axis

finding: The rs8176719 SNP, which involves a 261G deletion in exon 6 of the ABO gene encoding the O allele, was connected with double dose non-O genotypes resulting in a higher risk of severe malaria compared to single dose heterozygotes. It showed a significant odds ratio in relation to severe malaria in the Kenyan children studied.
title: Non-O ABO blood group genotypes differ in their associations with Plasmodium falciparum rosetting and severe malaria

finding: The rs8176746 SNP, which encodes C796A and distinguishes between A and B alleles, was implicated in the formation of larger P. falciparum rosettes with AA and AB host RBCs compared to OO phenotypes, ultimately supporting the hypothesis that non-O genotypes are linked with an increased risk of severe malaria due to the higher levels of A and/or B antigens.
title: Non-O ABO blood group genotypes differ in their associations with Plasmodium falciparum rosetting and severe malaria

finding: The SNP rs55682638 from the SLC24A2 gene revealed significant main effects on GMD related to pain sensitivity. Specifically, high pain sensitivity was associated with lower GMD in the pallidum and putamen. The mediation analysis indicated an indirect effect of this SNP on pain threshold, mediated by GMD (β = 0.03, p = 0.003).
title: Genomic and transcriptomic profiles influence on brain morphology and their interactions with pain sensitivity

finding: The SNP rs500102 was associated with variations in the promoter region of the RORB gene. In the study, it was highlighted that in the context of sn-m3C-seq data, chromatin interaction strength was enhanced specifically within the adult PFC L4-5 FOXP2 cell population in the RORB region. Additionally, a significant decrease in CG methylation signals was observed particularly in excitatory neurons of the PFC L4-5 FOXP2 cluster, supporting previous findings related to methylation patterns and gene expression in this cell type.
title: Empowering Integrative and Collaborative Exploration of Single-Cell and Spatial Multimodal Data with SGS

finding: The SNP rs7040902 was found to be significantly implicated in the heterogeneity of breast cancer tumor stromal components, demonstrating a clear relationship with tumor growth and therapeutic implications as identified in the tumor microenvironment.
title: XDec Simplex Map of Breast Cancer Cell States Enables Precise Modeling and Targeting of Breast Cancer

finding: The rs7870388 SNP at the PTPRD locus showed a significant association with disease progression pseudotime (p = 1.31 × 10^-6) in the ROS/MAP cohort. This locus was indicated to influence the susceptibility to neurofibrillary tangle independent of amyloid deposition.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: The SNP rs544873 was associated with multiple phenotypes, including pulmonary heart disease, phlebitis and thrombophlebitis, hemorrhoids, circulatory disease, and diverticulosis. This suggests potential pleiotropic effects.
title: NETMAGE: a humaN-disEase phenoType MAp GEnerator for the Visualization of PheWAS

finding: The SNP rs925488 was linked to various thyroid-related conditions such as thyroid cancer, nontoxic nodular and multinodular goiter, and hypothyroidism, indicating its role in affecting multiple phenotypes.
title: NETMAGE: a humaN-disEase phenoType MAp GEnerator for the Visualization of PheWAS

finding: The SNP rs13294100 was associated with Parkinson's disease, pointing toward functional variants that could regulate neurodegenerative processes.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This frameshift insertion variant, linked to blood group O, demonstrated a significant association with E-selectin levels, emphasizing the ABO locus's extensive pleiotropy related to various diseases and traits.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This rare variant was identified at the ABO locus associated with E-selectin, but it has no prior associations in the GWAS catalog, highlighting unique insights from this multi-ancestry study.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: This blood group A tagging variant was substantially associated with many other traits, maintaining significance through multiple conditional tests.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs7030860 was positively associated with the progression of Invasive Ductal Carcinoma (IDC) stages, indicating its potential role as a genomic factor in distinguishing between early and late stages of IDC. This finding was significant in the context of utilizing RNA-seq gene expression profiles from cancer patients, thereby illustrating its relevance in cancer prognosis and personalized treatment approaches.
title: Classification models for Invasive Ductal Carcinoma Progression, based on gene expression data-trained supervised machine learning

finding: The lead variant rs35093463 was located in the intron of the gene ABCA1, which is crucial for high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDLC) homeostasis. This variant showed a higher frequency in the Japanese population (MAF 36%) compared to Europeans (MAF 5%), contributing to the discovery of this locus in the study.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs112270518, located near DBH, was previously reported with smoking trajectory II and was confirmed as a significant locus for smoking cessation.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The variant rs6475604 was identified as a functional glaucoma risk variant located in a regulatory enhancer region at the 9p21.3 locus. The risk allele (C) disrupted the binding of the transcription factor YY1, which is known to repress the expression of the neighboring gene p16INK4A, linking the genetic variant to increased glaucoma risk and potential accelerated cellular senescence.
title: Identification and functional validation of an enhancer variant in the 9p21.3 locus associated with glaucoma risk and elevated expression of p16INK4a

finding: The rs17230081 SNP was identified as a potential regulatory site influencing the development of Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM). This finding was established through a combined analysis of Orm2 potential SNP sites alongside obesity-related SNP datasets. The connection to T2DM highlighted the importance of Orm2 and its regulatory SNPs in the context of metabolic diseases.
title: Treatment of non-alcoholic steatohepatitis with recombinant Orosomucoid 2, an acute phase protein that attenuates the Erk1/2-PPARγ-Cd36 signaling pathway

finding: The SNP rs1340513 in the JMJD2C gene was associated with autism spectrum disorders (ASDs) in a Finnish sample, indicating that alterations in this region might influence the development of these neuropsychiatric conditions.
title: Systematic analysis of brain lactate and pH levels in 65 animal models related to neuropsychiatric conditions

finding: The SNP rs10120473 was identified as a significant factor in influencing the immune response in cancer patients who smoke. In the context of the study, this SNP was linked to differential expression patterns in tumor-infiltrating immune cells (TIICs). The findings suggested that variations at this locus could contribute to the observed changes in immune cell populations, particularly in relation to survival outcomes among smokers. The relevance to multi-myoma cells was underscored by its association with natural killer cell activity as described in the work by Vulpis et al. (2018), thereby establishing a connection between genetic susceptibility and immune modulation in cancer.
title: Large scale analysis of smoking-induced changes in the tumor immune microenvironment

finding: The rs118203742 variant, which resulted in a glycine to serine change at position 1035 of the TSC1/hamartin protein (G1035S), was found to be significantly associated with progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) with a p-value of 0.031 and an Odds Ratio of 4.241, suggesting a meaningful contribution to tauopathy risk.
title: TSC1 loss-of-function increases risk for tauopathy by inducing tau acetylation and preventing autophagy-mediated tau clearance

finding: Part of a cluster linked to longitudinal cocaine use, this SNP showed strong association with a P-value ranging from 1.85 × 10^-7 to 1.93 × 10^-7.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: This SNP was included in the cluster associated with longitudinal cocaine use, contributing to a P-value between 1.85 × 10^-7 and 1.93 × 10^-7.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: Identified in the same cluster related to longitudinal cocaine use, it exhibited associated P-values of 1.85 × 10^-7 to 1.93 × 10^-7.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: Within the significant cluster, this SNP was associated with P-values from 1.85 × 10^-7 to 1.93 × 10^-7 regarding longitudinal cocaine use.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: Part of the cluster demonstrating association with longitudinal cocaine use, with P-values within the range of 1.85 × 10^-7 to 1.93 × 10^-7.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: The SNP rs2278973 in the gene CACNA1B, which encodes the N-type calcium channel Ca<sub>V</sub>2.2, was associated with schizophrenia and Parkinson's disease. This SNP was found to be non-synonymous only in the short exon47 C-terminal isoform, leading to three alternative amino acids—arginine (Arg), leucine (Leu), and histidine (His)—while remaining synonymous in the long exon47 variant of Ca<sub>V</sub>2.2.
title: The interplay between splicing of exons 18a and 47 differentially affects membrane targeting and function of human CaV2.2

finding: The rs3011158 SNP was associated with a positive finding indicating its role in increasing transcriptome diversity in ER-positive breast cancer, and its interaction with HSF1 was linked to the genomic action of ESR1.
title: Heat Shock Factor 1 (HSF1) as a new tethering factor for ESR1 supporting its action in breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs7026071 in the C9orf3 gene was found to be associated with the risk of atrial fibrillation and was linked to the risk of ALS with p=0.049, marking it as a positive and original finding regarding complex diseases.
title: The interplay between host genetics and the gut microbiome reveals common and distinct microbiome features for human complex diseases

finding: The analysis provided a predicted change in chromatin information associated with SNP rs2997560 specifically in pancreatic islets. This suggests that the SNP may affect chromatin accessibility and thereby influence gene expression in that tissue context.
title: Chromatin information content landscapes inform transcription factor and DNA interactions

finding: The SNP rs3764435 was associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) in a study specifically conducted on Mexican Mestizos. This finding highlighted the protective effects of this SNP against both the development of PD and associated cognitive impairment, helping to elucidate its potential role in modifying disease risk.
title: DOPAL initiates αSynuclein-mediated impaired proteostasis in neuronal projections leading to enhanced vulnerability in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs10759931, specifically the GG homozygous genotype, demonstrated a significant association with an increased risk for cognitive impairment following SARS-CoV-2 infection. This was evidenced in a cohort of 86 patients who had mild COVID-19, where the GG genotype was linked to a higher incidence of cognitive deficits post-infection, with a p-value of 0.0234 and an odds ratio of 1.91. The context was related to cognitive dysfunction mechanisms in post-COVID patients.
title: SARS-CoV-2 spike protein induces TLR-4-mediated long-term cognitive dysfunction recapitulating post-COVID syndrome

finding: The SNP rs7853758 was linked to the gene SLC28A3. It showed a negative correlation between its expression levels and cardiotoxicity, specifically following DOX and DNR treatments, indicating its potential role in mediating cardiotoxic effects.
title: Anthracycline-induced cardiotoxicity associates with a shared gene expression response signature to TOP2-inhibiting breast cancer drugs in cardiomyocytes

finding: Mutation rs138894217, which resulted in a change from hsa-miR-548ar-5p to hsa-miR-548au-5p by altering its secondary structure, was associated with heel bone mineral density and body mass index. Although the precise relevance to malignant conditions was not established, the alteration in secondary structure suggests potential implications for regulatory function.
title: Changes in miRNA secondary structure can predict mutations associated with cancer and other diseases

finding: Located in the TRIM14 promoter, rs7867966 influenced aCM score and expression of both TRIM14 and a neighboring gene, CORO2A, suggesting its role in local gene regulatory interactions.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The SNP rs4837016 was identified as significantly associated with obstructive sleep apnoea (OSA) in a genome-wide association study, with a p-value of 1.5 x 10^-8, marking it as a notable finding in the genetic loci linked to OSA risk.
title: Genetic analysis of obstructive sleep apnoea discovers a strong association with cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs1048638 in the 3'UTR of the carbonic anhydrase IX gene was associated with hepatocellular carcinoma, indicating its involvement in disease mechanisms related to cancer.
title: Synonymous SNPs of viral genes facilitate virus to escape host antiviral RNAi immunity

finding: The CARD9<sup>G111E</sup> mutation was identified as a rare natural variant causing strong spontaneous activation of CARD9, associated with conditions such as IBS, fibromyalgia, and arthritis.
title: Chimeric and mutant CARD9 constructs enable analyses of conserved and diverged auto-inhibition mechanisms in the CARD-CC protein family

finding: The CDKN2B-AS1 rs4977574 variant was associated with hypertension, which is a critical factor contributing to DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The CDKN2B-AS1 rs1333049 polymorphism showed an association with myocardial infarction in individuals with type 2 diabetes, which might implicate cardiovascular complications relevant to DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs753085 was associated with COL27A1, a fibrillar collagen gene reduced in VVs, suggesting its relevance for potential therapeutic strategies.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs78216177, located in DOCK8, was associated with varicose veins and implicated in the immune response, demonstrating potential links to inflammation in pathogenesis.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs10121905 was associated with findings that demonstrated urbanization impacts on vegetation phenology in China, notably linked to changes in the start of season (SOS) and length of season (LOS) due to increased urban intensity, providing a context for understanding similar patterns observed in European metropolitan areas.
title: The phenological response of European vegetation to urbanisation is mediated by macrobioclimatic factors

finding: The study identified that the SNP CORO2A rs1985859 was predictive of radiosensitivity to preoperative chemoradiotherapy in rectal cancer patients. This finding highlighted the genetic control aspect of CORO2A in cancer responses, emphasizing its potential role as a novel oncogene associated with worse patient outcomes.
title: Coro2a, An Expression Quantitative Trait Gene Underlying Estq1, Controls Uterine Responsiveness to Estradiol

finding: The SNP rs8176645 showed significant association with Bifidobacterium bifidum (p = 5.5x10^-15) indicating its involvement in gut microbiome modulation related to blood type antigens.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: The SNP rs550057 was significantly associated with Collinsella aerofaciens (p = 2.0x10^-8) and with the higher taxa of Collinsella, indicating its role in microbiome variation linked to the ABO locus.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: The variant rs507666 was associated with the metabolic pathway LACTOSECAT-PWY related to lactose and galactose degradation (p = 5.38x10^-15), underscoring a connection between the ABO gene and lactose metabolism.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: The rs391957 variant was associated with the risk of hepatocellular carcinoma by cis-regulating the expression of the oncogene GRP78, indicating its role in cancer susceptibility.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: The rs10739971 SNP showed interaction effects with PGC and ERCC6 gene polymorphisms in the context of gastric cancer and atrophic gastritis, which highlights its relevance in complex genetic interactions.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: The rs965513 SNP was implicated in thyroid cancer risk via multiple functional variants in long-range enhancer elements, indicating its significance in cancer genetics.
title: SNPector: SNP inspecting tool to detect disease existence and drug response in direct naked sequencing depends on mutation index

finding: The variant R95G (rs121909332) was demonstrated to be pathogenic and was found in individuals suffering from Inclusion Body Myopathy with Early-Onset Paget Disease with or without Frontotemporal Dementia 1. It was classified based on significant evidence linking it to these fatal diseases.
title: In-silico Study of the Uncertainly Significant VCP Variants reveal major Structural, Functional fluctuations leading to potential Disease-Based Associations

finding: The variant R191Q (rs121909334) was confirmed to be pathogenic, associated with multiple diseases such as Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis, Inclusion Body Myopathy with Early-Onset Paget Disease, and Frontotemporal Dementia 1. The association for this SNP was supported by strong evidence linking it to these serious conditions.
title: In-silico Study of the Uncertainly Significant VCP Variants reveal major Structural, Functional fluctuations leading to potential Disease-Based Associations

finding: The SNP rs7026071 located at the C9orf3 gene was implicated in atrial fibrillation and also associated with the risk of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) with a significance (p=0.049).
title: The interplay between host genetics and the gut microbiome reveals common and distinct microbiome features for human complex diseases

finding: rs687621 was found to be significantly associated with PUD and is located in high linkage disequilibrium with rs505922, another SNP linked with duodenal ulcer. This locus contributes to the understanding of genetic predisposition to PUD.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: This SNP was significantly associated with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and confirmed the prior association in UKB data, indicating its potential importance in the genetic landscape of IBS.
title: Genome-wide association study of gastrointestinal disorders reinforces the link between the digestive tract and the nervous system

finding: This SNP near TUSC1 gene showed a strong GxS interaction associated with BIP (p=2.29×10−7).
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The lead i-rQTL variant rs4498662 was associated with CARD9-208, which lacked the CARD domain. The AS risk allele decreased this isoform's ratio while increasing the main isoform, influencing susceptibility to ankylosing spondylitis and IBD.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: In strong linkage disequilibrium with rs4498662, this variant was correlated with a decrease in CARD9-208, revealing its role in regulatory changes affecting inflammatory disease pathways.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: The SNP rs10758593 was identified as the lead candidate causal variant in the CDC37L1-DT locus associated with fasting glucose and type 1 diabetes (T1D). It colocalized with a unique singleton eQTL for CDC37L1-DT, exhibiting a high posterior probability of 79.2% for FG and 91.2% for T1D, suggesting a key role of CDC37L1-DT during pancreas development.
title: eQTL mapping in fetal-like pancreatic progenitor cells reveals early developmental insights into diabetes risk

finding: The variant rs7870658, located in an intron of REPS1, was associated with cardiometabolic diseases in type 2 diabetes, particularly coronary artery disease and chronic kidney disease.
title: Insulin and Exercise-induced Phosphoproteomics of Human Skeletal Muscle Identify REPS1 as a New Regulator of Muscle Glucose Uptake

finding: The SNP rs72758878 was found to be independently associated with altered mean platelet volume, linking it to the functional role of LRRC8A in regulating platelet volume and activation. The association highlighted its relevance in platelet physiology and potential implications in thrombosis.
title: LRRC8 complexes are adenosine nucleotide release channels regulating platelet activation and arterial thrombosis

finding: This SNP was linked to trans-actions of E-selectin and insulin receptor levels, highlighting its pleiotropic effects across multiple pathways.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs8176741 was associated with trans-regulatory effects on diverse proteins and had associations with transcription factor binding, indicating complex regulatory roles.
title: A large-scale multivariate pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The SNP rs10120474 was found to be associated with the emerging role of TYRO3 as a therapeutic target in cancer, as described in the publication by Smart et al. in 2018. This association indicated that variations at rs10120474 could influence the effectiveness of treatments targeting the TYRO3 receptor, highlighting its significance in oncogenic signaling pathways.
title: Novel substrate prediction for the TAM family of RTKs using phosphoproteomics and structure-based modeling

finding: The intronic PD-L1 variant rs822339 was reported to be associated with overall survival across various cancer types, including lung adenocarcinoma (LUAD), kidney chromophobe cancer (KICH), and thyroid cancer (THCA). This indicated its role in cancer prognostication.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The PSMD11 variant rs28459155 was associated with lower odds of being an immunotherapy responder but increased expression levels of the gene, suggesting its role in modulating response to cancer treatments.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The SNP rs10738607 was part of a well-replicated coronary artery disease (CAD) risk locus located approximately 80kb upstream of the CDKN2B gene. This variant was found within a region under strong selection with a Z score of 4.48, indicating a pronounced level of constraint. The risk allele was predicted to disrupt a binding site for STAT5A, a transcriptional activator of CDKN2B, which negatively regulates cell proliferation, contributing to the genotype-phenotype association for 9p21 risk alleles.
title: A genome-wide mutational constraint map quantified from variation in 76,156 human genomes

finding: The SNP rs2808772 was identified near the COL27A1 gene with a P value of 1.49 × 10<sup>−8</sup>. While it did not replicate in the second stage of testing, the findings suggested its potential role in knee pain, possibly through its association with COL27A1, which has established links to cartilage formation and knee osteoarthritis.
title: A genome-wide association study identifies that the GDF5 and COL27A1 genes are associated with knee pain in UK Biobank (N = 171, 516)

finding: The SNP rs12341335, located near TUSC1 on chromosome 9, displayed a significant GxS interaction (p=2.29×10^-7), suggesting its involvement in bipolar disorder.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The rs10217259 SNV was associated with psoriasis and influenced KLF4 expression by enhancing JUN binding, resulting in increased transcriptional activity, suggesting its role in abnormal epidermal differentiation.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: The SNP rs10962612, which tagged the region chr9:16,720,122–16,804,167, was associated with an introgressed Neanderthal haplotype present at approximately 70% frequency in Europeans. This haplotype contributed to an increased risk for sun sensitivity, linking it to skin pigmentation and sunburn risk.
title: Quantifying the contribution of Neanderthal introgression to the heritability of complex traits

finding: The SNP rs62543578 tagged the region chr9:16,891,561–16,915,874 and was strongly associated with an increased incidence of childhood sunburn and poor tanning. This association reflects the influence of Neanderthal ancestry on skin-related phenotypes in modern Europeans.
title: Quantifying the contribution of Neanderthal introgression to the heritability of complex traits

finding: The SNP rs495828, located in the ABO locus, was found to be associated with traits spanning 7 different trait domains. This significant pleiotropy indicated that the SNP impacts a wide array of physiological processes and traits, demonstrating its importance in the genetic architecture underlying various traits. The finding contributed to the understanding of shared genetic influences across multiple domains.
title: PolarMorphism enables discovery of shared genetic variants across multiple traits from GWAS summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs10120520 was associated with the oncogenic activation of Nrf2, where it was found that the knockout of the full-length Nrf1 alpha allele, which is a dominant tumor repressor, contributed significantly to this activation. This finding highlighted the intricate relationship and regulatory roles of Nrf1 and Nrf2 in tumor suppression and cancer biology, particularly in the context of hepatocellular carcinoma.
title: TCF11 Has a Potent Tumor-Repressing Effect than Its Prototypic Nrf1α by Definition of both Similar yet Different Regulatory Profiles, with a Striking Disparity from Nrf2

finding: The PTPRD rs560380 polymorphism was found to be significantly associated with neurofibrillary tangle accumulation in Alzheimer's disease, presenting a powerful association (p = 3.8x10^-8) which informed the genetic link between PTPRD and AD dementia risk, although the specific molecular mechanisms remain unclear.
title: PTPRS is a novel marker for early tau pathology and synaptic integrity in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: rs1755609 exhibited a significant association with urinary glycine levels (P = 3.3 × 10^-10, N = 5447). This intronic variant is found within the glycine decarboxylase (GLDC) gene, crucial for glycine metabolism. Its association highlights the genetic influence on glycine levels and associated metabolic disorders.
title: Meta-Analysis of Urinary Metabolite GWAS Studies Identifies Three Novel Genome-Wide Significant Loci

finding: At locus 9q34.2, rs657152 was found to be a significant genetic susceptibility locus in COVID-19 patients. This locus contributed to the understanding of host genetic factors impacting the severity and outcomes of SARS-CoV-2 infection.
title: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus-2 genome sequence variations relate to morbidity and mortality in Coronavirus Disease-19

finding: The SNP rs35568725, also the missense variant (Ser251Pro) in the PLIN2 gene, was similarly associated with elevated risk of NASH, with an odds ratio of 2.74 when analyzed under a dominant inheritance model. This SNP was shown to contribute to an altered phenotype in hepatocytes, provoking changes such as smaller, more numerous lipid droplets under steatogenic conditions, indicating its involvement in the hepatocyte lipid metabolism associated with NASH.
title: A single nucleotide polymorphism of PLIN2 is associated with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis and causes phenotypic changes in hepatocyte lipid droplets

finding: The SNP rs1049430 was identified as a regulatory variant located in the 3'-UTR of the SH3GL2 gene, which influenced the expression of this gene. This finding had clinical and prognostic implications specifically in the context of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
title: scReQTL: an approach to correlate SNVs to gene expression from individual scRNA-seq datasets

finding: The study identified rs500102 as a putative causal variant for schizophrenia that overlapped with a loop-connected differentially methylated region (DMR) in layer 4-5 excitatory neurons. The variant exhibited a posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.27 and had been detected as a fine-mapped expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for the RORB gene in brain tissue. The research highlighted that this genomic region was connected to the RORB promoter through a cell-type-specific loop domain, suggesting that alterations in chromatin conformation and DNA methylation around rs500102 may influence schizophrenia risk.
title: Epigenomic and chromosomal architectural reconfiguration in developing human frontal cortex and hippocampus

finding: LOCUS identified rs2519093 as a variant trans-acting on E-selectin (LYAM2), Insulin Receptor (INSR), and CD209 protein levels. It was situated in the ABO locus, known for associations with coronary artery diseases, type 2 diabetes, and lipid levels. This SNP also demonstrated functional significance as a cis-acting eQTL for genes including ABO, indicating its role in complex gene regulation.
title: A fully joint Bayesian quantitative trait locus mapping of human protein abundance in plasma

finding: LOCUS revealed rs8176741 as a variant trans-acting on the Tyrosine-protein kinase receptor (Tie-1), Cadherin-5 (CADH5), and CD209 proteins. Situated in the ABO locus, it is acknowledged for relationships with cardiovascular diseases and metabolic traits. This SNP has been reported as a cis-acting eQTL for multiple genes, affirming its potential regulatory influence.
title: A fully joint Bayesian quantitative trait locus mapping of human protein abundance in plasma

finding: This variant located within the intron of REPS1 was associated with cardiometabolic diseases such as coronary artery disease and chronic kidney disease in type 2 diabetes.
title: Phosphoproteomic Analysis Identifies REPS1 as an Insulin- and Exercise-Responsive Signal Transducer to Glucose Uptake in Skeletal Muscle

finding: The SNP rs657152 was identified at locus 9q34.2 in a genome-wide association study concerning COVID-19, where it was noted for its potential involvement with the ABO blood-group system, indicating its significance in the genetic profile related to the disease.
title: The discovery of a recombinant SARS2-like CoV strain provides insights into SARS and COVID-19 pandemics

finding: The SNP rs7875199 located near MTAP was associated with the abundance of naevi and melanoma incidence. Notably, this target site was found to have been lost in non-African populations, leading to speculation that such loss might correlate with higher expression levels of MTAP in these populations and potentially contribute to increased skin cancer risk, reflecting variation with geographical latitude.
title: The impact of population variation in the analysis of microRNA target sites

finding: Similar to rs7875199, rs7868374, also associated with MTAP, was linked to the abundance of naevi and melanoma. The loss of this target site was highlighted in non-African populations, suggesting a potential relationship with the elevated expression of the gene, potentially tied to skin cancer incidence, again reflecting regional variations influenced by latitude.
title: The impact of population variation in the analysis of microRNA target sites

finding: This SNP was described as an intronic variant in the ZNF462 gene, which encodes a zinc-finger transcription factor essential for embryonic neurodevelopment, and was chosen as a credible causal SNP for cerebellar volume.
title: Genome-wide association study of cerebellar volume

finding: The intronic SNP rs72754248 in the PAPPA gene exhibited the strongest association with cerebellar volume in the GWAS and was connected to the regulation of IGF1 availability.
title: Genome-wide association study of cerebellar volume

finding: SNP rs143563851 was identified with a CADD deleteriousness score of 24.2, indicating a likely molecular impact. It was previously noted as being present in 1% of a cohort of 211 Palestinians during targeted sequencing of the blood group antigen synthase GBGT1.
title: An integrated personal and population-based Egyptian genome reference

finding: The finding showed that rs10758593 (chr9:4292083:G>A) was the lead candidate causal variant for the eQTL associated with fasting glucose levels and type 1 diabetes, implicating it in pancreatic beta cell development.
title: Disease-associated regulatory variation often displays plasticity or temporal-specificity in fetal pancreas

finding: The SNP rs1563 was identified in relation to the comprehensive genome-scale metabolic reconstruction of maize metabolism. The study highlighted that the maize root's metabolism significantly affects its growth and development under nitrogen-stress conditions, indicating a positive finding regarding its regulatory role in root biomass growth.
title: Dissecting the Metabolic Reprogramming of Maize Root under Nitrogen Limiting Stress Condition

finding: The dark allele at rs7870409 near RALGPS1 was similarly associated with a decrease in frequency that could not be solely attributed to ancestral changes, suggesting potential selective dynamics.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: Evidence indicated that rs2153271 near BNC2 exhibited changes in allele frequencies consistent with ancestry changes, rather than selection.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: The TYRP1 locus around rs1325132 supported the hypothesis of selection with strong evidence noted from the hunter-gatherer lineage.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs7870388 at the PTPRD locus exhibited the most significant association with pseudotime in the ROS/MAP cohort, demonstrating a p-value of 1.31 x 10^-6. This locus was linked to susceptibility for neurofibrillary tangles independent of amyloid deposition.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: rs1172922 was linked with the SYK gene at a CTCF binding site, indicating its involvement in regulatory mechanisms impacting Alzheimer's disease.
title: A Network-based Deep Learning Framework Catalyzes GWAS and Multi-Omics Findings to Biology and Drug Repurposing for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This variant was consistently detected with high confidence by the fine-mapping methods FINEMAP, SuSiE-inf, and FINEMAP-inf. It replicated previous findings using a luciferase assay as orthogonal evidence for variant causality, specifically relating to the trait Plt.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: Similar to rs12005199, this variant was also detected with high confidence by FINEMAP, SuSiE-inf, and FINEMAP-inf. It replicated earlier findings where a luciferase assay provided orthogonal evidence for variant causality associated with the trait Plt.
title: Improving fine-mapping by modeling infinitesimal effects

finding: The SNP rs7040890 was associated with prostate cancer stem-like cells, which play a crucial role in the development of castration-resistant prostate cancer. This finding emphasized the importance of stem-like cells in the disease's progression and therapeutic resistance.
title: Identification of a Micropeptide Linked to Cancer Stem Cell Regulation and Chemoresistance

finding: Associations for rs8176645 at the <italic>ABO</italic> locus linked to <italic>B. bifidum</italic> (p = 5.5×10<sup>-15</sup>) and were replicated with consistent allelic effects.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: The SNP rs550057 showed significant associations with the genus <italic>Collinsella</italic> (p = 2.0×10<sup>-8</sup>) and with the metabolic pathway for lactose and galactose degradation, indicating a strong link between the <italic>ABO</italic> locus and microbial metabolism.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: This SNP was linked to the metabolic pathway <italic>LACTOSECAT-PWY</italic> (p = 5.38×10<sup>-15</sup>), demonstrating associations in bacterial pathways related to lactose metabolism.
title: Effect of host genetics on the gut microbiome in 7,738 participants of the Dutch Microbiome Project

finding: The SNP rs10809485 was the index SNP for the most significant region on chromosome 9p23, with a p-value of 1.6×10−12. It was associated with Lifetime Anxiety Disorder, indicating a substantial role in the genetic architecture of anxiety disorders.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The SNP rs1187280 was identified as the index SNP on chromosome 9q21.33, located in the intron of the Neurotrophic Receptor Tyrosine Kinase 2 (NTRK2) gene. It exhibited a p-value of 5.2×10−8 and showed a consistent direction of effect across analyses involving Lifetime Anxiety Disorder, Neuroticism, and Major Depressive Disorder (MDD), indicating its significance in the context of psychiatric traits.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The SNP rs10959883 was part of a locus that replicated formally in both Neuroticism and MDD samples, showing significant association with Lifetime Anxiety Disorder and was noted for having the same direction of effect across all samples analyzed.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The SNP rs10959577 was associated with both Lifetime Anxiety Disorder and Current Anxiety Symptoms, indicating strong overlap in genetic factors affecting anxiety symptoms in different populations with a reported linkage.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The SNP rs11515172, located at Chr 9:11Mb, was identified as significant in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) for Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) overall, with a p-value of 3.82x10<sup>-8</sup>. This association persisted with logistic regression analysis yielding a p-value of 4.69x10<sup>-8</sup> and an odds ratio of 0.96. The locus had previously been associated with depression and neuroticism in studies utilizing UK Biobank data, indicating its relevance in understanding the genetic basis of MDD.
title: Genome-wide gene-environment analyses of major depressive disorder and reported lifetime traumatic experiences in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs7870388 located at the PTPRD locus was identified as significantly associated with pseudotime in the disease progression of late-onset Alzheimer's disease (LOAD) in the ROS/MAP cohort, with a p-value of 1.31 × 10<sup>−6</sup>. This locus was noted to be associated with susceptibility to neurofibrillary tangles independent of amyloid deposition.
title: Molecular estimation of neurodegeneration pseudotime in older brains

finding: Moderate evidence for selection was observed at rs2153271 linked to BNC2, which is associated with freckling. This SNP showed signals of selection but was less pronounced compared to others.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The variant rs7030256 in the PTCSC2 gene was significantly associated with thyroid histological changes (P<6.62×10−12). It correlated with increased colloid and enlarged follicles indicative of goiter development, and showed associations with 128 gene expression levels, including regulators of thyroid hormone secretion.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI Framework for Automated and Interpretable Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes

finding: This SNP was replicated in the meta-analysis, showing protective effects against SSNS in both Sri Lankan and European cohorts, confirming its role as a genetic marker in SSNS.
title: Common risk variants in AHI1 are associated with childhood steroid-sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: The missense variant CREB3<sup>R119G</sup> (rs11538707) conferred a 40% reduction in the risk of developing ALS and was associated with a slower progression rate of ALS patients, extending disease duration by approximately 12 months.
title: CREB3 gain of function variants protect against ALS

finding: Caused a L536P mutation in FANCC and linked to apoptosis and DNA repair.
title: Predicting functionally important breast cancer SNPs using pleiotropy, conservation, and protein structure

finding: This variant was causally associated with increased risk of ulcerative colitis and inflammatory bowel disease, while also influencing height when considering both cis and trans analyses.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs3011285 was found to be associated with cancer genetic dependencies and was specifically linked to sensitivity to zinc-induced cytotoxicity. The context of this finding relates to its implication in the regulation of Glutathione Reductase (GSR), which plays a crucial role in cell death mechanisms, particularly in GSR-dependent lung cancers.
title: A comprehensive landscape of the zinc-regulated human proteome

finding: The variant rs8176671 showed a strong <italic>trans</italic> association with the CDH5 protein level (MAF = 0.19, P = 8.83 × 10^-40).
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The deletion variant rs8176643 was associated with the SELE protein level (MAF = 0.18, P = 7.98 × 10^-36), being an intronic variant at the 9q34.2 locus.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The ABO variant rs12216891 was associated with the CTRC protein level (MAF = 0.19, P = 8.39 × 10^-30).
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The intronic variant rs507666 had the most associations per lead pQTL variant, with 332 significant associations, mostly with blood cell traits.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: Located in DBH, this SNP has been previously implicated in nicotine dependence, contributing to the understanding of the genetic factors underpinning smoking behaviors.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs8176719 colocalized specifically in T effector memory cells shortly after anti-CD3/CD28 stimulation, linking it with both severity and susceptibility to COVID-19. This highlights the importance of cell-type-specific signals in understanding genetic susceptibility to SARS-CoV-2.
title: Widespread gene-environment interactions shape the immune response to SARS-CoV-2 infection in hospitalized COVID-19 patients

finding: The SNP rs10985080 was located at chr9:120,896,106-120,897,428 within the TRAF1 haplotype and functioned as an intergenic enhancer. It was identified as expression-altering in unstimulated K562 cells, with a significant reduction in PHF19 gene expression when its enhancer was targeted using CRISPRi.
title: A Systematic Strategy for Identifying Causal Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms and Their Target Genes on Juvenile Arthritis Risk Haplotypes

finding: The T allele of rs2737273 was shown to be associated with decreased BMD and increased TPM2 isoforms containing exon 6. Alternatively, the C allele was associated with increased BMD and increased expression of isoforms containing exon 7. This variant highlighted the complexity of interpreting the direction of effects due to multiple correlated splicing events, especially in the context of brain and testis tissues.
title: Long-read proteogenomics to connect disease-associated sQTLs to the protein isoform effectors of disease

finding: The SNP rs3215700 was linked to increased expression of TPM2 isoforms containing exon 6 and was associated with lower levels of BMD. This finding further established the splicing axis between PTBP1 and TPM2, where higher levels of PTBP1 including exon 9 was correlated with higher levels of TPM2 containing exon 6, thus contributing to the regulation of BMD.
title: Long-read proteogenomics to connect disease-associated sQTLs to the protein isoform effectors of disease

finding: The SNP rs35199210, which results in an amino acid change from Asp to Glu at position 238, was identified in the gene UNC13B. It segregated with Alzheimer disease (AD) in a family with 6 affected individuals. The CADD score for this variant was greater than 22, indicating a high likelihood of being deleterious.
title: Linkage Analysis in Caribbean Hispanic Families with Puerto Rican Ancestry Idenitfies an Alzheimer Disease Locus on chromosome 9

finding: The SNP rs41276043, leading to a Phe to Leu change at position 1096 in the UNC13B gene, was also identified among the high priority variants. It had a CADD score exceeding 22 and was predicted to be highly deleterious by Polyphen. Both SNPs were linked to Alzheimer's disease through segregation patterns in multiple affected families.
title: Linkage Analysis in Caribbean Hispanic Families with Puerto Rican Ancestry Idenitfies an Alzheimer Disease Locus on chromosome 9

finding: The V727M mutation, associated with the SNP rs121908627, was characterized in GNE myopathy patients. It was predicted to be largely pathogenic; however, it displayed moderate hyposialylation in the mutant cell lines. Since V727M occurs in a compound heterozygous state, its individual effect on GNE myopathy was determined to be less severe despite its prevalent distribution.
title: Efficient GNE myopathy disease modeling with mutation specific phenotypes in human pluripotent stem cells by base editors

finding: The SNP rs7864322 was identified as a trans-eQTL associated with hypothyroidism, where it controlled the expression of the nearby PTCSC2 lncRNA and was implicated in the thyroid hormone signaling pathway.
title: Reverse regression increases power for detecting trans-eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs4297160 was associated with hypothyroidism and influenced the expression of the FOXE1 gene, also affecting the DIO1 gene in chr1, which is crucial for T3 production, thereby indicating its role in thyroid hormone action.
title: Reverse regression increases power for detecting trans-eQTLs

finding: The SNP rs10983975 was linked to hypothyroidism and contributed to the regulation of the PTCSC2 lncRNA and FOXE1 gene, suggesting its involvement in pathways relating to thyroid development and hormone signaling.
title: Reverse regression increases power for detecting trans-eQTLs

finding: The rs621940 variant was associated with MPN risk, located near GFI1B, a gene known to influence HSC quiescence and self-renewal.
title: Genetic predisposition to myeloproliferative neoplasms implicates hematopoietic stem cell biology

finding: The SNP rs2183745 was strongly associated with alkaline phosphatase (ALP) level, with a P-value of 2×10^-133. A 684-bp deletion located in an intergenic region of chromosome 9 (chr9:101,457,417-101,458,101) was found to be in almost perfect linkage disequilibrium (LD) with this SNP, indicating a potential functional contribution of the deletion to the phenotype.
title: Structural variation across 138,134 samples in the TOPMed consortium

finding: The variant rs4543592 was involved in the positive causal association of lifetime smoking with waist-hip ratio (WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub>). This suggests a genetic relationship influencing abdominal fat distribution due to smoking behaviors.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The risk SNP rs1933683, located near the gene BARX1, showed a significantly higher incidence in the esophageal atresia (EA) and infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis (IHPS) cohort with an odds ratio of 3.29 and a p-value of 0.009, indicating its substantial association with IHPS in patients with EA.
title: Models for infantile hypertrophic pyloric stenosis development in patients with esophageal atresia

finding: The SNP rs1412832 within CDKN2B-AS1/ANRIL presented a genome-wide significant association with higher risk of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
title: Explainable models using transcription factor binding and epigenome patterns at promoters reveal disease-associated genes and their regulators in the context of cell-types

finding: The SNP rs7040890 was associated with the development of castration-resistant prostate cancer (CRPC). This finding was corroborated by the study conducted by Ojo et al. (2015) which indicated that prostate cancer stem-like cells contribute to the progression of CRPC, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in the context of tumor pathology and response to treatment.
title: The soluble guanylyl cyclase pathway is inhibited to evade androgen deprivation-induced senescence and enable progression to castration resistance

finding: The rs2453555 variant was located within intron 3 of the <italic>C9orf72</italic> gene and was included as a key risk variant in the pathways contributing to ALS.
title: Genetic analysis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis identifies contributing pathways and cell types

finding: The rs7849703 variant was used in place of rs12973192 in the analysis as an important SNP relating to <italic>UNC13A</italic> and its contribution to ALS pathways.
title: Genetic analysis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis identifies contributing pathways and cell types

finding: Evidence linked rs2479106 to increased susceptibility to Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) in Caucasian patients, confirming its role in the genetic architecture of the disorder.
title: Unique genetic features of the naked mole-rat’s THADA gene

finding: The SNP rs11536889 was specifically targeted by miR-1236, which showed preferential binding to the G allele over the C allele located in the 3' UTR of the Toll-like receptor 4 gene. This finding indicated a significant role of miR-1236 in regulating allelic expression in human cells.
title: An alternative miRISC targeting a coding mutation site in FOXL2 links to granulosa cell tumor

finding: The rs129891 variant was demonstrated to have a significant association with smoking status, where participants with more copies of the minor allele "A" exhibited a higher likelihood of being current smokers (p=0.045). Additionally, this allele was associated with significantly lower white matter integrity as measured by fractional anisotropy (FA) in the corpus callosum regions (GCC: p=1.75×10⁻²; BCC: p=4.97×10⁻²; SCC: p=3.15×10⁻²). The findings revealed that the genetic effects related to this SNP mediated smoking status through reduction in WM integrity, indicating a connection between its genetics and neurodegeneration as well as smoking-induced diseases.
title: White matter integrity and nicotine dependence in smokers: evaluating vertical and horizontal pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs1461780285, located in the ABO blood group, was associated with the microbial module MF0007, which involves lactose and galactose degradation. The finding was supported by a discovery p-value of 2.10 × 10⁻¹² and a replication p-value of 1.09 × 10⁻¹⁰.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses support causal relationships between blood metabolites and the gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs507666 was found in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1461780285 within the ABO gene region. It was associated with serum alkaline phosphatase levels, corroborating findings from this study and previous research.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses support causal relationships between blood metabolites and the gut microbiome

finding: Similar to rs507666, the SNP rs532436 also resided in strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1461780285. It contributed to associations with alkaline phosphatase levels in both the current and earlier studies.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses support causal relationships between blood metabolites and the gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs651007, located in the ABO gene block, was associated with metabolite levels, particularly serum alkaline phosphatase, in line with findings from this study as well as previous literature.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses support causal relationships between blood metabolites and the gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs579459 demonstrated strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1461780285 and was implicated in the associations pertaining to alkaline phosphatase levels, consistent with past studies.
title: Mendelian randomization analyses support causal relationships between blood metabolites and the gut microbiome

finding: The SNP rs182096718 in the Anp32B gene led to a D130A substitution that reduced the efficacy of FluPol activity compared to wildtype ANP32B. This variant had a dominant negative effect, disrupting FluPol’s interaction with ANP32A and leading to diminished influenza virus replication. It was present at a higher frequency in the Hispanic/Latino cohort, indicating potential genetic protection against influenza.
title: A rare variant in ANP32B impairs influenza virus replication in human cells

finding: The intron variant rs7030256 in the PTCSC2 gene was found to be significantly associated with histological changes in thyroid tissue (P < 6.62×10-12). It was linked to increased colloid and enlarged follicles, indicative of potential goiter development, thus relating the SNP to thyroid health and associated disease mechanisms.
title: HistoGWAS: An AI Framework for Automated and Interpretable Genetic Analysis of Tissue Phenotypes

finding: The variant rs77375493 (V617F) was identified as a gain of function variant associated with myeloproliferative neoplasms. This finding was established through kernel-based tests, which showed that six out of seven biomarker associations for JAK2 were only identified by these tests.
title: Identifying interpretable gene-biomarker associations with functionally informed kernel-based tests in 190,000 exomes

finding: The variant rs182096718 was found to result in the D130A substitution in ANP32B, which exhibited reduced support for influenza virus polymerase activity compared to the wildtype ANP32B. This variant had a global minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.0044, being prevalent in 3.41% of individuals of Hispanic / Latino ethnicity. The study suggested that carriers of this variant may have genetic protection against influenza viruses.
title: A rare variant in Anp32B impairs influenza virus replication in human cells

finding: The variant rs77375493 (9:5073770:G:T, V617F) was linked to significant associations with biomarkers for lipid metabolism (negative associations with Apolipoprotein A, HDL cholesterol, cholesterol, LDL direct), kidney function (positive association with Cystatin C), and diabetes (negative association with HbA1c). It is known for its prognostic significance in myeloproliferative neoplasms.
title: Identifying interpretable gene-biomarker associations with functionally informed kernel-based tests in 190,000 exomes

finding: This intronic variant was associated with lower levels of various glucosylceramide species, indicating its regulatory potential in lipid metabolism and its functional implications based on strong annotations.
title: Leveraging a founder population to identify novel rare-population genetic determinants of lipidome

finding: The SNP rs10120514 was positively associated with the study of racial disparity and triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) in African-American women, as discussed in the context of various biological factors that contribute to the aggressiveness of TNBC, potentially linking to the treatment efficacy of agents like MsDef1 in these populations.
title: Medicago Sativa Defensin 1 (MsDef1), A Natural Tumor Targeted Sensitizer for Improving Chemotherapy: Translation from Anti-Fungal Agent to Potential Anti-Cancer Agent

finding: The SNP rs28592848 was linked to significant eQTL signals associated with the PTGDS gene, which was identified as the top hit for its strong association with Type 2 Diabetes (T2D). Additionally, PTGDS expression was nominally associated with BMI and HbA1c, highlighting its relevance in diabetes risk.
title: Islet Gene View - a tool to facilitate islet research

finding: Similarly, the SNP rs28375538 was part of the genome-wide significant eQTL signal for the PTGDS gene, reinforcing its connection to T2D risk while also correlating with related phenotypic factors like BMI and HbA1c.
title: Islet Gene View - a tool to facilitate islet research

finding: The SNP rs1575972 was found to be significantly associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) with a P-value of 4.7×10−13. It was noted that an NRS located 158 kb upstream of DMRTA1, flanking this SNP, was in strong linkage disequilibrium (r² > 0.8) with several other SNPs significantly associated with diabetes mentioned in GWAS, thereby suggesting functional implications in the context of diabetes susceptibility.
title: Graph pangenome reveals functional, evolutionary, and phenotypic significance of human nonreference sequences

finding: The SNP rs2378757 was identified as a very significant and lung-specific variant that conferred highly variable expression of the CTSL gene. The genotype associated with this SNP was found to confer lower baseline expression of CTSL, which was likely associated with a better response to SARS-CoV-2 infection, suggesting a potential protective effect against higher viral loads.
title: “Amantadine disrupts lysosomal gene expression; potential therapy for COVID19”

finding: The SNP rs114063116 was observed as a splice QTL variant affecting splicing ratios of CTSL transcripts, specifically significant in lung tissues. This finding indicates that this splice variant could influence the regulation of CTSL expression in the lungs, potentially impacting the natural diversity in baseline expression and viral fitness during SARS-CoV-2 cell entry.
title: “Amantadine disrupts lysosomal gene expression; potential therapy for COVID19”

finding: The SNP rs7859844 on chromosome 9 was found to be a genome-wide significant association with recurrent miscarriage. This SNP had a MAF of 6.4% and a P-value of 1.3×10^-8. It was implicated in controlling extravillous trophoblast motility and showed chromatin interaction with the gene TLE1, a known repressor in the WNT signaling pathway.
title: The genetic architecture of sporadic and recurrent miscarriage

finding: The SNP rs9408928 was identified as an eQTL specifically in astrocytes, associated with the expression of the gene NDUFA8, which has been previously linked to Alzheimer's disease and Parkinson's disease. This connection highlights its potential relevance in neurodegenerative disease mechanisms.
title: Minimum entropy framework identifies a novel class of genomic functional elements and reveals regulatory mechanisms at human disease loci

finding: The SNP rs532436 was associated with low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL) levels, total cholesterol (TC), and breast cancer risk, with a significant P-value of 2.9 × 10^-8. This SNP lies within an intron of the ABO gene, suggesting that ABO could be a causal gene for the observed associations.
title: Assessing a causal relationship between circulating lipids and breast cancer risk: Mendelian randomization study

finding: Similar to rs532436, the SNP rs635634 also exhibited a significant association with LDL, TC, and breast cancer risk, indicating that it may serve as a genetic marker linked to the increase in breast cancer risk mediated by lipid levels. It was identified in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with rs532436, underscoring its relevance.
title: Assessing a causal relationship between circulating lipids and breast cancer risk: Mendelian randomization study

finding: The association with CTCF binding and decreased contact at the PCK2 promoter underscores its role in regulatory processes, showing a significant relationship with gene expression across diverse studies.
title: Shared and distinct molecular effects of regulatory genetic variants provide insight into mechanisms of distal enhancer-promoter communication

finding: The SNP rs657152 was detected at locus 9q34.2 in the Severe COVID-19 GWAS Group's analysis, linking it with higher severity of COVID-19 symptoms.
title: Human genetic variants associated with COVID-19 severity are enriched in immune and epithelium regulatory networks

finding: The CARD9 G111E mutation was identified as a rare activating variant associated with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), constipation, fibromyalgia, and psychological issues, suggesting its pathogenic potential.
title: Chimeric and mutant CARD9 constructs enable analyses of conserved and diverged autoinhibition mechanisms in the CARD-CC protein family

finding: Linked to respiratory failure risk in COVID-19 patients, this SNP was associated with higher levels of coagulation factor VIII and von Willebrand factor, indicating maladaptive hypercoagulation responses.
title: Genetic architecture of host proteins interacting with SARS-CoV-2

finding: rs534035399 was associated with the strength of the 1-day circadian periodicity with a p-value of 1.8×10^-9, found at LINC01508, which is an RNA gene.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: rs554696049 was found significant for the strength of the 1-day circadian periodicity with a p-value of 4.8×10^-8, located at LINC01501, an RNA gene not previously associated with this trait.
title: Automated Feature Extraction from Population Wearable Device Data Identified Novel Loci Associated with Sleep and Circadian Rhythms

finding: The SNP rs6478109, located in the TNFSF15 gene, was associated with increased susceptibility to Crohn's disease, as established by a meta-analysis. However, it was noted that this SNP did not have a significant association with ulcerative colitis.
title: Speos: An ensemble graph representation learning framework to predict core genes for complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs10781499 within the CARD9 gene was associated with impaired microbial production of AhR ligands in patients with Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD). This finding indicated that the SNP's effects on metabolism were relevant not only to the genetic susceptibility to IBD but also to how the microbiota functioned in relation to immune responses.
title: Dissecting the respective roles of microbiota and host genetics in the susceptibility of Card9-/- mice to colitis

finding: It had a high Hexp of 0.5030, making it a potentially effective marker for genetic diversity studies.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: It produced a moderate Hexp and was effective for assessing genetic diversity.
title: The forensic landscape and the population genetic analyses of Hainan Li based on massively parallel sequencing DNA profiling

finding: The rs146597587 SNP showed a significant association with asthma, with a p-value of 7.1×10−7 when identified through hospital records and 2.4×10−14 through verbal questionnaire responses. This finding suggested that the protein truncating variant in the IL33 gene was implicated in asthma pathogenesis.
title: Assessing digital phenotyping to enhance genetic studies of human diseases

finding: The SNP was identified as a non-coding transcript exon variant in GPR21, contributing to the association with height despite lacking prior recognition in UK Biobank studies.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The rs1059273 variant in TRIM14 was noted for its significant eQTL effects in immune cells, indicating its role in antiviral responses. It was identified within a region under positive selection in East Asian populations.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: The eSNP rs10453229 exhibited significant chromatin looping to the eGene LPAR1, which codes for the lysophosphatidic acid receptor, providing a mechanistic link for its role in OA as previously evidenced in collagen-induced arthritis models.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The risk allele for rs1321917 showed an association with increased expression of PAPPA, indicating a regulatory function tied to OA risk in both PBS and FN-f treated cells.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: Identified as an eQTL for PAPPA, this variant supported its increased expression in OA due to both PBS and FN-f treatments.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: This eQTL was linked to PAPPA as well, retaking similar regulatory mechanisms identified previously.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The SNP rs11507683 was significantly associated with anxiety, phobic, and dissociative disorders (p=8.74×10−6) in the PheWAS assessment, located near EXD3.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The rs10817103C>T SNP, located in the enhancer region of the LPAR1 gene, was found to be significantly associated with a decreased risk of anxiety. In univariate analyses, patients carrying the T allele exhibited a 40% lower risk of anxiety compared to those carrying the CC genotype, with an odds ratio of 0.61 and a p-value of 0.005. This SNP was also correlated with decreased expression of LPA1 and was active in neurons, supporting the findings that LPA16:0-LPA1 signaling is involved in anxiety.
title: Platelet-derived LPA16:0 inhibits adult neurogenesis and stress resilience in anxiety disorder

finding: The genetic association between the protein truncating variant rs146597587 located in the IL33 gene and asthma was established, with a p-value of 7.1×10^-7 when cases were defined using hospital records and a significantly stronger association with a p-value of 2.4×10^-14 when cases were defined using questionnaire responses. This indicated that the questionnaire responses provided better power for detecting associations.
title: Assessing digital phenotyping to enhance genetic studies of human diseases

finding: In the study by Regad (2015), it was found that rs7030860 was significantly associated with variations in RTK signaling pathways in cancer. The SNP influenced the response of RTKs, particularly in relation to how they interacted with GPCRs, which is relevant for understanding cancer progression and treatment responses. This highlighted its role in mediating cellular signaling affecting synaptic plasticity, as evidenced by the interplay of TrkB and mGluR5.
title: Synaptic plasticity via receptor tyrosine kinase/G protein-coupled receptor crosstalk

finding: The SNP rs76158822 was part of the linkage disequilibrium noted between another pair of InDels, indicating its involvement in genetic interactions.
