title: Genomic history and forensic characteristics of Sherpa highlanders on the Tibetan Plateau inferred from high-resolution genome-wide InDels and SNPs

finding: The SNP rs7030781, located within the VLDLR locus, demonstrated a meta-P-value of 3.78 × 10^-13. This association was consistent with its previously known effects on the cytokine network.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The lead variant rs550057 at the ABO locus was found to have a meta-P-value of 2.75 × 10^-8. This SNP was significant in the context of blood group determination and was shown to associate with various inflammatory protein levels.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: Identified in moderate linkage disequilibrium with the lead cytokine-associated variant at the ABO locus, it was recognized for determining ABO blood group and its association with inflammatory proteins.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: Similar to rs507666, this SNP was also implicated in determining the ABO blood type, linking it to cytokine and immune function regulations.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of a cytokine network reveals variants with widespread immune, haematological and cardiometabolic pleiotropy

finding: The SNP rs10114470 was located in the 3' UTR of the TL1A gene, a TNF family cytokine involved in ILC3 activation. It was identified as a high-confidence fine-mapped variant associated with Crohn's disease (CD), showing a SuSIE posterior inclusion probability of 0.56. This finding indicated a link between genetic variation in TL1A and immune-mediated inflammatory processes, emphasizing its potential role as a drug target in inflammatory bowel disease.
title: High-resolution promoter interaction analysis in Type 3 Innate Lymphoid Cells implicates Batten Disease gene CLN3 in Crohn’s Disease aetiology

finding: The CDKN2B-AS1 rs1333049 G/C variant was reported to impact coronary heart disease risk, presenting evidence of its significance in cardiovascular genetics.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The rs4977574 SNP located in the CDKN2B-AS1 gene was associated with hypertension in a population study, suggesting its potential role in blood pressure regulation.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The rs2383207 polymorphism of CDKN2B-AS was linked to susceptibility to atherosclerosis, supporting its role in cardiovascular disease development.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The SNP rs62556120 was identified with a causal association with increased risk of ulcerative colitis and inflammatory bowel disease, holding a very low p-value of 2.92x10^-51.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs10453229 was associated with eGene LPAR1 via a chromatin loop spanning 400 Kb, linking it to the regulation of lysophosphatidic acid signaling which is critical in OA pathogenesis.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The lead GWAS variant rs1321917 was associated with increased expression of PAPPA in response to FN-f treatment, showing colocalization with the Total Hip Replacement GWAS signal.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: The eQTL signal for rs1885244 indicated consistent effects on PAPPA expression in both treatment conditions, underscoring its role in OA.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: Located as an eQTL for PAPPA, rs10983265 showed significant expression changes linked to FN-f treatment.
title: Response eQTLs, chromatin accessibility, and 3D chromatin structure in chondrocytes provide mechanistic insight into osteoarthritis risk

finding: It correlated with immature reticulocyte fraction, displaying maternal effects and contributing further evidence of its role in blood cell phenotypes.
title: Parent-of-origin effects in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP represented the mutations Y89H and Y89D, affecting a predicted tyrosine-based motif in GALAC1. These mutations were linked to Classical Galactosemia and demonstrated a significant reduction in protein activity which suggested that they were part of a functional motif.
title: MotSASi: Functional Short Linear Motifs (SLiMs) prediction based on genomic single nucleotide variants and structural data

finding: The SNP rs9409226 was part of the FDA5 PRS, showing significant predictive performance for weight gain in young children. It was upstream of genes associated with BMI and birth weight, such as FBXW2 and PHF19, respectively.
title: Polygenic risk score based on weight gain trajectories is predictive of childhood obesity

finding: The rs10811661 polymorphism located upstream of the CDKN2A/2B gene showed a significant association with gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) in women, highlighting its potential role in the genetic risk factors for GDM.
title: Genome-Wide Polygenic Risk Scores and Prediction of Gestational Diabetes in South Asian Women

finding: Identified in association with Parkinson's disease, suggesting its involvement in age-related decline.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP was initially linked to AGT activity, which is crucial for determining blood group A1. The study findings indicated that AGT activity was significantly lower in venous thrombosis (VT) patients compared to controls, suggesting a potential role of this SNP in blood coagulation processes.
title: ABO blood group, glycosyltransferase activity and risk of Venous Thrombosis

finding: This SNP was associated with BGT activity, relevant to individuals with blood group B. The study demonstrated a moderate correlation between BGT activity and VWF/FVIII plasma levels in B blood group carriers, thus supporting a genetic basis for variations in these plasma factors.
title: ABO blood group, glycosyltransferase activity and risk of Venous Thrombosis

finding: As part of the A2 blood group definition, this SNP is crucial for AGT functionality. In the context of the study, A2 blood group was characterized by a significant reduction in AGT activity, which was found to be markedly lower in VT cases when compared to controls.
title: ABO blood group, glycosyltransferase activity and risk of Venous Thrombosis

finding: This SNP defined the blood group O and resulted in an inactive enzyme. The study provided insights into how individuals with this genotype expressed only the H antigen, thereby potentially influencing their risk for VT given the observed differences in plasma levels of FVIII and VWF.
title: ABO blood group, glycosyltransferase activity and risk of Venous Thrombosis

finding: The variant rs765246726 (p.Cys2107Arg) in ABCA1 was linked to a mean reduction in HDL-C of 0.64 mmol/l, showing its critical involvement in cholesterol metabolism.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The variant rs77273740 (p.Arg65Trp) in DBH was associated with a mean decrease of 1 mmHg in diastolic blood pressure, relating it to cardiovascular risk profiles.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The minor C allele of the SNP rs7873784 was associated with rheumatoid arthritis and Type 2 diabetes mellitus; it was suggested to bind PU.1 and enhance TLR4 expression, linking it to autoimmune and metabolic diseases.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: An updated meta-analysis found a significant association between rs2230806 in ABCA1 and coronary artery disease, reinforcing its potential as a genetic risk factor.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in coronary artery disease and related complications using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs10120520 was associated with the oncogenic activation of Nrf2 following the knockout of full-length Nrf1 alpha. This knockout allowed Nrf2's role as a master antioxidant transcription factor to be liberated, while Nrf1 alpha acted as a dominant tumor repressor. The finding emphasized the complex interplay between these transcription factors in relation to tumor growth and survival in hepatocellular carcinoma.
title: A potent tumour-suppressor TCF11, than its prototypic Nrf1α, is defined by similar yet different regulatory profiles of both isoforms, with a striking disparity from Nrf2

finding: The SNP rs382940, located within the intron of <italic>SLC44A1</italic>, was linked to reaching Hoehn and Yahr stage 3 or higher faster (HR 2.04 [1.58, 2.62], P-value = 3.46E-8). This finding highlighted a significant connection between this variant and Parkinson's disease progression.
title: Genome-wide association study of Parkinson’s disease progression biomarkers in 12 longitudinal patients’ cohorts

finding: The variant rs111245230 was associated with elevated SVEP1 serum levels in patients with coronary heart disease (CHD) and type-2 diabetes (T2D), illustrating its role in these diseases and associated traits.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The SNP rs7040882 was identified as having a role in the function of TRPM8 ion channels, which were linked to the adverse effects of menthol on human bronchial epithelium. The study suggested that TRPM8 activation by menthol led to increased calcium influx and subsequent mitochondrial reactive oxygen species generation, highlighting a mechanistic pathway related to respiratory diseases. This was relevant to the observed changes in bronchial epithelial responses to menthol exposure.
title: Menthol in Electronic Cigarettes: A Contributor to Respiratory Disease?

finding: The variant rs4742170, associated with the IL33 gene, was identified as a Neanderthal-derived variant that was linked to asthma and childhood wheezing. It was documented that the T allele of rs4742170 disrupts glucocorticoid receptor binding to a putative IL33 enhancer, increasing IL33 enhancer activity, which is critical in the development of asthma phenotypes.
title: A Neanderthal Origin of Genetic Variants Associated with Asthma

finding: The rs7861875 SNP (T>C) was identified as a heterozygous site in HEK293 cells, influencing gRNA binding to the ATXN10 gene. The HiFi sequencing revealed that the alternative C allele had a higher binding affinity than the T allele due to fewer mismatches with the gRNA sequence. Specifically, 95% of the reads corresponded to the C allele, indicating preferential binding. The findings suggested that individuals homozygous for the T allele might be largely unaffected by potential off-target binding associated with the ATXN10 gRNA.
title: Amplification-free long read sequencing reveals unforeseen CRISPR-Cas9 off-target activity

finding: The SNP rs4837613 was found to be replicated in the elderly cohort's ALM analyses, contributing to the identification of genetic factors that affect muscle mass.
title: Genome-wide associations reveal human-mouse genetic convergence and modifiers of myogenesis, CPNE1 and STC2

finding: The SNP rs10757668, located in the exon 2 splice acceptor, played a critical role in determining the proportion of transcripts from the wild-type and mutant alleles in patient-derived neurons. Analysis revealed that more than 90% of exon 1A-containing transcripts were derived from the mutant allele in unedited patient lines. This imbalance was corrected following the excision of the repeat expansion, indicating that some mutant 1A-transcripts could undergo normal splicing. The findings suggested that the excess activity of exon 1A in the diseased state was primarily attributed to the mutant allele, implicating transcriptional upregulation of the mutation as a potential biological driver of frontotemporal dementia (FTD) and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). Overall, this SNP served as a crucial marker for evaluating allele-specific expression in the context of CRISPR editing.
title: Two therapeutic CRISPR/Cas9 gene editing approaches revert FTD/ALS cellular pathology caused by a C9orf72 repeat expansion mutation in patient derived cells

finding: rs507666, part of the ABO gene linkage block, was associated with metabolites levels, particularly serum alkaline phosphatase, corroborated with previous studies.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: Similar to rs507666, rs532436 in the ABO gene block showed associations with metabolite levels, reaffirming earlier research findings.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: This SNP, also within the ABO gene linkage, had previous associations with metabolite levels, particularly for alkaline phosphatase, validated in this study.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: Found in strong linkage disequilibrium with the ABO gene, rs579459 was shown to be associated with metabolite levels, particularly serum alkaline phosphatase, consistent with earlier findings.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: This SNP associated with Streptococcus mutans was replicated in this study, affirming findings from previous research.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: rs1570247 was reported to disrupt the binding of transcriptional repressor ZNF263, which was correlated with increased expression levels of the GBA2 gene. It was specifically noted as a causal SNP linked to type 2 diabetes, providing insights into the relationship between genetic variation, gene expression, and disease phenotype.
title: Quantitative assessment of association between noncoding variants and transcription factor binding

finding: Found to be associated with risk of ER-positive/PR-positive tumors (P=3.70×10⁻²).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: Significantly associated with risk of ER-positive disease (P=2.18×10⁻⁵).
title: Common breast cancer risk loci predispose to distinct tumor subtypes

finding: The SNP rs965513 was identified as having multiple functional variants in long-range enhancer elements that contributed to the risk of developing thyroid cancer.
title: Predicting the effects of SNPs on transcription factor binding affinity

finding: The SNP rs1340513, located in the JMJD2C gene, was found to be associated with autism spectrum disorders (ASDs) in a Finnish sample, indicating a significant genetic contribution to the etiology of ASDs.
title: Systematic analysis of brain lactate and pH levels in 65 animal models related to neuropsychiatric conditions

finding: The SNP rs10120520 was associated with the oncogenic activation of Nrf2 following the knockout of Nrf1alpha, which acts as a dominant tumor suppressor. This relationship highlighted how the aberration of Nrf1 led to altered expression of various critical genes involved in cancer progression, indicating that this SNP was part of a significant genetic context relating to tumor repression and Wnt-beta-catenin signaling pathways.
title: Nrf1 is endowed with a dominant tumor-repressing effect onto the Wnt/β-Catenin-dependent and -independent signaling networks in the human liver cancer

finding: The findings related to rs958804 included its association with pain-related phenotypes in patients undergoing surgical procedures.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers associated with endometriosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: rs8176719, related to the O blood group, was confirmed to have the greatest protective effect in African populations against severe malaria. Its evidence for association was substantial, revealing heterogeneity in effect across populations.
title: New insights into malaria susceptibility from the genomes of 17,000 individuals from Africa, Asia, and Oceania

finding: The SNP rs1888909 was associated with IL-33 expression as it resides within 5kb of the IL-33 gene and overlaps with an OCT-1 (POU2F1) binding site. This finding indicated its relevance in asthma-related IL-33 modulation.
title: Tumor suppressor p53 deficiency increases tumor immunogenicity through promoting IL33-mediated anti-tumor immune responses

finding: This SNP was identified as a high-confidence loss of function splice acceptor variant located within the gene IL33, which had previously been implicated in asthma. The effect size for this variant in the UK Biobank was reported to be three times greater than that of the lead colocalized variant (rs3939286).
title: Diverse transcriptomic signatures across human tissues identify functional rare genetic variation

finding: This low-frequency missense variant in SVEP1 was linked to coronary heart disease (CHD) and type 2 diabetes (T2D), with the risk allele associated with increased levels of SVEP1.
title: Coding and regulatory variants affect serum protein levels and common disease

finding: The SNP rs10759931 was associated with an increased risk of developing cognitive impairment in mild COVID-19-recovered patients. Individuals with the GG homozygous genotype of the TLR4-2604G>A variant demonstrated a significant association with cognitive deficits following SARS-CoV-2 infection, with a p-value of 0.0234 and an odds ratio of 1.91. Conversely, the GA genotype was associated with a decreased risk (p-value 0.0209; OR 0.50). This finding highlighted the impact of TLR4 variants on cognitive outcomes in the post-COVID context.
title: SARS-CoV-2 spike protein induces long-term TLR4-mediated synapse and cognitive loss recapitulating Post-COVID syndrome

finding: The SNP rs958804 was found to be positively associated with pain-related phenotypes in patients undergoing laparoscopic colectomy and mandibular sagittal split ramus osteotomy. This finding related to the neurobiological aspects of opioid dependence, which involves alterations in the regulatory networks of genes like ASTN2.
title: Convergence of case-specific epigenetic alterations identify a confluence of genetic vulnerabilities tied to opioid dependence

finding: The SNP rs7858836 also displayed a positive association with pain-related phenotypes in similar patient populations. This further emphasized the role of the ASTN2 gene in relation to opioid use disorder risk and contributed to understanding the genetic underpinnings of opioid dependence.
title: Convergence of case-specific epigenetic alterations identify a confluence of genetic vulnerabilities tied to opioid dependence

finding: The SNP was identified as newly FDR significant through Flexible cFDR, leveraging functional genomic data.
title: Leveraging auxiliary data from arbitrary distributions to boost GWAS discovery with Flexible cFDR

finding: Located upstream of CEL, rs541856133 had a minor allele frequency (MAF) of 0.0015 and was associated with increased risk of T1D (OR=2.97). The CEL gene has been linked to MODY8 and pancreatic exocrine dysfunction.
title: Large-scale genetic association and single cell accessible chromatin mapping defines cell type-specific mechanisms of type 1 diabetes risk

finding: The rs61751937 variant in the SVEP1 gene was identified as a significant determinant of ADP-induced platelet aggregation. The specific nonsynonymous change (Gly229Arg) altered a highly conserved residue in the protein's VWFa domain, which was associated with increased platelet reactivity.
title: Genome Sequencing Unveils a New Regulatory Landscape of Platelet Reactivity

finding: The rs8187929 mutation on the ALDH1A1 gene was associated with human drinking behaviors, particularly in the Japanese population. It exhibited an allele frequency of 4.56% in East Asians and was noted to disrupt the protein-protein interaction between ALDH1A1 and ALDH2. However, it had a more limited impact on enzymatic activities involved in ethanol metabolism compared to the mutation rs671.
title: The Extent of Edgetic Perturbations in the Human Interactome Caused by Population-Specific Mutations

finding: Located in ROR2's 3'-UTR, this SNP was linked to facial traits and served as a model for human craniofacial anomalies.
title: Novel genetic loci affecting facial shape variation in humans

finding: The SNP rs56405676, found in the NTRK2 gene, was significantly associated with greater hippocampal volumes, specifically in individuals older than 60, where carriage of the major allele (T) was linked to increased volumes compared to those possessing one or two copies of the minor allele (C).
title: Investigating neurotrophin genetics and hippocampal volume

finding: The SNP rs4977575 was associated with allele-specific signal quantification in the context of enhancer interactions, which implicates its role in dynamic gene control mechanisms. The finding was established via ATAC-dPCR methods utilizing a Taqman array for precise measurement of allelic variations.
title: Tri-4C: efficient identification of cis-regulatory loops at hundred base pair resolution

finding: Associated with cognitive function, this SNP also correlated with increased participation odds in MHQ.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The rs2519093 variant had significant associations with concentrations of sE-selectin and sICAM-1 levels, independent of ABO blood type, indicating its role in the regulation of these soluble adhesion molecules.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The rs8176746 variant showed association with sVCAM-1 concentration, and the association was independent of the A1 subtype, suggesting a distinct mechanism for sVCAM-1 from those affecting sE-selectin and sICAM-1.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies seven novel loci associating with circulating cytokines and cell adhesion molecules in Finns

finding: The low-frequency missense variant rs111245230 in SVEP1 was associated with serum levels of SVEP1 and linked to coronary heart disease (CHD), blood pressure, and type-2 diabetes (T2D), where its risk allele was associated with elevated serum SVEP1.
title: Coding and regulatory variants affect serum protein levels and common disease

finding: The analysis demonstrated that the SNP variant rs12337802 was associated with the splicing of the elncRNA RP11-112J3 and impacted the expression level of its target gene GBA2. Specifically, the distribution of splicing index for RP11-112J3 and the expression of GBA2 varied across different alleles of rs12337802, indicating a significant relationship between the SNP and both the splicing of the elncRNA and the expression of its target.
title: The activity of human enhancers is modulated by the splicing of their associated lncRNAs

finding: This SNP was associated with voltage-gated ion channels in cancer cell proliferation, particularly in breast cancer cells, indicating a link between the genetic variation and the altered bioelectrical properties observed.
title: High-frequency extracellular spiking in electrically-active cancer cells

finding: The SNP rs3793577 located on chromosome 9p21 was found to be significant (p=4.68E-10) and was associated with the ELAVL2 gene. This gene, which encodes a neural-specific RNA-binding protein, has been previously reported in major depressive disorder studies, further supporting a link between sociability and psychiatric conditions.
title: Genetic underpinnings of sociability in the UK Biobank

finding: The association between rs7856187 and the family Lachnospiraceae was replicated in the study. This finding contributed to the understanding of how genetic variance may affect gut microbiome composition at the family level.
title: A Comprehensive Assessment of Demographic, Environmental and Host Genetic Associations with Gut Microbiome Diversity in Healthy Individuals

finding: The SNP rs4297160 was identified as a significant trans-eVariant associated with multiple genes in thyroid tissue, demonstrating a p-value as low as 2.2 × 10^−16 for its association with ARFGEF3 and 6.6 × 10^−11 for MAPRE3. It was located within the lincRNA gene PTCSC2, which is associated with a predisposition for papillary thyroid cancer. Furthermore, without the inclusion of PEER factors as covariates, rs4297160 was found to be a trans-eVariant for 34 different genes in thyroid, indicating its importance in gene regulation within the 9q22 locus, which is linked to thyroid-specific transcription factors.
title: Telescoping bimodal latent Dirichlet allocation to identify expression QTLs across tissues

finding: Erfined as pathogenic, rs121909332 (R95G) was implicated in diseases such as Inclusion Body Myopathy with Early-Onset Paget Disease and Frontotemporal Dementia 1. It demonstrated significant effects on protein structure and was categorized under the pathogenic-possibly pathogenic category.
title: In silico Study of the Uncertainly Significant VCP Variants reveal major Structural, Functional fluctuations leading to potential Disease-Based Associations

finding: Associated with several diseases, including Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis and Inclusion Body Myopathy with Early-Onset Paget Disease, rs121909334 (R191Q) was classified as pathogenic. It exhibited severe impacts on the VCP protein structure and was also correlated with multiple neurodegenerative diseases.
title: In silico Study of the Uncertainly Significant VCP Variants reveal major Structural, Functional fluctuations leading to potential Disease-Based Associations

finding: The intronic mutation in RABL6 (chr9:139731607:A:G) was reported as a shared mutation between LUAD components of patients 31 and 35, as well as the SCLC components of the same two patients. This finding indicated a rare overlap of mutations across different histologic subtypes, suggesting some genetic similarities despite differing cancer histologies.
title: The histologic phenotype of lung cancers may be driven by transcriptomic features rather than genomic characteristics

finding: This SNP was associated with the genetic dependency for IFNE. It was one of the two SNPs identified that explained different genetic dependencies related to ancestry, suggesting a potential link between this germline variant and ancestry-associated dependencies in cancer.
title: Germline variation contributes to false negatives in CRISPR-based experiments with varying burden across ancestries

finding: This SNP was associated with two genetic dependencies: IFNA6 and IFNA14. Like the previous SNP, it highlighted the relationship between genetic dependencies and ancestry, supporting the idea that specific variants may influence dependency dynamics.
title: Germline variation contributes to false negatives in CRISPR-based experiments with varying burden across ancestries
